text:
Triple zonder veel smaak en bittere afdronk. Zeker niet mijn smaak, niet meer nemen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at brussels. Hazy yellow colour small white head. Nose is ... tripel... taste is low bitterness, low sweetness. Noce bitter aftertaste, fast finish.
Bottle - clear golden color with steady white head. taste is banan, peach, coriander, spices. body is full. few boozy notes in the finish. strong beer :D

Ar: Banana and white peach; black pepper, star anise, and fruity coriander; sweet cracker maltiness. Ap: Deep gold and hazy; large off-white head with excellent retention, leaving a picture-perfect cap of super-airy foam and dry webs of bubbly coating on the glass sides. T: Rich pear and plum; doughy and slightly sweet, with a bit of alcohol warmth; white pepper and dried flowers; orange and banana on the finish, with a high, slightly earthy bitterness. P: Medium body with very high carbonation, prickly full foam; finish is dry. O: A classic tripel, with austere and refined quality; bright, satisfying fruit esters, with lots of spice and hops lending a delicious complexity; warming yet exceptionally drinkable, one part quaffing beer and another party sipping beer!
Puissate et enivrante, elle sait dépasser le cliché de la blanche fade classique, un bon standard
Golden, slightly hazy. Spicy aroma, some sweetnes. Well balanced, medium carbonated. It deserves its position as a clasic. Very nice!

A: Dark amber with a big white head.
N: Malt sweetness, citrus and spice. 
T: Very spicy. Citrus complexity galore, particularly lime zest. 
P: Full
O: Very enjoyable, complex tripel.

330ml. bottle in Vientiane, Laos. Pours a coppery red with a medium foamy head. Aroma of dark fruits and bread. Taste of malts, yeast, apple. Moderate bitterness with a tart finish. A very pleasant tripel.
UPDATED: MAY 28, 2017 Bottle. Big White head. Gold colour. Spicy, yeast, malt flavour. Medium bitterness.
Its a quite strong, powefull beer. The appearance is not so special. I think for this is for real belgen beer lovers.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2017 Today i am rating one of my favorite beers.Head is creamy, off withe to beige in color, big and long lasting. Beer is unclear dark, milky yellow. Aroma is intense, herbal, floral, orange, soap, yeast, coriander, bubble gum and a some pepper. Unusual and complex. Flavor is full, sweet, bitter, sour, wheat, herbal, yeast. Very multi-layered and all sensation at once. Finish is first low sweet turning into a strong bitter, herbal and yeasty long lasting finish. Carbonation is average and refreshing. A beer to enjoy from the beginning to the end!

Aus der Flasche getrunken (Händlerlieferung). Fast klares Gold im Glas mit stabiler starker weißer Schaumkrone. In der Nase typisch "belgisch". Kräftig im Körper mit erst spät durchschlagendem Alkohol.

Aroma: coriander, fruits.
Appearance: Yellow, haze with white head.
Taste: the same as aroma, lemon in finish.
Palate: Medium body, high carbonation, dry finish.

Floral and fruity aroma with pear, melon, orange. Hazy straw gold color with bright white head. Medium palate with slight bubbly carbonation on tongue. Cracker and wheat texture. Melon and pear flavor, bready, slight toffee on finish, dried apricots.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cork Bottle: Pours a hazy murky gold with thick foamy head. Aroma is very floral and fruity. Taste of apricot, orange, plum, fresh bread, and spice. Very nice.
UPDATED: APR 24, 2017 Barwa bursztynowa, wysoka piana. W aromacie belgijsko + banan. W smaku troszkę słodko, przyprawy, czuć chmiel. Wysokie nasycenie, które mimo to nie przeszkadza.

Hazy dark yellow with strong pure white head. Earthy belgian yest, banana, coriander, some maltyness. Yeast, lots of herbs, especially coriander. I think this could have used more waiting. Nice but not stellar. Perhaps needs maturing.
Sublime complex taste, suprisingly strong for a blonde beer. Has some citruses. Thick and long-lasting foam. Its both interesting and pleasing.

Draft Taproom (Charlottesville). Surprised to find I hadnt rated this. Only slightly hazy with a head that laces the fuck out of the glass. Banana, spice, light garbage water, gum in the nose. Flavor is crisp grasses, bubblegum, coriander, other spice, fruit.
Lettere uklar gul/orange med medium skum. Gær, koriander og citrus i næsen. Mediumbitter med rn smule sødme i smagen. Noter af citrus, gær og krydderi.

Bought a 750 ml bottle of the white for the first time in quite awhile. Why did I wait so long? The presentation is grand, its yellow-orange body is a bit hazy but the head is bright white and frothy. The foam is replenished by a very active effervescence. My Chimay glass is appreciative. A sniff delivers yeast and cotton candy. The first taste is delightful, the yeast once more, dough, apricot, a slight cane sugar sweetness. And then, surprisingly, a lingering, moderate bitter finish. Many moving parts that add up up to extremely nice and drinkable beer.

Bottle at Herman, Berlin. Hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. Aroma is dough, alcohol, some banana and raisins along with some other fruits. Taste is superb, fruity flavour with medium sweetness, light sourness and light bitterness. Palate is very nice, too. It is medium-to-full bodied with a very pleasant creamy texture. A satisfying sensation in the mouth. Head is almost always there and it makes the drinking experience better. Carbonation is average-to-lively. Finish is somewhat bitter and long-lasting, pleasant! I really dig this one.

Barwa ciemnego złota, mętne(z pływającymi drobinkami drożdży). Aromat przyprawowy, są również cytrusy, pomarańcze, estry i nuta przywodząca na myśl biszkopt z miodem. W smaku przyprawy, najpierw owocowa słodycz, po której następuje trochę pikantna goryczka. Dobrze ukryty alkohol, spore wysycenie. Piwo raczej wytrawne, bardzo pijalne.
Boozy wheat, earthy and floral flavors. Fruity but dank. A little bland. I don't understand why it's rated so high. Draft pour at Hopcat in Chicago, 5oz snifter.

From the tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours fairly transparent gold with an abundant head of white foam, very fine. Aroma is resinous, with honey and caramel as well. Body is medium, with some carbonation. Taste is characterized by sweetness, though bitterness is present and alive. Finish is no special.

Sweet aroma of yeast, champagne, toffee or honey, malt. Pours amber-golden with large frothy head. In flavor crispy malt, mild sweet fruitiness, biscuits, caramel, spice, well accented hoppiness with short moderate bitterness. Creamy yeasty-fruity aftertaste. Medium body, lively carbonation. Intense yet balanced, very tasty.

Bottiglia da 33. Bellissima alla vista: colore ambrato quasi arancio con un bel cappello di schiuma densa e compatta color panna. Olfatto di cereali e frutta non molto intenso. In bocca più dolce che amara. Più del gusto intriga la pienezza del corpo e la sua frizzantezza.

Hazy golden yellow with creamy white froth. Big belgian, banana aroma. Same flavours there in the taste, some clove too. Nice hit of Belgian yeast. Very smooth combination of flavours. Feels fantastic in the mouth, creamy and luscious.

Pours golden, hazy with abundant foam up top. Aromas of grains, caramel and raisins are present. First taste is delicious, this beer has no bite, it is an easy sip. It is very complex, and a taste of honey on toast is what I perceive. I had this beer several years ago, but never got to review it. For some reason it slipped from my mind and never drank it again, perhaps I was not ready for such a great beer. 
I will always have some around.

Piwo ciemnozłote w barwie, wysycenie duże, piana obfita, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa. Utrzymuje się średni krótko, ale ładnie zdobi szkło. W aromacie i smaku dominują nuty chlebowe, trochę bananowe i ziołowe. Goryczka solidna, ziołowa, lekko alkoholowa, trochę zalegająca.

330ml bottle. Pours with a good head and lacing. Aroma is sweet malt, alcohol, banana and a wee bit pukey in the background. The taste is full flavoured, medium sweet, some alcohol and quite peppery. Overall very good.

I am supposed to be enjoying this but hmmmmm. 

Thought I'd try this triple tipple, and boy it looks lovely in the glass. With a pleasing fizz and ever so slightly hazy, the amber liquid has a tinge of an orange hue. The two finger frothy off white head lasted longer than Willy Wonkers gobstopper. 

The nose is bubblegum and bread with a inkling of indistinct malty aromas. 

The sparkling appearance translates into the mouth with a medium body and a burst of bubbles that pleases the palate. 

The hops bring a sharp, acerbic attack up front, whilst this persists throughout, closely behind is metallic dryness on the tongue like the bottom of a parrot cage. Slowly some subtle malt hints of caramel glide in and then gently warming spices but not enough to dismiss the bitterness. 

 Although it scores high in the popular perception of classic Belgian beer somehow I am less than impressed, I expect it's just a personal preference.
Really enjoy drinking Tripels and this is one of the better beers I have enjoyed. Love that it isnt as acidity as other tripels, and the bubblegum flavour is to die for.

backlog

Great refreshing beer for the ABV. Really dry and carbonated. From what I can remember some nice fruity and spice/yeasty notes.
Bouteille achetée chez Intercaves. Grand classique des bières dabbaye. Notes fruitées.
dough, alcohol, herbs, golden, hazy, white foam, frothy, light body, thin feel, fizzy, lightly bitter, light sweetness,

Bottle as gift. Pours clear copper-gold. Lots of bubbles in the glass. Whippy off-white head. Aromas dry and spicy, gentle warming cinnamon and icing sugar. Flavours of dry yeast, warm spice and doughnuts. Light and sharp palate with a dry sparkle. Strong yeasty presence that surprisingly sweetens to a cinnamon doughnut finish. Nice beer.

Pours hazy, golden colour with a small, white head. Many fruits, peaches and bananas. Sweet apricots and yeasty notes. Moderate intensity. Taste is rich, quite sweet. Fruity notes and slightly bitter aftertaste. Medium body, highly carbonated. Unfortunately, alcohol is noticeable. Pretty good, very complex beer.
Bottle at home. Pours light golden. Medium thick, white head. Spicy, with honey, yeast, green pepper, sweet malts and hops. Medium carbonation, with long, bittering aftertaste. Well done.
Bottle. Pours a hazy amber color with a big creamy long-lasting head. Aroma is sweet and fresh dominated by fruits. Taste is rich and sweet.
Aroma of honey, figs, and booze. Clear gold colour. Boozy front with notes of burnt caramel and date. Medium body with lively carbonation. Quite a tasty brew.

La mia birra preferita. Si presenta di un bel color giallo paglierino torbido dovuto alla rifermentazione in bottiglia. Schiuma abbondante, fine e persistente. Allolfatto note fruttate di pesca, albicocca e di mandarino. In bocca è unesplosione di sapori. Questa birra è 8 gradi ma non si sente per niente, la sua frizzantezza e il suo corpo riescono a camuffare lalcol rendendola particolarmente beverina. I sentori sono di frutta gialla, note di caramello che si bilanciano con la lieve acidità. Nel finale rimane agrodolce.
Una birra eccezionale.

bottle, mainly malt smell when opening, looking for other fruit but difficult to find, taste bitter with some lingering aftertaste, dry, not so creamy and a bit harsh aftertaste. Can taste the alcohol.

Draft. Hazy dark gold in colour. Hoppy, yeasty aroma. Fruity (orange-citrus, raisins). Hoppy (earthy, peppery hops). Yeasty and Spicy (cinnamon). Malty (caramel). Dry bitter edge throughout. Dry finish. Very nice beer! (2008)

Piana mega trwała, zbita, drobna. W aromacie brzoskwinie, suszone morele. Fenole ukryły się gdzieś w tle, ale jakoś mi ich tu nie brakuje. W smaku przyjemnie, jest dość wytrawnie, choć nie aż tak jak w niektórych stylowych pobratymcach. Wysoko nasycone, rześkie, bardzo mocno owocowe. Bardziej soczyste od niektórych polskich NE IPA:D Klasa.

Served quite cold from a tulip, nice frothy head. Appearance is yellow with some cloud. Tangy, bread and banana like flavours. Very smooth, almost Weiss like with pronounced yeast-strain flavours and slight bitter aftertaste.
Uzupełnianie profilu z własnych notatek / zapisków, z racji postanowienia założenia konta na rb.
Balanced. Bread, cream, banana, coriander. Slightly more pronounced bitterness than f.e. a Karmeliet.

Pours a hazy yellow like aged leather with a big white head that lasts forever leaving plenty of lacing. Aroma is hoppy with a bit of fruity sweetness. Taste is fairly bitter, a bit sweet, and a little tart with medicinal, tannic dryness. Notes of noble hops up front, along with lemon, bubblegum, peach, wheat, and some peppery spice. It has a very foamy, full mouthfeel and plenty of carbonation. On the first sip it seemed too medicinal and off putting, but it grew on me.

Aroma is very good, fruity. Lots of white cream head, stays. First taste is sweet malty caramel. This slowly develops into bitterness of hops and that stays also for aftertaste, when sweetness is gone. Excellent tripel. Easily drinkable, pure joy.

Butelka do 2017. Ciemnozłote, opalizujące, piana drobna i średnia, wysoka, obficie oblepia szkło. Aromaty przyprawowe, kwiatowe, nuty winne, ale też miodowe. Początkowo na ustach czuć owocową słodycz, ale zaraz za tym przychodzi przyprawowość i wytrawnoość. Już w pierwszym łyku rozgrzewa gardło goryczka, typowa dla mocnego belga, pikantna i lekko alkoholowa.

Real nice fruity aroma of cherries and plum. That and a ton of lemony hops on the tongue makes this a slightly tart (almost sour) and tasty ale. Sweetness and spicy grains from the malt. Balanced and beautiful
Weinig aroma. De smaak valt dus echt binnen. Fruitig zond zoet te zijn, pompelmoes en citrus zonder te zuur te zijn, hop zonder te hoppig te zijn. Mooie balans en een fijne bitter hoppige afdronk.
Butelka 330 ml. Znakomite. Jasnozłota barwa, gęsta, drobnopęcherzykowa piana. Duże wysycenie, długo utrzymuje się na języku. Pełne ciało. Ostry smak, owoce.

Spices, bubblegum, peach in nose. Pours golden with tall white head. Taste is dry with peach, spices, bubblegum, flowers. Medium bitter finish, lively carbonation. Overall very good example of a style.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2017 330 ml bottle from Colruyt, Antwerp. Served in a Trappist glass. Dark orange colour. Fruity grapefruit and lemon aroma. Taste is rather bitter for a Tripel; it is also a bit sour. Aftertaste is significant and bitter. Carbonization is medium. Very refreshing. One of my favourite Tripel beers and by far my favourite Chimay.

330ml bottle @Bir&Fud Bottega (Rome). Dorata torbida, opalescente, cappello di schiuma bianca imponente e persistente. Al naso sentori di frutta matura, arancia candita, zucchero di canna, spezie, alcol. In bocca è dolce con un finale leggermente amaro, un po sbilanciata, lalcol si sente un po troppo. Corpo medio, carbonazione media. Ok.

0.75 l bottle from EDEKA Preller (Breckerfeld), bottled in 2014, cellared for about two years. Clear, golden amber with a rather large, frothy, stable, white head. Sweetish, fruity and slightly yeasty-spicy aroma of lots of peach, candied orange, some banana and hints of clove. Rather sweet, yeasty-spicy and slightly fruity taste of Belgian candy, banana, peach, candied orange and clove, followed by a medium long, quite bitter, yeasty-spicy, a bit harsh finish. Medium body, slightly creamy and fairly effervescent mouthfeel, very lively carbonation. Nice Tripel, not overly complex and still a bit harsh in the finish, but with a nice composition of classic flavours and a pleasant palate. Slight disappointment to be honest though, a fresh bottle Ive had in the past wasnt better by the way.

Barwa ciemno złota, delikatnie zmętnione. Piana średnio obfita, biała, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, dosyć trwała. Aromat słodkawy, kwiatowo-owocowy, lekki banan oraz ostrawy - przyprawowy, delikatna nuta alkoholu. W smaku dosyć wytrawne, alkohol dobrze ukryty, piwo przyjemnie rozgrzewa, goryczka niska-przyprawowa, średnio wysycone i treściwe,
Bottle. Soft white head, hazy golden colour, fruity fresh aroma, strong hop and bitter taste with long lasting nice aftertaste.

Hazy golden colour, creamy and thick white head. Citric aroma, floral notes, fresh sensation on the nose. Taste is in the middle of sour and bitter, a malty sensation on the mouth and a strong bitter end. Meidum to full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice from the start to the finish. Weak point: the aroma is too subtle. Everything else is top notch.

8%ABV. Belgian tripel.

Poured out gold. 8°SRM.

Nose is Belgian, but lighter and more beery. Lightly lemony.

Mouthfeel is beery. Palate is honey, sweet wheat, biscuits. Hops are balanced.
Pretty good. Not my favorite as it seemed to be lacking a little flavor. Still tasty.

Bottle 33 cl.
Pours hazy orange with a big white persistent head. 
Aroma is bread, grain and citrus hoppy.
Taste is hoppy and grapefruit, bitterness lasts long in the aftertaste.
Medium body with high carbonation.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Bursztynowe, zmętnione z obfitą, ale dziurawą i szybko opadającą pianą. W aromacie lekkie cytrusy, trochę banana, estrów, brzoskwini, są też przyprawy. Wytrawne, owocowe, z niską goryczką. Wysokie wysycenie, poprawne ciało. Ok, ale są dużo lepsze triple

Bière blonde avec un bon nez, un peu fleuri, une belle mousse blanche pas trop épaisse, assez pétillante quand même, un petit peu damertume au goût mais on reconnaît bien la méthode et les levures trappistes, une bonne bière assez rafraîchissante pour lété
Poured from bomber soft orange color with off white head and lots of sediment smells of fruit and spices very nice easy drinking flavor.
From bottle. Poured with large medium sized bubble head with amazing retention and nice lacing. Drank with beautifully balanced taste a really good beer
Bottle. Orange color, thick white head. Aroma is citrusy with oranges, cloves, coriander, honey, yeasty. Taste is yeasty, sugary, decent spicy and hoppy, good balanced, easy drinkable tripel
Very soft, complex tripel. Taste, unlike so many tripels, strong: hoppy with dark fruits, aftertaste mildly bitter. Quality.
Une de mes bières préférées ! Elle cumule force et finesse. Des arômes subtiles.

Growler Guys, Seattle. White cream, clear rich gold. Sweet banana alcohol, rich bready yeast. Creamy heavy tripel. Classic profile, a bit heavier body than I usually think but quite clean and rich. Mild ester, strong alcohol presence, medium carbonation. Nice.
Its a classic. Good to match style. Clean. Banana notes from yeast. Transferring from old system. tap and bottle

So Im coming off the most productive days of my life and checked in too many times with the boss who was taking care of two lads one sick. First project, Im done in under 18 hours. (sorry boss, newbie) I wasnt expecting to rate a beer tonight but after a lot of firsts: Ive tended bar in the past 20 years and always played moderator. First time I was ever escorted out of a bar because one Luciferian Blond would NOT let me finish a sentence, then went to finest bar in Lancaster to be rendered invisible by a bunch of turtles, then go to what Ive always regarded as a class hotel in a great chain only to be treated like scum, tourists, they bend over backwards for. Im already busy, but now Im driving to Rockville, MD on Tuesday morning to read someone the riot act.....My review of Chimay White and two place reviews you wont want to miss!!! Stayed tuned! When I awake, then I will be scarce till Monday! Oh yeah GREAT BEER here<Thirstys>

Bottle 330 ml in Bucharest, at Bistro GUXT. Poured in the Chimays branded glass.
Beautiful hazy copper color with a white and creamy nice head, with good retention and lacing.

Very appealing aroma with bready and biscuity hints< also hay, caramel, honey, citrus peel, fruits (banana and grapefruit) and spices (especially coriander, but also some spicy and pepery hints). Some bitter and discrete alcoholic notes. Really nice.

Taste shows at least as much complexity as the aroma. Bitter-sweet with coriander hints, also banana and grapefruit and some pepper and cloves as well. Well integrated alcohol.

 Pretty intense and lingering aftertaste with a bitter and dry finish. Some discrete alcohol in the end as well as some spicy and mineral hints.

Medium body, medium carbonation. Creamy, velvety and warm in the mouth.

O very good tripel showing great complexity and perfect ballance. Very easy to drink, very enjoyable, Ill drink it anytime in the future.

Enjoyed: Poured from a bottle into a trappist glass.
Appearance: Hazy pale-orange colour, with rich creamy head and lively carbonation (like a little spring) with floating bits.
Aroma: Malt, dusty, metallic, bread, a hint of alcohol
Palate: Full body, moderate carbonation with many small nibbling bubbles. 
Taste: Hint of sweetness which soon turns to bitterness; whole grain bread, metallic-grapefruit-bitter aftertaste.
Overall impression: Very enjoyable and tasty, pure pleasure. Somehow different than many other beers.

Piwo koloru złotego z obfitą pianą, lekko mętne. Pachnie owocami cytrusowymi, czuć rodzynki, jabłka, zioła. W smaku czuć wytrawny alkohol, rodzynki, zioła, goździki, delikatny posmak brzoskwiniowy. Piwo jest dosyć wytrawne z wysokim wysyceniem.

Bottle
Aroma-floral, fruits
Appearance-amber, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Powerhouse off white head on an unfiltered amber body. Softy citrus hop and spice nose. Citrus hops, banana esters, cloves, cereal and candied fruit produce a crisp and fresh taste profile. The hops are a nice addition to the typical Chimay taste array.
Bottle. It poured a cloudy orange color with a big frothy white head. The aroma was malty, Belgian spice, raisins and banana. There was a light bitterness on the finish.

Ljus med ett stort vitt skum. Lätt estrig med jäst och skumbanan. Lätt i tonen och torrt avslut

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dobre piwo. Fajny aromat, fajny smak i świetny wygląd. Taki klasyczny tripel.

750ml bottle from the state store 
Pours slightly cloudy golden with a medium sized off-white head, good lacing. Aroma is yeasty, dried fruit and oranges. Flavor of dried fruit, orange, estery and citrus peel 
Good

La Chimay Blanche est un autre exemple de lexcellence de la maîtrise brassicole de labbaye de Chimay. Entre puissance et douceur, cette triple sait trouver un équilibre juste. De couleur blond doré et paré dun léger voile, elle est surmontée dune mousse blanc crème de 2 à 3 cm dépaisseur saffaissant au long de la dégustation pour se maintenir à quelques mm en fin de dégustation. Le nez est avant tout sur les céréales avec un brin de coriandre. Lattaque est toute en souplesse et douceur sur les céréales et avec des arômes de fruits rouges. La deuxième attaque est splendide. En parallèle apparaissent 1.la puissance de lamertume, sur des arômes dorange et de girofle, tout en intensité et 2. des arômes de sucre candi et de fruits jaunes donnant de lampleur à la bière, tout en douceur et suavité. Lensemble est dune parfaite homogénéité avec des arômes sintégrant parfaitement. La corpulence est excellente avec un sucre résiduel bien présent (un tantinet trop à mon goût, mais cela ne peut en rien être objecté à notre triple) et lalcool sintègre parfaitement, montant crescendo vers un final long présentant quelques notes épicées. Une grande bière, un grand moment.

Pure white choppy head stayed impeccably on hazy light brown body. 
Orange, sweet citrus and yeast aroma. 
Very clean on the palate, quite often Tripels are cloying. 
Bitter sweet citrus, orange, banana, yeast and a slight hint of cloves.

Bottle at The Office. Aroma: Spice, fruit, dried fruit, banana, light aceton, flowers. Appearance: Nice head, hazy amber colour. Taste: Spicy, fruity, light aceton in the background, flowers, banana, sweet. Palate: Sweet finish, medium-high body, very high carbonation.

Piwo bardzo pszeniczne, zbożowe, drożdżowe, słodkie, pijalne, nieco brettowe, przyjemne. W barwie miodowe z bujną białą pianą. Całkiem smaczny, słodki, treściwy tripel, nie jest może jakiś szczególnie złożony, ale po prostu jest dobry.

0.33l bottle. Hazy orange color with big white head composed of big bubbles, could have been prettier. Aroma of yeast, malt, chestnut and banana. Taste is sweet and bitter. None of these chimays really hit the spot for me, too bad.

Bottle, 0.33l. Pours hazy copper body with two finger, thick and creamy white head. Excellent retention, lots of lacing. Very nice smell, yeasty, floral, herbal.

Full body with creamy texture, softly carbonated. Starts of sweet, gets bitter towards the finish. Rich aroma. Malts, yeast, wheat, nuts, candy, brown sugar. Refreshing foral mouthfeel. Herbs and spices, a bit peppery on the tongue. Well hidden presence of alcohol. Excellent complexity and balance. Long finish with slight alcohol burn lingering on the tongue.

Overall, very tasty tripel.

Bottle, pours a dark orange shade with smaller head. Smell is fig, plum wine, candy sugar, spice, and oak. Flavor is similar with lots of raisin and dark fruit complexity. Medium to fuller mouthfeel. Probably my second favorite of the Chimay;s i have sampled
Bottle at home. Pours hazy light amber with big white head. Aroma is yeast, malts and banana. Taste has yeast, hops and some bitter. Quite carbonated. Really nice!
Very well done. Visually couldnt be better: tall off-white head that stats til the end. Deep golden color. Flavors: peaches, apricots, brioche.

From the bottle poured into snifter pours hazy amber with stable white head. Slightly sour nose, yeasty. Taste is quite bitter, belgian yeast classic Tripel taste... The package however does not amaze me...  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
UPDATED: OCT 28, 2016 Pours amber colour with large white head, hazy liquid. Aroma of honey, vanilla, hay. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Medium body, thick feel, well balanced alchohol aftertaste.

0.3 bottle. Pours light brown color with huge, sticky white head. Aroma of flowers, vanilla, alcohol. Flavor is medium sweet, medium bitter, intense. Finish is long, high bitter with alcoholic warmth, but quite pleasant despite of this. Well balanced. Full body, lively carbonation.
citrus, herbs, caramel, leaves, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, bitter,
泡沫像刮鬍泡
Orange / Braun und trüb. Geruch süß, Pfirsich. Leicht nach Apfel. Im Geschmack dann Karamell.
Very floral and light body, with some tropical fruit notes and yeasty ester flavors, cleaner but a bit soapy
Brilliant and a great example of the type. Smooth, complex, estery, fruity, warming, apricot. One of historys great beers.

Light and fruity aroma of yeast. The flavor is fermented, musty, sour and incredibly bitter. Not so good bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. This is the grass that I will pour out. Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Fruity smell. A touch of banana. Herbal and dry. Hoppy finish. Lots of yeast fruitiness. Not much spice, but a touch of vanilla. Didnt really get good notes, since I was at a party.

Bottle. Pours is hazy golden with big foamy white head. Aroma floral, grassy, toast, bread. Taste is moderate sweet, slightly bitter, solid malty background. Medium to heavy body, creamy texture, light sweet, light bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with huge whitehead. In aroma citrus, peach, banana, spices. In taste similar, fruity-herbal, lightly sweet, quite dry. Medium body, fizzy carbonation, bitter and slightly warming finish.

33cl bottle. Pours orangey brown with a small long lasting off-white head. Aroma: yeast, fruity hops, malt, citrus, banana, grapefruit. Taste: wheat/yeast, citrus fruit, banana, grapefruit, some herbs/spices, bit of a hop bitterness in the finish and aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, full-bodied. Another great beer from Chimay, much fruitier than I thought it would be.

Bottle. Slightly hazy rich yellow with large off-white spongy head, lightly doughy aroma, high carbonation, lightly salty taste with typical Belgian yeast flavor, smooth body, long bitter vanilla finish. Smooth and tasty, a classic.
Pours hazy gold with a white head. Aroma is peach, apricot, and grapefruit. It has a full body, lively carbination and a bitter finish. A complex and well put together beer.
Aroma of apricot, banana, a bit of grapefruit, herbs and spiciness. pretty high herbal-grapefruity bitterness. high carbonation

Goûtée dans un verre Charles Quint.
Belle robe orangée surmontée dune mousse blanche abondante et tenace, carbonatation intense.
Le nez est fruité et houblonné avec des touches de levure et de citron.
Le goût est sur la banane, les fruits jaunes et secs(dattes) avec une parfaite balance douceur/amertume.
Larrière bouche idéale nous ramène les houblons sur une bonne longueur.
Une très grande triple trappiste.
17.5/20

Belle robe blonde cuivrée avec une mousse blanche persistante.
Le nez dégage des arômes de céréales et alcool.La bouche révèle des notes fruitées, houblonnées bien équilibrées avec une légère amertume.
Très bonne bière Tripel qui nous laisse sur une douce amertume bien agréable !

Lively cloudy orange pour with a massive white head. Nice balance of yeasty, bread esters... Citrus... Lively carbonation. Slight astringency stops it being as good as some tripels, but a very good beer all the same.
Butelka, jasne i mocne piwo z Belgii, czuć chmiele, dobre piwo, szkoda że tak mało w tej butelce.
Bière dorée, avec une belle mousse blanche qui tient. Pas aussi bonne que la Chimay Bleu, bière forte mais rien dexceptionnel.
Cloudy yellow liquid with big white foam. Cirtrus, alcohol, yeast aroma. Nice carbonation.

A bottle from Jasons drunk at home during the typhoon! Aroma: unmistakably hoppy. Appearance: hazy, light amber, minimal head. Palate: full-bodied, but certainly not thick in texture. Soft carbonation, a long, bitter and astringent finish. Overwhelmingly bitter thanks to the hops. Refreshing, and an excellent beverage, but I prefer something more complex in terms of flavour.

Amber clear with big, white head. In aroma its spicy and caramel with peach/apricot fruitiness, and floral notes. In taste it hits with upfront caramel, which slides into apricot and peachy, apricot and spicy notes with accompaniment of herbal and floral hoppiness which last into finish that ends up with mild bitterness. Medium carbonations and slick, creamy body. Slight alcochol

Appearance: Pours off white with white head and good lacing
Aroma: spicy, fresh
Mouthfeel: medium, smooth, medium low carbonation 
Taste: fresh, spicy, creamy smooth 
Awesome drinking. Refreshing, tasty, really enjoyable

Pours clear golden yellow with a thick white head that leaves a 9 mm ring and lacing. Nose is ripe fruit. Taste is light banana, malt, extremely light bitterness in the aftertaste. 11.2 oz bottle Bring back 12 oz. Use cans!

Veiled amber color with storming activity. Extra frothy white 4-5 finger mountain head, lasting around 20 minutes, with strong legs. Fresh floral smell with a yeasty and caramel touch. Flavors of burned grains and bread, caramel and banana, some lemon and apple, a little of pears and coriander, thick herbal and floral spices. Sugary with present bitterness, almost leathery. Smooth slick full body with champagne like carbonation. Medium to strong finish with a long ending of estery tongue coat, slightly dry and vinous, a long malty sugary and spicy yeasty feel. Feels more like a dark belgian with more hops and a thick oily feel and a little syrupy. Overall very good craft and interesting flavors. Not very accessible yet the alcohol is well hidden, and for those who like the overly heavy spices its quite warming and filling.

Bottle from Booths, Media City.  Hazy amber with a small head. Its strength is very evident in its nose, but less so in taste, although it clearly has one. Here theres some gentle fruitiness and some spice.

medium and sourish aroma - a common blanche (white bread, a bit of coriander, sweet citrus, a bit of yeast and artificial perfume).
medium, sourish and sweetish taste - malt, dusty cereals, yeast, white bread, some citrus, flowers, a bit of bitterness and spicy flavor. good and interesting!

Chimay White/Cing Cents (whatever you call it) is one of the regularly distributed Chimay brews thats escaped me for a while. Here we are at last. Time brings them all home. Chimays Tripel pours gold orange and clear (well, clear if you dont muddy it slightly with yeast like my klutzy ass). Aromas are both inviting yet delicate. Wheat malt sweetness and mild fruitiness. Flavors are surprisingly soft yet complex. Round malt breadiness, sweet candied and stone fruits, banana, and some herbal hops. Sublimely smooth mouthfeel. This brew has a mellow, creamy feel. Booze is totally hidden despite the moderate strength of this beer. Not as bold and tropical as some variations, but its a classically beautiful Tripel.

Hazy light amber, strong white head.

Aroma: spices, ethers, sweet grape.
Taste: almost dry with hoppy and spicy bitterness. Light fruit sweetness.
Flavour: yeasty ethers, black pepper, allspice, light minty ethery notes, some grassy and woody hops.
Very light alcohol notes in the finish.

Very good.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, for the book. Aroma is booze, sweet tropical fruit, clove, spice, bubblegum, it has some lager characteristics, mostly very fruity. Appearance is amber golden, darker, hazy, off white head. Taste is just incredibly boozy, bland, dry, syrup, some tropical fruit, its really very light flavored with the exception of the booze. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, booze dry aftertaste. Overall, this completely misses the mark.

330 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. The pour is a darker golden brown/orange with a thin white dense cap of head that lingers as a thick ring. The aroma is pretty strange. There is a yeasty lager thing happening. There is a light fruitiness that culminates with a pretty hefty banana. A light clove exists, but its drown out by the fruit. Its very plain and not really offensive for a tripel. The flavor is very bland. There is a light malt and a hint of fruity clove, but its just very bland and light. The mouth feel is thin and under carbonated with a lingeringly metallic finish. Its somewhat interesting, but not the best by any means. Oh well.

Pours hazy orange with a large white head. Smells fruity, bready, and hints of wheat. Taste is sweet, hints of white fruits, and bread. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and lively mouth-carbonation, Chimay Blanche (Cinq Cents) finishes with a lingering bready sweetness.
Butelka 330 ml. Znakomite. Jasnozłota barwa, gęsta, drobnopęcherzykowa piana. Duże wysycenie, długo utrzymuje się na języku. Pełne ciało. Ostry smak, owoce.

Aroma- Belgian yeast, coriander, orange peel, wheat malt. Appearance- Golden orange, pours 3 fingers of thick foam. Settles into 1 finger that persists. Visible intense bubblieness. Sticky lacing. Taste- Wheat malt, Belgian yeast, citrus, mild alcohol. Palate- medium body, highly effervescent. Slight back palate bitterness. Overall- A fine example of a what a traditional tripel should be. Very drinkable.

Pear and some vanilla in the aroma with definite alcohol as well. Taste is suprisingly rich maltiness and more subtle fruitiness (again, pear) and a strong backbone of spicy and bitter hops. Finishes with a long, lingering sweetness and bitterness. Full bodied, but still finished dry enough to be exceptionally drinkable.

Golden colour but very opaque. Big lacing, fruity alcohol scent mixed with aroma of banana ester, pear, clove and spice. Taste Dry hops. Flavour sweet, pear primarily and spicy. Mouthfeel dry and smooth.

[backlog] 21-01-16 / bottle bought in Belgium, drank at home. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 2.75/5

Color dorado, medianamente turbio, con capa de espuma blanca, jabonosa, de dos dedos de grosor. Carbonatación media. Aroma floral, increíblemente fresco. También recuerda al de muchas cervezas de trigo, ¿quizá por la levadura? Sabor suave para una triple, pero complejo, con ligero amargor final, sin presencia de alcohol (estamos hablando de nada más y nada menos que 8%). Triple extraña, única; no esperaba menos viniendo de Chimay.

Bue 3 ans et 4 mois avant DLC. Bière blonde foncée à épais col de mousse à tenue exceptionnelle (un peu comme lorval). Petits cratères sur le dessus. Carbo très faible. Arôme floral. On sent lalcool plus tard après réchauffement et la poire bien mûre. En bouche, crémeuse, réchauffe un peu le palais. On sent lalcool et une bière très ronde. Douce, pas amère du tout, un peu acide en final. Meilleure fraîche que réchauffée car après réchauffement cest alcool et malt toasté sans être exceptionnelle.

330ml bottle. BB end 2017
Fruity, malty aroma with Lambic overtones.
Hazy amber gold with ice cream head.
Very mild bitterness with a mild phenolic finish.
Mmmm, yeah not bad.

I poured it from the bottle into a glass. It pours orange with a big, white head and lacing. The aroma is wheat, banana, and spice. The taste is wheat, banana, other fruit, and spice. Its very carbonated. The subtle sweetness mixes well with the slight bitterness. There are slight boozy hints to it. This is a nice beer.
330ml bottle. Hazy orange with big thin white head. fresh aroma of yeast and orange. High corbonation. Taste is bitter with yeast and malt. Notes of fruits. Very fresh beer.

Flasche 0,33l: Bernstein, deutliche Trübung, sehr kräftiger fester mittelporiger Schaum; würzige Nase, kräftige Süße, Malz, Malzzucker, dunkle Früchte, Röstaromen, etwas Schokolade, leichte Hopfenaromen; kräftig würziger Körper, würzige Süße, leicht alkoholisch, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, leichte Säure, leicht trocken, Röstaromen, etwas trockene Bitterkeit; angenehmer kräftig-würziger Nachgang

Ein sehr schweres, trockenes und vollmundiges Tripel, was allerdings mit seinen Umdrehungen auch nicht hinter den Berg hält. Cognac, Kräuter, Erde und Brot. Der Nachhall exorbitant lang und voller alkoholischer Hopfenschärfe. Anders. Kleine Flasche vom Supermarkt in Belgien. Ca.1-1,5.

Pours pale golden with frothy off-white head. Some hay in the aroma, yeast, underlying fruitiness. Fully complex palate, with a bitter malt background, yeast and a toasted finish that fades out very gradually. Medium to full body. Nice.

Brysselistä 2010 joulukuussa ostettu pullo, BBE 2013. Pienehkö vaahto, jättää hieman pitsiä. Pullossa näkee paljon hiivapartikkeleita leijailemassa. Kullankeltainen, samea olut. Tuoksu varsin pehmeä ja vahvasti hedelmäinen sekä aavistuksen hiivainen. Myös maku maltaisen täyteläinen ja hedelmäinen sekä todella pehmeä; varsinkin jälkimmäinen lasillinen jossa kaikki hiivat kaadettu mukaan. Lienee pehmentynyt ikäännytyksellä ja katkeruus hävinnyt. Mainio edelleen. Tuoreena aavistuksen ärhäkämpi tapaus kaikin puolin (enemmän vaahtoa, enemmän katkeroa, ...), iän myötä pehmentynyt kaikin puolin. 3.10.2014: Tuoreempi versio kokeilussa. Todella kuohkea usean sentin vaahto, joka jättää kivasti pitsiä. Pehmeää se on tämäkin, ja raikkaan hedelmäistä. Mainio, ulkonäölle lisäpiste. 40->41

Huge frothy off-white head very long lasting that evolves to a rocky head.
Hazy orange amber colour.
Aroma is wheat beer (banana clues), yeasty, malty and very spicy.
Taste is very crispy, spicy (pepper, cardamom) and yeasty. Complex finish: bitter, and spicy (pepper) with some sourness.
Poured from .33l bottle good head with a mid golden colour smells and tastes of hops. Good drink like it a lot

330ml bottle.
Smell is mostly yeast and spices. Some malty notes and herbs, tracing flowers.
Pours light brown with a nice white head that stays a while.
Tastes is wheaty - clove and banana - a bit hoppy, some yeast and spicy notes.
I did enjoy this one. Very tasty.

Appearance is dark golden and very clear, becoming cloudy with more of the bottle poured in. Lots of carbonation, a 2-finger pillowy white head. Aroma- creamy caramel malt, spices, yeast, white bread, oranges, fruity hop undertones. Taste- sweet malts, raisin, fruitcake, crisp hops, sugary fruit, yeasty dough. Mouthfeel is excellent- full and fluffy, then becomes juicy to deliver the flavours. Alcohol well-hidden. Well done.

홉 향의 끝을 봤다. 
은은한 아로마와 맛. 
IPA 같이 쓴 맛이 강하지도 않아 마시기 좋다. 
그냥 맥주로만 마셔도 정말 좋을 듯 하다. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mooi Trappistenbier. Fruitig, Hoe langer je dit bier laat staan hoe slechter deze wordt,

33cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famiflora) U: lichtwazig koperkleurig met witte schuimkraag G: pilsmout, metallisch, gist en iets kruidigs S: moutzoete aanzet, opnieuw metallisch, licht fruitig en een mooie nabitterheid M: mooie, stevige carbonatie

Pours with a huge thick white head. This softens the taste nicely and adds a little creamy touch. Belgian yeast and spices do most of the magic. The malty side is also soft, but certainly notable. Mild hoppiness in the middle. Then yeast and spices turn it upside down once more. A hint of alcohol only in the begining, later it fades away. Enjoyable glassful.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2017 Lätt grumlig med fint vitt skum. Doftar lite jäst, bröd och hö. Smaken bred med humle och lite sötma. Eftersmaken lång och fint besk. OBS! Sämre på fat än glas 4.2. (Re-rate 170616) Oklar mörkorange med tjockt vitt skum. Doftar jäst, sirapslimpa (melass) och frukt, lite mango, äpple och päron. Smaken fint fyllig, komplex och bred, något besk. Eftersmaken ganska lång och kryddig.

Apparence : Cuivre/bronze aux reflets orangés, gros col blanc ayant une bonne rétention, carbonatation moyenne à rapide, légère dentelle. 

Nez : Levure, phénols, un peu dagrumes. Intensité moyenne à élevée. 

Goût : Entrée en malt sucré/mielleux, par la suite les phénols avec un peu de poire, finale présentant une amertume plutôt franche (et inattendue) jouant dans les notes herbacées/épicées. 

Sensation : Effervescence faible en bouche, corps moyen, chaleur en gorge durant la finale, finale assez longue.

Bref : Triple axée sur la levure, les épices et le houblon herbacé (ainsi que son amertume). Plutôt intense, bien intégrée, mais plus ou moins dans mes cordes.
Camomilla aromas in smell. Belgian way hopps and palate. Quite sweet. Slippery and oily. Pure trappist quality.

Bottle. Color: Gold, littlebit hazy. Dense off white frothy head. Lively carbonation. Taste: Bitterweet, yeast, subtle hints of herbs, fruit, flowers and tobacco. Complex and tasteful. Dry mouthfeel. Finishing with a slightly more bitterness. Overall a really nice beer.

Stubby little 33cl bottle to Chimay goblet. L11 date code, which makes this 2011 vintage, I think. Cant believe that I havent entered a rate for this yet! Pours light brown with a lingering off white head. Aroma is raisin, molasses, clove. Flavor is banana, raisin, molasses, clove. Clove bitterness in the finish.
Arôme de grains, mousse blanche, forte effervescence, robe dorée trouble. En bouche, pain, levure avec une amertume moyenne. Bon niveau de corps qui masque complètement le fort taux dalcool.
Sokáig tartó, hatalmas hab, homályos borostyán szín. Illata komlós, enyhén gyümölcsös. Fincsi komlós, enyhén gyümölcsös íz, jellegzetes komlós keserűsséggel, ami sokáig megmarad. Testes sör.
Pours a slightly dark hazy amber, thick white head, some lacing. Nice, crisp, surprisingly rich, dry, yeasty, almost wine-like fruits in terms of flavor. Very good beer.

Small bottle. Minimal aroma. White frothy head. Bitter. Slightly tart. Meh. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy golden with a big and foamy white head. Malty aroma of orange, caramel and some spice. Medium body, thick feel, average carbonation. Taste is suprisingly dry with hops, grass, yeast and black pepper. Long and quite bitter finish.

Chimay Tripel, with its typical golden colour, its slightly hazy appearance and its fine head is especially characterised by its aroma which results from an agreeable combination of fresh hops and yeast. The beers flavour, as sensed in the mouth, comes from the smell of hops: above all it is the fruity notes of muscat and raisins that give this beer a particularly attractive aroma. The aroma complements the touch of bitterness. There is no acidity, but an after-bitterness which melts in the mouth. This top fermented Trappist beer, refermented in the bottle, is not pasteurised.
Ingredients: Water, malted barley, wheat starch, sugar, hop extract and yeast. See Protz (beer-pages.com/protz/features/chimay.htm) and John White (www.whitebeertravels.co.uk/chimay.html)
Fuerte sabor, aroma agradable pero ligero. Paladar duradero, herbal. Poca astringencia, poco carbonatada. Espuma nula.

33 cl bottle served in tulip. A classic classic. Pours blurry, hazy yellow. Earthy aroma of yeast, fruits and spices. Balanced taste in the same direction with a discrete bitterness. Another piece of evidence for the fact that good beer is not necessarily brewed by pretentious hipster douchebags. <3
Pours golden hazy very nice retention. Nose is fruity, oranges, apricot m, stone fruit and some herbal and yeast notes. Taste is correspondingly fruity with a pronounced bitterness.
Nærmest lidt rødgylden med tæt hvidt skum. Krydret, cremet og kraftig. Meget bitterhed i eftersmagen.

Butelka 330ml (12.2019). Piwo klarowne o ciemno złotej barwie. Biała, kremowa piana jest bardzo obfita, trwała i dokładnie oblepia szkło. Aromat drożdżowy z nutami owocowymi, pieprzowymi. W smaku owocowe z nutami przyprawowymi, lekko pieprzowymi i zaznaczoną, przyprawowo-fenolową goryczką, na umiarkowanym poziomie i wytrawnym finiszu. Piwo jest dość wysoko wysycone, leciutko musujące, średnio treściwe i dość lekkie w odczuciu choć wyraźnie rozgrzewające ale alkohol jest dobrze ukryty.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 330 ml bottle. Pours dark golden with a large frothy white head. The aroma is rather faint, yeasty and some fruity notes (apples and pears). Medium to full body with quiet lively carbonation. and an alcoholic finish. The taste is pretty sweet and heavily malty (caramel) with some bitterness and fruity aromas coming in course of the tasting - dried fruits and apples and pears, honey. Very nice one.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2016 Chimay Blanche is perhaps the most classic of the set, but it surely is not the worst. Once again, you?ll find that specific, somewhat bitter but very enjoyable taste, but with a most traditional approach than the other ones. No fruits like the red one, not as charged as the blue one, this one is lighter to me, and surely is a great beer for any occasion. APPROVED BY TAVERNY?S BLACK METAL CREW !

Usually I dont like Blanche, too safe, like Wieckse Witte (Heineken).
I like this one. Taste? I would say "hay/cereal" Well they say that its real Trappist from Baileux.
They also like it in France. France North of course. Below the La Canche river they are beern00bs just like me. ;)
---
irgendwie "unspeziell". Konfuzzi from Freiburg wrote that. I think hes right, but yet I liked it better than most whites coming from the former BENELUX.
Trüb, goldfarben. Angenehm bitter. Schmeckt gut, aber irgendwie "unspeziell".

Koperkleurig oranje bier met een dikke witte schuimkraag.
Aroma: fruitig (boom fruit zoals appels en abrikozen en druiven), gist en brood, kruiden en alcohol. 
Smaak volgt het profiel van de neus: licht fruit, zoete mout, citrus.
Gemiddeld mondgevoel met mooi koolzuur en zachte afdronk.
Dark golden appearance with some creamy head. Complex tastes of brown sugar, caramel and dried banana. Heavy body, smooth carbonation and a finish of dried banana. Good, but not overwhelming

Golden colour with a thick foamy head. The aroma has some citrus notes, yeast and sweet fruits. Aroma is mostly bitter, some banana and apricot. The bitterness stays long time in the mouth. Full-bodied. Completely enjoyable, but I personally would prefer the red to this.

pours a thick white head with butter, faint jasmine and yellow flowers aromas. Hazy and dark gold colored body. thick and longly bitter in mouth. nice malted cerals flavors with a long finish. a model of balance for belgian tripel ales with well masked alcohol.
A really nice tripel! Bought the 0.33cl bottle onstead of the 0.75 and kinda regretted it. Hazy colour with a good foam head. Insane aftertase.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with large slightly off-white head. Aroma is banana, fruits, yeast, and malts. Taste is bittersweet with bitter aftertaste. Flavours are malts, yeast, hops, bread and alcohol.
Good Belgian trappist beer. Nice smooth flavours and aroma, been trying to emulate this one for ages.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
From a bottle. Pours nicely golden and hazy. Nice white head. Caramel and fruity aroma.

Bottle at home. Hazy golden color, small white head. Lively carbonation. Aroma of grape and fruits, some notes of malts and yeast. Some alcohol as well but it well hidden. Full bodied. Nice medium sourness, light to medium sweetness and medium bitterness. Really good.
Bouteille 33 cl- mousse blanche persistante, couleur oranger foncée, odeur floral, fruit, goût: houblon citron agrumes, amertume très présente mais agréable, finale longue sur lamertume
Dark bronze, nice white foam. Caramel and fruit in the aroma. Sweet, malt, with sweet paper blended aftertaste.

Tasted from the bottle 750 ML with Marc. This is my favorite from the three pack. Nose is not as good as the rest. This is a great beer! Orange golden cloudy color. Long lasting white head. Fruity with pineapple taste but good balanced hops and 8% alcohol. Smooth and easy to drink for a quality drink. 

F Avey---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

En bouteille.
Superbe couleur orange, tête magnifique bien blanche qui dure...
Nez de malts et de bananes. Sucrée en bouche, amertume très douce. Amertume qui reste sur un final long. Alcool bien caché.
Une excellente trappiste.

With the modern Chimay signature nose this sweet smelling lightish russett coloured beer squeezes itself into the triple catehory. Some complexity and carby acidity is evident but this lacks definition and comes across as somewhat four square.

Aroma of malt, chestnut and wheat. Hazy pale amber orange body with a foamy white head and a long lace. Taste of wheat, malts, banana-bread, mostly malty flavors. Bittersweet aftertaste. Medium body with a slick texture, soft carbonation and very noticable alcohol

pours a light golden with a white head that produces Belgian lacing. It has a heavy smell of spices and floral elements. There is some yeast elements to it with citrus and bread. It has flavors of spice, earthly elements, bread, citrus and floral hops. The carbonation is fairly high and it has a dry finish.

25 oz. bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy dark gold color with a vigorous white head. A light hoppy/sour aroma is present. Medium body, lots of carbonation on the tongue. Taste is a nice combination of hops, malt and a touch of sourness. Finish is slightly sour. Excellent!

Pours golden yellow with big frothy white head, good lacing. Nose finds honey, fruits (mainly peach, bit of citrus), bread, Belgian yeast. Taste is rather bitter, a bit sour even, some liquorice in the finish, spices, a hint of pepper, oak. Medium sweet, medium to high bitter. Body is medium, palate is oily, carbonation is high. Very nice.

0,25l from on tap at a pub in caorle italy. Orange hazy colour, small white head. smells of peach, spices, flowery, perfume, some herbs, yeasty. medium to full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of peach, spices, belgian yeast, some sweetness, herbal, flowery, tobacco. finishes quite balanced with some belgian yeast and notes of spices, a but flowery and peach. quite nice one, great balance, just enough flavor to keep it interesting (there are quite a few beers of the style that are rather boring)
0.75 bottle. Cloudy golden appearance. Nice thick cap. Sour aroma. Bitter, sour taste. Refreshing. Bitter aftertaste.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2017 Pours hazy golden with a big frothy head that diminishes but lasts throughout the tasting. The rich aroma contains fruits, caramel, yeast, hops and herbs. It tastes medium fruit-like sweet with a spicy light bitter ending. The aftertaste is long. Full body and creamy texture. Very enjoyable

Sampled from a bottle the beer poured, an opaque coppery orange. The beer had a thick frothy head which, when settled down left a white cap and good lacing. Some sediment was left in the bottle, as this beer is unfiltered. The beer is aromatic and much of what would be expected from a Belgian tripel: fruitiness (tree fruit like apples and apricots and grapes), yeast and bread, spice and alcohol. The flavour follows the profile of the nose: light fruits, sweet malts, citrus notes, Belgian yeasts and with a hint of hoppy bitterness at the end. Complex and masterfully balanced. The beer was fully bodied and crisp, with an almost soda like carbonation. This doesnt feel like it is 8%, the ABV is well hidden.
Pours amber, huge white head. Surprising aroma of fruits, hops. Taste of malts, fruits, citrus. High carbonation. Resfeshing taste, not quite sweet, i was expecting more. Overally good trappist

Originally rated on 7/1/08. It poured a massive white cap, the body was interesting blend of colors depending on the light, it was yellow, and amber very cloudy. Thick lace left on my glass, flavor was a very subtle mix of fruit and spices, with malty overtones.Slight scent and flavor of alcohol but its well hidden and smooth.

Goud van kleur, volle foamy schuimkraag die heel lang blijft. Medium koolzuur. Troebel Ongefilterd. Aroma van de Belgische gist, kruidig,peper,kruidnagel en hops. De kruidigheid gelukkig wel subtiel. Smaak is fruitig, zoet, kruidig en een licht zuurtje. Een flinke nabitter die weer overgaat in zoet. Alcohol ondanks de 8 ABV goed verborgen. Medium tot vol body en droog op het einde. Keurige Tripel.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Aroma of traditional trappist beer. Pours amber with creamy head. Cream on the palate and soft mouth feel. Caramel and malt flavours with hints of grassiness. Not overpowering trappist funkiness. Consistent finish retains the flavour from the middle.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Fruity and malty aroma. Long white head. Hazy amber color. Combined sweetness and bitterness. Bitter aftertaste.

Bottle. Golden amber color, hazy liquid with a lot of sedimentation. Higher carbonation. Very nice banana smell. Aroma of banana, oak, some unidentified sweet fruit in the background. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet and a bit sour. Excellent.

Smell: buckwheat honey, hops, peach, delicate aroma of banana, tropical fruits, a little bit of spicy.
Taste: dominated by bitterness ...bitterness becomes sweetness, herbs & cloves, yeast, some of alcohol, sour sweet; finish is intense of bread. Pleasantly warming.
Color: amber - honey with creamy peach head.

Not my favourite tripel but the authentic ones rarely disappoint. Golden colour with plenty of white head. Oily body. Nose has sweet toffee malt, syrup and pear. Flavour brings dried fruit but retains a slightly harsh edge.

Draught at Porter and Sons Tel Aviv. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of yeast, hibiscus, some biscuit and a little bit of oxidation. Tastes bitter, a little yeasty, a little plastic / phenolic. Full body, sweetish finish and quite carbonated. decent.

A little lighter than the other chimays, leaning a bit more towards the citrus fruit side and more refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amber color. Good foam. Aroma: carmel, bubblegum, spices, pepper. Pleasent. Taste: peach, fruits, spicies. Full body, but too much alcohol in aftertaste.
golden hazy body with a white bubbly head that leaves a ring all the way through.it smells sweet malt,bubblegum and spices.the taste is sweet and bubbly because of the overcarbonation.nice beer
Amber color. Rocky head. Good aftertaste. Cloudy. From bottle 0,33 cl. Fruiry notes of raising.

33cl bottle. Hazy, dark golden pour with medium, velvety, white head, nice lacing. Aromas of basement, dried fruit and caramel. Taste is a bit sweet, bittery and balanced. Low carbonation, lively palate. Aftertaste is really nice balance of warm alcohol and dry bitterness. Good in its own style.

33cl bottle on 02-Nov-2015, poured into a long stemmed tulip glass. Slightly hazy golden colour with a fine white head. Aroma of yeast and spices. Medium body and carbonation. Taste of sweet malt, sugar, yeast and spices. Sweet finish with light hops. A little too at sweet my taste, but it gets better down the glass as it warms
Aroma of yeast and spices. Taste is very spicy, lightly sour with a great hoppy finish. Alcohol is well hidden
0,33l Flasche. Hellbraunes klares Bier mit flachem Schaum. Malziges Karamell Aroma. Kräftiger runder Geschmack.

Triple assez légère en goût
Robe claire
Belle mousse
Un peu trop légère selon mois pour un triple
Citrus, floral, belgian yeast, golden with a rocky and white head, taste of citrus, sweet with a bitter final, medium body, lively....wonderful.
cool, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel

Bottle, 330ml. A clear amber beer with a huge frothy head and lot of gas. Aroma is of Belgian yeast, citrics, alcohol and green apples. Taste is bitter with a dry Belgian character. Medium bodied with some carbonation and astringency. Kind of hoppy afertaste with a yeast finish that is slightly alcoholic.

Bottle, 33cl. Clear golden/amber with a creamy offwhite head. Aromas of citrus, fruity hops, cereal, Belgian yeast, alcohol. Medium bodied with moderate to fizzy carbonation. Dry and oily, with a deep hoppy bitterness and astringency, and a controlled sweetness for a tripel. Very pleasant farmhouse character and amazingly drinkable. Excellent, even slightly unorthodox tripel.

Massive longlasting fluffy white head, nice lacing, sits on top of a hazy light gold coloured beer. The ice cream cone effect. Spicy yeast, candy sweet malt, fig, fruity aroma. Matching flavours but this bottle has a lasting metallic note that doesnt seem like it should be in the beer. Im guessing this bottle hasnt been stored well. Med-high carbonation, medium mouthfeel, dry finish with a lingering bitterness. Very nice beer but docked points because of the metallic note (will have to re-rate).

On tap, Beergeek Praha: nice medium foam, good cling to glass, dissipated in a few minutes. A bit bitter, as I recall I prefer the overall balance of Chimay Rood (red) a bit more. My research of Belgian beers needs further refinement.... and with any luck shall continue apace. A few more sips reveal a delicate flavor unfound in Czech beers: an apples to oranges comparison and thus close to meaningless. The big downside to experiencing more Belgian beers is my increasing reluctance to drink the local brews. Ach jo! (Kdy mluvite český, rozumite)

Draught at SBWF 2015.
Lasting white head. Clear solid golden color.
Nobel taste to give a very nice trippel with a fine carbonation.
Nice refreshing fruity aftertaste. Strong beer without sweetness. Golden color, thick head. This from tap at Delirium Cafe Brussels.

Pours hazy blonde with a decent white head. Nose is lemon tardiness with a little hops and bread. Flavor is a little acidic and strongly favors citrus. Good but not as good as some of its other abbey peers.
Amber with rocky white head. Raisins, cognac, ripe pear, dark chocolate and caramel. High carbonation, sweet, thick, spicy, round, floral and dry finish. Overall: Enjoyable.

So underestimated this, and it was pretty good. The aroma is very good. Lots of Belgian yeasts fruity character and some spiciness, and malt. High carb, medium-light bodied. Very dry and drinkable, but some booze too.

330mL bottle, pours with a large foamy white head that reduces quickly. A yellow-amber colour that is a little cloudy. Aroma- alcohol, malt, yeast, slight banana and grape. Taste- alcohol, malt,grape, buscuit. Moderate bitterness. Very well balanced and smooth beer.

The beer has a beautiful look. The color of the beer is a beautiful golden yellow, with a little hint of orange. The beer is quite clear, but it has a tiny cloudiness in it.The beer pours a tremendous thick layer of soft white foam. The bulk of the foam collapses quickly, but a nice rich layer of soft white creamy foam remains to cover the beer. The beer has a delicious smell. The smell is very rich and somehow thick. The smell has a strong nutty alcohol aroma. Besides this i smell some delicious hops, and a doughy yeast aroma. The smell is a delicious balance between sweet and bitter. Unfortunately I have a runny nose, so all the aromas are a little mild to me. The smell is delicious as well. It is almost the same as the smell. It is very alcohol, in a good way, has a little fresh hop flavor and has a delicious somehow doughy yeast flavor. This beer is more yeasty than most beers. The yeast in combination with the alcohol is amazing. It is a truly delicious beer. Just like you can aspect from a Belgian Trappist beer.

A strong yeasty side, smells and tastes like yeast strongly, its amazing. Nice bitterness balance, kind of a sweet bitterness. Pretty nice appearance, especially the lightness of this beer and its foam. Great on the palate, powerful taste and long lasting. Im not really into trappist beers but this is the type of beer that I consider as the most close to what a beer is supposed to be. Aromas are pretty average to me, but flavours are deep and powerful. I find it similar to Orval but the bitterness is so much more enjoyable (Orval is the only trappist I disliked till now). and damn this beer is cheap, there are plenty of more expensive beers that arent real beers. Im used to bake so I usually taste fresh yeast, this beer is the beer that comes the closest to fresh yeast in taste.

Pours a cloudy golden with a bumpy white head. Cream with accents of banana and white grape on the nose. Fuller body, but gets lighter toward the end. Gets a little astringent. Everything is very mild. Faint banana, green, and cream.
Excellent color and foam. Nice malty character. Fresh hops and excellent sweet taste. Slight bitterness.

Golden-amber coloured beer, strongly carbonated, with big three-finger white head. Aromas are toffee, polished wood, pear, cumin. Taste is basically dry, but with big burnt caramel background adding weight and bitterness. Some fruit sweetness at the end.

color orange
aroma of orange, grapefruits
smooth and strong feeling of sweetness, citrus
33 cl bottle. Pours a cloudy golden with white lasting head. Aroma of hay and alcohol. Taste is slightly bitter. Palate is medium body and smooth. Overall very good beer.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2017 Bouteille 33. Belle couleur jaune claire. Mousse abondante et persistante. Odeurs fraîches dagrumes notamment le citron. Amertume très agréable avec des notes complexes de fruits et dépices (coriandre ?) pas du tout agressifs. Bière ronde et gouleyante : un must de chez Chimay... mais peut-être un peu trop de mousse ! :-)))

- Very strong grapefruit flavor
- Long lasting foam

Very refreshing

___________________________________
___________________________________
Bouteille. Arôme de banane et de bacon (oui oui) (il faudrait que jen déguste une nouvelle pour redécouvrir les arômes). Bière assez forte, amer, bien houblonné, levurée. Triple efficace.

De color dorado y espuma blanca, de media retención que deja encaje.
Aromas a hierba seca, algo de manzana y levadura.
Cuerpo medio y bastante carbonatada.
En boca especiada, con recuerdos a vino blanco y final bastante seco.
Bottle. Body is golden with generous white head and fine bubbles. Nose is belgian yeast and hops, fruity. Taste is yeasty and fruits. Excellent tripel beer.
Very nice trappistbeer, and my favorite Chimay compared to the Red and Blue varieties. Fresh but complex taste with spicy hoptones.
Color oro, turbia, espuma abundante. Aroma a fruta. Se nota alta carbonatacion, sabor a fruta, toques a plátano, dulce. Muy recomendable.

High quality offering. For me, best as a summer complement to sweet BBQ.

Served: Direct pour Chimay goblet: Temp: approx 50 deg.
Appearance: Golden, slightly hazy, effervescent, some sediment.
Aroma: Pleasant, aromatic fruitiness. Not a distinct fruit.
Mouthfeel: Full bodied snd crisp. Effervescence almost soda-like.
Aftertaste: Very clean with slightly sweet/ fruity finish.
Overall: Very drinkable and best as complement to food with sweeter qualities. Worked well with BBQ chicken.

Amberkleurig bier met witte wandklevende schuimkraag. Van t vat gedronken en zo smaakt hij voor mij het best. Geur: gist en bitterig en klein beetje peper. Smaak: mooie strakke bitterheid. Goede carbonatie en niet te volmondig. Droog bittere afdronk. Dit bier doet me heel even denken aan het bittertje, het pepertje en het mondgevoel zoals een verse Orval vroeger kon zijn voor het zuurtje kwam piepen.
Yeasty aroma with spices and fruits. Taste of the same, but with malts as well. The taste starts bitter and fresh, then turns to more sweet, before a quiq bitter ending. Very nice!

Bomber into wine glass. Brassy, with fine, thick white head that lingers. Hops in the nose, with a touch of sweet raisins and wheat. A touch of bitterness in the mouth balances the continued gritty sweetness. Finishes crisp and with a touch of lingering hops. Delicious!

33cl bottle, served in trappist chalice. Poured a beautiful radiating amber with a two finger white head. Aromas of hops, sweet candy, caramel, fruits, lemon. Taste pretty much a continuation of the aromas: hoppy, fruity, slightly bitter in the mouth. Medium body, drinks smoothly away with a bittersweet finish. Overall a damn good tripel.
Bottle from Albert Hein Netherlands. Pours orange amber with big white head and carbonation. Aroma is citrus and hops. Taste is bitter and mouthfeel is dry and crisp.

On tap @ Expo 2015, Milano. Lintensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è discreta. Il cappello di schiuma a bollicine fini con carbonazione media diventa presto una velatura ma si fa ricordare come pizzo sul vetro. Il colore è giallo dorato. Il corpo è strutturato ma duttile. Lamaro è deciso con aggiunta di un po di umami. Lintensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è godereccio. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono luppolate. Il finale è amarognolo e complesso. Il retrogusto è intenso.

20.12.2015-Flasche-0,33L.rötlich-gelb, fast klar, fast weisser Schaum.Schwebende Sedimentteile ( trotz vorsichtigen Einschenkens) .Aroma hefig, leicht phenolisch/alkoholisch. Antrunk spritzig, leicht fruchtig, blumig, kräuterig, zitronig.
Pours hazy orange, with a white head. Smells citrusy, of bread and of Belgian yeast. The taste is bitter and refreshing, with high carbonation and a bitter-sweet aftertaste.

Aromat intensywny, głównie owoce, cytrusy, w tle przyprawy. Kolor miodowy, mętne. Piana drobnopęcherzykowa, obfita, szybko opada do otoczki przy krawędzi. W smaku owocowa słodycz, przyprawy i lekka nuta chmielowa. Wyraźna, dosyć wysoka, alkoholowa goryczka, piwo lekko grzeje w przełyk. Wysycenie wysokie. Bardzo dobre.

Bottle from Drinkshop. One of the smoother and easier drinking tripels. The spiciness of the yeast and the alcohol coming from the sugar use are not over the top - rather at a moderate intensity, which leaves the beer balanced. But it is a tripel sure enough. Also some honeyish notes, I get a bit of hemp, herbal hoppiness. A good one definitely.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2016 Pours hazy golden with thick white head. Nose is spicy. Aromas are sweet malt,spices (especially pepper), fruits, freshly cut grass and alcohol. Lively carbonation, medium body. Long bitter and alcoholic finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour. Full bodied but still somehow flat in flavor. Pours a cloudy yellow. Aroma is particularly flat

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle - yeasty orange aroma. Sparkling golden amber with thick foamy white head. Hit of alcohol straight away - rest over powered. Triple still not by drink.

Bottle @ friends/don. Appearance: pours hazyamber/orange with hood soapy off-white head and lacing. aroma/taste: bread, brown sugar, caramel, grass and lots of fruity notes. palette strong yeasty aroma, average to sparkling carbonation, medium body, average to notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by a medium bitterness, average duration and an oily texture. Overall: nice and well balanced tripple.

330ml bottle. Pours a cloudy golden body with a white head - lots of bubbles on the side of the glass. Floral aroma and quite a complex taste caramel, citrus and bitter finish. Be warned this is very drinkable and you dont notice the alcohol level until its too late!
Nogal een zware tripel, een stevig bier dus. Een diepe zware afdronk, zeer traag te drinken.
Bottle from Hop City Birmingham. Pours golden color with white head. Aroma of hops and yeast. Tastes of raisins and slightly bitter hops. Bitter, hoppy aftertaste. Medium bodied. Excellent beer
Het is een lekkere tripel, pittig in de smaak, aanwezige smaak van typerend Belgisch gist en een lichte hint van zeewier/ziltigheid. Backlog from 2015/02/17.
Amber, hazy great head. Very fizzy. Aroma: hay, yeasty, spices and flowers. Light to medium body, semi sweet. Yeasty with alcoholic finish.

Cloudy amber pour with almost no head - not inspiring. However, along comes an amazing nose of yeast, caramel, ripe fruits. Taste isnt as intriguing, but nice yeast and malt come through - though a little watery. Wish this tasted like it smelled.

banana, bubblegum (most prominent), alcohol (quite gentle), grass (very gentle). enjoyed it a lot more than the red, slightly less than the blue. slightly amber, beautifully hazy, nice white foam, minimal head, ok retention.
taste is light to medium bitterness that is very smooth, bubblegum, banana, some gentle alcohol that is well hidden. light body, slick feel, creamy, left a fluffy impression in the mouth during and after each sip.lively carbonation, long finish that is slightly sweet and bitter, still some creaminess. That fluffiness is quite amazing. 
Overall a very nice beer that lives up to its intentions of being drinkable and hiding its alcohol well. The taste and mouthfeel were nice, the aroma could be more developed though. Nicely balanced.

Cor de mel, ligeiramente turva. Espuma abundante e persistente. Aroma de mel, caramelo, passas e especiarias, todas se estendendo ao sabor adocicado, um pouco alcoólico, que tem ainda uma leve nota cítrica e um retrogosto com final amargo.
Golden, slightly hazy, a lot of foam. Grass and coriander aroma. Dry, yet fruity tast. Dry bitterness lingering.
Really not up to the rating. Decent but nothing special. Wish I had bought something else for the money.

0.33 bottle from sm.
Slightly hazy orange with big off white dense. Head drops to 0.5cm and lasts till the end. Nose is sweet, sugary maltiness, yeasty spice notes, bread, very light tartness, very welcoming! Taste is what you would expect from the aroma but more hoppy than sweet. Light caramel and candy sugar notes, spice notes maybe from yeast and hops. Aftertaste is reminiscent of the malt body and mainly hoppy. Dry, medium carbonation, medium body, very good brew...

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

,33l pour from room-temp bottle into a footed pils glass in Almaty, Kazakhstan. Pours a hazy dark orange with ample carbonation and a big foamy white head. The nose is amazing. Sweet, fruity, citrusy, almost a soda-y sweetness. Full body, a little sticky, thick. Taste is great. Fruity, citrus, some honeydew, honey sweetness, floral notes, some bitter hoppy herby taste. All around a great beer.
O que falar de uma chimay? Simplesmente sensacional! Aroma frutado e muito agradável. Cor avermelhada e espuma densa, perfeita! Sabor marcante com amargor na medida certa. Trapppistes!

L: pours a cloudy bronzed orange with a huge pillowy off-white head. 
S: a modest aroma that recalls a bakery in the morning, bread and yeast, very pleasant. Hints of white grape and a slight alcohol note. 
T: very nice hoppy taste with Belgian yeast, phenolic tinge, citrus notes, spiced at the end, lights fruits. So well balanced. 
F: the malt is quite chewy, the body is reasonably light and hides the ABV well, nice peppery carbonation across the palate. 
O: great drinking, one of the classic tripels, shouldnt be understated. Another please.

Pours amber with large white head. Sweet citrus and possibly caramel or raisin, as well as bitter hoppy in the mouth, while the most prominent flavour in the finish is bitter hops (but is not dominant). Full and bready in texture. Nice

Botella. @Paco´s Beer, Oviedo. 01/11/2015 BBD: 12/2018
Color amarillo,sabor dulce, levadura, una gran cerveza.

Pours beautiful clear amber with persistent frothy off-white head. Aroma of esters, caramel, flowery hops. Taste is sweet and light sour, light bitter finish. Medium body, alcohol well inserted. Great tripel.

the bottle I drank was cellared by me for over 8 years. The cork had a stamp of 11/06. we drank it on sept.30 2015. wow. smooth, very mild yeast and fruit but complex vanilla/butterscotch/caramel, with a hint of nuts. sip and savor. color was an amber/copper. one of the most amazing ales Ive ever drank. have numerous chimays over the years and this was the ultimate.
Prima tripel. Heel subtiel, niet te uitgesproken, en juist daarom zo goed.
En ok trappistøl fra Chimay - men er ikke i nærheden af dem blå's storhed.

Ambar opaco con buena espuma y aherencia. Lúpulo floral-especiado alto, malta maltoso caramelo moderado, licoroso moderado, ésteres ligeros a fruto seco. En boca, lúpulo floral alto, licoroso moderado, malta maltoso caramelo moderado, buen balance. Final maltoso-licoroso, sin astringencia, prolongado, buena carbonatación y con cuerpo. Excelente cerveza.
Bottle. Creamy white foam, light amber colour. Clove, muscat and yeast aroma, slightly bitter start with sweet caramel aftertaste, litte bit spicy. This beer is very smooth and quite elegant.
Gosh I never rated this. Cloudy golden pour into trappist glass. Fruit, a bit of spice, some sugar, a pretty decent trip.
Duft krydret sødlig koriander lidt masipan smag meget det samme god humle smag lidt citrus og græs

33cl bottle at home. pours a hazy light amber with a big white head and leaves lacing. aromas of yeast, citrus/lemongrass, grain. taste is malty and hoppy with notes of citrus, caramel, i guess coriander. the finish is fairly bitter and spicy

25 oz bottle The ale poured a light amber with a huge white head and lacing. This is a very smooth ale This was enjoyed at a bachelor party in NMB. The ale was dry yet having a spicy bite. It was surprisingly drinkable for me where Belgian ales normally are difficult to consume. The ale had a medium body with average carbonation. The finish was modestly yeasty.

Cor laranja, turva e com algum brilho. Espuma branca dr altas formação e persistência com lacing razoavel.
Aroma,perceptível logo ao abrir a garrafa, intenso de leveduras com um toque lupulado dando um suave aroma de folhas de limoeiro.
Sabor seguindo o aroma, picante desde o início com final de picância mais acentuada, seco e levemente amargo; retrogosto picante e levemente adstringente. Corpo médio e alta carbonatação.

Aroma is clove, lemon grass, wild yeast and slight sulphur. Taste is sweet malts with a fairly strong tartiness. Matching taste to aroma essentially. Pretty refreshing and smooth for its abv. Appearance is a cloudy gold with a fluffy pillow head that retains fairly well.

Pours amber/golden with a lot of jead, which stays for some time in an appropriatr glass. Aroma is of caramel, yeast and barley. Full, heavy aroma. Taste is full, well bodied and not complex. The body of the beer makes it unique and excellwnt with a sour aftertaste.

Złote, mętne piwo o obfitej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w postaci sporej warstewki na powierzchni. Aromat przyjemny, jasne owoce, gruszka, winogrona. W smaku także mocno owocowe, lekko szczypiące w język. Goryczka średnia. Ogólnie bardzo dobry tripel, wysoka półka, mocno owocowe, alkohol rewelacyjnie ukryty, pije się dość lekko..

Gold Beer with a big white cup, high carbonation.
Tastes very malty, wheat, bitter hops, alcohol, yeasty character and something fruity.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2016 Arancio dorato, velata, ampia schiuma pannosa biancastra. Intenso aroma dolce e con note speziate, agrumi. Al palato malto dolce, continuano le spezie, retrogusto amaro pulito. Finale pulito. Perfetta carbonazione. Alcol ben supporta la bevuta. Grande tripel

Pours a cloudy dirty yellow with a foamy white head that disappears quickly. Aroma of wheat and bread dough. Nice body, clings to the glass, almost syrupy. The taste is concentrated on the center of the tongue. Its not harsh, not sweet or bitter. It has a bread dough taste from the yeast which is not unpleasant. Fairly smooth with just a slight warmth and tingle from the alcohol. Didnt love it or hate it but I did enjoy it. Somewhat similar to the taste of a German Hefeweizen with a little more body.

bottle. Pours hazy orange Lovely spiced yeasty and caramel malty aroma.
 oft caramel flavoured with a small spice 
.Goes into a more yeast and spice dominated flavour.
 Ends slight bitter and spiced. 
. A great beer that I enjoy on a regular basis.

Karamellige Farbe, stark schäumend - übrig bleibt eine feine Schaumschicht
Buttrig fruchtiger gout Buttergeschmack bleibt im Gaumen
Tolles Preis/Leistungs-Verhältniss

Light sweet malt nose with yeast tones.
syrupy light malt taste that combines with the hops and yeast to give a 
cloying waxy finish.
Seems like a typical trappist triple and not for me.

Hazy golden with thick creamy head. Yeasty and spicy, but subdued and only slightly fruity compared to other tripels. Slightly sweet, dry and lightly alcoholic finish. Average carbonation, rich smooth palate. Good body and palate but somewhat subdued aromas.
Just found some ancient incomplete notes with numerical values. Amazing beer.
330ml bottle at home. Very good Belgian tripel. Good foamy head and fruity aftertaste.
Aroma is sweet malts with banana and yeast. Taste is malty and spicy with a yeasty character. Sweet in the finish with a lovely mild bitterness. Splendid brew.

Laranja escura, espuma de boa formação, longa persistência. Aroma caramelizado, malte evidente, lúpulo mais aparente que nas outras Chimay. Paladar alcoólico, malte caramelado. Aftertaste de média intensidade, licor, chocolate.

On tap in a local bar in Lille - Color: clear blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: caramel and malt domination. Sweet and and floral notes. Taste: full body, with domination of caramel and malt taste. Very sweet and good alcohol finish. Aftertaste: nice bitterness with caramel and sweet alcohol.
