UPDATED: FEB 26, 2016 Plutôt intéressante.Bière tout à fait singulière : le côté triple se ressent bien par une belle rondeur miel soutenue par une certaine présence d?alcool.Mais pas seulement : on trouve un côté "weizen" et de fait après vérification on y trouve bien du blé à la tradition allemande.Dernière chose : sa texture. Extraordinairement épaisse en bouche ! Très agréable.

07/07/2015, 33cl bottle @ Orient express, Brussels North.
Hazy blond with nice thick white head. Grains, some citrus, banana, bitter hops en very light sweetness

Bottle, 33 cl. Hazy light orange body with a big, foamy, white head. Aroma has notes of fruit and spices. Rich medium-sweet taste with medium bitterness and lots of spicy and fruity notes. The alcohol is quite perceptible and adds some warmth. Light body. Lively carbonation. Long finish with alcohol and some bitterness. This is a very good tripel but the alcohol is too apparent for my taste.

Bottle, vinmonopolet. Sweet caramel, dried apricot, notes of herbal hops on the nose. Golden amber, hazy, small head. Medium sweetness, lightly bitter, taste of raisins, dried fruits, mild but nice bitterness in the aftertaste. Light/medium body, nice texture on top of lively carbonation. Classic triple, pairs very good with cheese and fat fish.

Aromat przyjemnie słodki, estrowy, intensywny. Wysycenie bardzo wysokie. W smaku słodkie, lekko alkoholowe, lepkie, gęste. Początkowa słodycz zrównoważona solidną goryczką - chmielową i alkoholową. Piwo z słodkiego staje się zdecydowanie wytrawne.Dobry ale nie najlepszy tripel.
Hazy golden with soapy white head. Aroma of malts and citrus, taste offers a odd mutation from sweet caramel into bitter hops in a second. A classic great ale!
On tap at the Cork & Tap at Bellevue Village QFC. Delicious, easy drinking Trappist Trippel. Perfect carbonation. Chimay does not disappoint.
Keg at spitfire. Pours hazy yellow, nose is caramel, toffee, light fruit, taste is similar, dry.

Pours a hazy golden body with white head. Aroma is citrus-ish. Tastes of yeast, caramel, a bit bitter hops and some maltyness. The 8% alcohol is also dominating the flavour. You?ll be willing to do a monk after finishing one or two of these.

A bit hazy, golden color with huge fluffy head. Intense yeast aroma with sweet hints. Taste has also all the belgian yeast specific esters. Bubblegum and boozy fruits come to my mind. Carbonation is on the high side and alcohol is a bit too present for my taste.
God smag af tripel, den har varme fra alkoholen, og har en karamel smag også over sig.
Awesome Tripel. In my perspective, this is what a tripel should taste like! Yeasty, citrus tones and some creamyness...
Bottle 33 cl. A hazy amber colour with a small frothy head. An aroma of bread, hay, citrus, herbs and alcohol. The taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter. Low carbonation.

Golden with a big white foamy head. Slightly fruity aroma. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Dry aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2015-05-03 Great beer. A real trappist with a very nice taste. I recommend it.

Very bubbly beer with durable white foam. It has a refreshing scent of light soft fruit, yeast and light malt. It has many yeast residues at the bottom, but it does not scare me to get those extra vitamins in my glass.
The taste is tart, characterized by citrus and fullness. The taste of yeast are not around, like malt and hops are in fine balance. The alcohol is present and leave a little warmth in the mouth. Its a really nice triple, though in terms of taste it is in the light end.

hay, alcohol, hazy golden with a soapy head at first. some bitterness ,has a lot of sediment going around in the bottle so keep it upright if your do not want all that yeast. A decent triple that tastes like a triple.

Bottle 75 cl from Systembolaget
hay, bread, citrus, grass, alcohol, earthy, pale, golden, cloudy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

Deep golden, cloudy, beautiful creamy head, perfect lacing. Spicy aroma of Belgian yeast. Fruity. Grainy malts in the background. Fine. Medium body. No alcoholic feel. The flavour is malty, spicy. Smooth bitterness growing to the ending. Surprisingly refreshing for that ABV. Delicous. Not very complex but very elegant. Excellent.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 one of the my favorite beers. hazy golden color with big head. aroma is citrusy, malty, barnyard and earthy. taste is very complex. well balanced. aftertaste is slightly bitter and acrid. delicious!
Golden, little hazy, big white head. Some citrus aroma, lots of fruits, sweet caramel. medium-heavy body, but not too sweet. Fruits and malt character. Some bitter finish. Tasty
330ml bottle. Golden orange-amber color with white head. Yeasty aroma, spicy, light hoppy fruity and malty. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Heerlijke triple. Staat op het zelfde niveau als mijn favoriet karmeliet. Lange afdronk. Heerlik fris citrusvruchten.
Grape-peach aroma with a mature peach, bread and candy taste. Is a perfect beer, just two sweet for me ;-)

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2016 
Aroma:

Malts, caramel, honey, Belgian yeast, fruit and spices.

Appearance:

Hazy/turbid golden/amber beer with a large white head.

Taste/Palate:


Taste/Palate:
Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, honey,  Belgian yeast and fruit; ends slightly dry with toast and spices.
Hazy orange almost wheat beer apperance yeasty esters it may be sacralidge but I prefer the red and blue chimays alcohol very present

Líquido turvo,coloração dourada escura,espuma magnífica,alta,cremosa e duradoura;aroma delicioso,aparecendo malte,fermento,lúpulo,notas cítricas e condimentos;sabor equilibrado com uma boa base de malte e uma carga de lúpulos generosa,dando um final seco e amargo,álcool notado tanto no aroma quanto no sabor,porem bem inserido,corpo médio/alto.

Amazing. I was so upset I only purchased one. Sipped slowly and couldnt fault it. If I could only drink one beer for the rest of my life this would be on the shortlist. Hundreds of other reviews will describe the other facets my advice is simply: Buy it, you will enjoy

Cerveza muy interesante. Lo primero que sorprende es la densa capa de espuma con una textura muy agradable. Olor suave y discreto. El gusto es excelente, con algunas notas afrutadas pero con un final seco y ligeramente amargante. Interesante método y tradición de elaboración.

330ml bottle, Chimay chalice glass. Grapefruit & herbal aroma, Cloudy golden liquor, Bitter-sweet Fruity, taste, Medium body and carbonation, Foamy white head, Oily texture, Belgian yeasty with hints of honey and toffee, Complex taste. Thumbs up!

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange with a huge, long lasting, off-white head that laces. Sweet, fruity aroma with caramel malt, yeast and spice. Sweet flavour of dried fruit, caramel malt and yeast with a dry, bitter, spicy, alcohol finish. Medium body with a smooth, creamy texture and average carbonation.

Bottle:
Pours cloudy, amber-brown with a tall, off-white head.
Caramel-apple, peach, fruit aroma.
Taste is slightly bready, apple, yeasty,
Nearly candy-sweet and sticky...malty...
Very good.

last beer i had with cam in zly casy at the weekend. i think this was also 1 or 2 years old. pours hazy honey orange colour with a white head. aroma of raisins, trifle, coriander and spices. tastes of delicious malts, candy sugar, bubblegum. the aging seemed to have mellowed the hops and herb flavours, which i liked. finish was long and dry. fantastic, and i can only assume all the better for the time its been bottled up
Amber with a thick white head. Rich dried fruit smell with a slight malt finish. Full fruit finish with a minty after finish.

33cl. BBE 2017. Golden hazy with white head and beautiful lacing. Aroma of yeast and mild hops. Soft and smooth. Very easy drinking at all temperatures. Not my go to beer from Chimay, but this one is really refreshing on a hot day.

On-tap at World of Beer in WPB. Poured into a Chimay goblet. How authentic. Golden straw colored with a big fluffy white head that never really goes away. Golden straw colored with a big fluffy white head that never really goes away. A blast of yeastiness, but much more dominated by the fruit notes. Honey sweetness midrange and a bready finish. Delicious, but lacks the complexity of other tripels. Some tripels have an intense dryness that makes me feel thirsty even while drinking it. This one isnt so dry, but its still present. Light bodied, but thats what I expect from a tripel. One of my old gateway craft beers that I still enjoy from time to time.
Huge white head, good lacing. Rich fruity, spicy, yeasty aroma, sweet spicy taste balanced by bitterness of hops and noble alcohol. Classic tripel.

Espuma media (2-3 dedos) poco duradera, Turbia de color ambar medio. Aroma ligeramente alcohólico. Compleja. Dulzón inicial, que sigue con especias y regusto a fruta tropical (mango?) y naranja en el paladar, para dejar un final muy seco y amargo que redondea el conjunto. Muy agradable en paladar con indudable cuerpo. Gran triple
Pours a cloudy yellow with white lacing. Smell is woody with a citrus note. Taste is close to the smell with an acidic finish. Not as sweet as most Belgians but still a very nice beer.
Bottle at family party. Coryander, spices, banana, yeast, some hops. I used to like this, but my palate has changed so much to the American styles that I tend to dislike it now.
Aroma: Clearly the coriander. After a while I notice the cara malts and the yeasty esters. Taste: Mostly coriander, caramel and peppery. Chimay beers are not my favourites.

Pours copper color with a little haze and a big tight heAd that lingers leaving a minute amount of lace on glass. Smells of raisins, prunes,dates and spices.Tastes of yeast,spices,caramel, and alcohol. Big body, hot mouthfeel, good carbonation, and a sweet and spicy finish. It is good but not great. I like the red more.

330 ml bottle. Pours a clear mid copper turning cloudy after sediment is disrupted, good initial head but fades to cap. Yeast and spice on the nose with some baked, stewed/concentrated fruit. Stewed fruits follow onto the palate with a lot of warm spice. Definite sour note and some definite bittering/drying on the finish. Pretty high carbonation carries everything through. Very refined triple.

Sporych rozmiarów sycząca piana, średnio i grubo pęcherzykowa, szybko opada nieznacznie znacząc przy tym szkło, barwa pomarańczowa, mętna. W aromacie klasycznie jak na Tripla przystało - estry owocowe (brzoskwinie, morele, czerwone porzeczki, rodzynki i winogrona), lekka przyprawowość i kwiatowość, troszkę melanoidyn w postaci świeżego chleba. Przyjemnie, orzeźwiająco i zachęcająco. W smaku dość słodkie, z tym, że jest to zdecydowanie słodycz owocowa, jest sporo ziołowo-pieprznych nut, które w połączeniu ze średnio-wysokim szampańskim nagazowaniem sprawiają wrażenie pikantności. W kontrze fajna chmielowo-korzenno-pestkowa goryczka, niezwykle miła, krótka. W afterteasie dojrzałe banany, miód i domowe wino z głogu (a może poncz?) przyjemnie rozgrzewające w przełyku. 
Fantastyczny trunek - z jednej strony orzeźwiający i lekki, idealny na lato i ciepłe dni, z drugiej treściwy, złożony i degustacyjny na jesienne słoty czy wiosenne burze. Bez wątpienia klasyk godny polecenia!
Een erg goede tripel. Mooie gouden kleur. Volle schuimkraag. Heerlijk bier en niet te sterk. Lekkere frisse smaak van cirtusvruchten en een geweldige afdronk. Doe mij er nog maar een bitte sehr.
From Hipercor San Juan de Aznalfarache. Playing KB Dark Side, in La Trappe chalice. Its a great beer but not my favourite chimay. Alcohol y a bit more noticiable here than desiderable.
On tap. Hazy gold with thin white head. Aromas of clove and banana. Flavors of sweet malt, banana, clove and fruity esters. Finishes with black pepper. Creamy mouthfeel. Very, very nice.

De couleur mi-blonde mi-ambrée. Beaucoup de fines bulles émanent du fond de mon verre vers la surface. Curieusement, que retrouve-t-on à la surface? Presque rien. La mousse sest évaporée en un clin doeil. Jai rarement vu des bières belges sestomper (en surface) de la sorte. Le nez est plutôt beurré et épicé. Les levures font parfaitement leur travail; je perçois même de la banane et un joli côté sauvage qui ne me déplaît pas. En bouche, la signature belge est exemplaire: levurée à fond - avec ces levures belges que lon connaît et dont on ne se lasse jamais vraiment, la bière est délicate et lalcool y est discrète. Puissante mais douce, cette bière mérite dêtre dégustée lentement.

Pours two fingers of head on a hazy straw body.
The aroma is floral, a little earthy and cereal.
The taste has mild sweetness, a bite of bitter, good balance.
The texture is airy and fizzy, wonderful.
Really enjoyable.

S:
-pepper,coriander,lemon,honey,peach
T:
-Foll the nose plus a grapefruit note
-medium,long-lasting bitterniss
O:
-One of the best Tripels in the world

Hazy orange w/ beautiful bounteous head that persists. Lacing. Aroma of bread-like yeast. Medicinal, herbal quality emanating from esters? Maybe some banana and honey. Sweet malt dissolving quickly into a peppery, sharp hop bite that lingers. World-class.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2015 21-12-2015 Delft

Lekkere triple. Troebele donker oranje kleur met redelijk veel schuim. Vrij zoet maar mist wel een onderscheidende smaak, qua aroma heel vlak. Smaak slaat geleidelijk over in een bittere afdronk die lang blijft hangen.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Aperta il 07/05/2016, imbottigliata nel 2014, bottiglia da 33 cl.
Dorata carica, velata dai lieviti in sospensione, schiuma bianca di buona persistenza.
Al naso uva passa, note di mela, albicocca e vino bianco, coriandolo, chiodi di garofano, note erbacee e paglierine.
Al palato speziata dal lievito belga, caramello, uva passa, vinosa; è caratterizzata anche da un lievissimo erbaceo, sul finale coda amara erbacea piacevole mista a lieve piccante etilico.
Corpo medio-pieno, ben carbonata.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2016 Turvo alaranjada como espuma densa, generoso e duradoura. Notas citricas, pao e fermentos,  e talvez coentro. Condimento bem presente, bastante picante e bem carbonatada, com corpo medio . Amargor mÃ©dio e lupulo aromÃ¡tico predominantemente. O alcool e menos perceptivel  ao paladar q no aroma, o que demonstra uma insercao fabtastica para os 8%. 

Aromas cítricos/Herbal e álcool ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is pineapple hops with bealigian homts, taste is quite goos and complex as well. Ok its simple but you can sens high lvl in many levels

Aromat: lekko fenolowe, z muśnięciem ziołowości chmielu i alkoholem
Wygląd: ogromna piana, szybko dziurkująca, mętne złoto.
Smak: owocowo-ziołowa baza, z fajną lekko cytrusową goryczką. Alkohol nieźle ukryty. 
Bardzo solidny Tripel - ciężko się do czegoś przyczepić.
Nice aroma orange color lot of foam taste a bit sour could be the yeast had beter for sure

Tasted in Brussels.
Quite a nice tripel this one, but Ive had several better.
Draft. Cloudy, amber, generous head. Somewhat complex flavors, but hard to describe. Kind of boring finish.
UPDATED: OCT 21, 2016 Aroma and taste are very similar to those of a witbier. Not bad, but I like the sweeter Chimay beers way more.

Bottle 0,33.
Golden color. Fruity, yeasty aroma. Sour. Long bitter aftertaste. Refreshing.

0.33 bottle. Cloudy, amber color and a medium, white head. Complex aroma: flowers, honey, citruses, spices, resin, delicate coriander, and unfortunate skunky notes. Taste is obviously sweet, again honey and flowers though the other flavors are less perceptible. Medium body, slick texture, and above average carbonation. Finish is not as complex as the aroma, one might even call it simplistic in comparison; introduces a delicate bitterness. Overall quite a good beer, yet it pales in comparison to its Red and Blue brothers.

Golden sparkling hazy body and a thick rocky white head. Nice fresh and sweet aroma of apricot, spruce, honey, cereal. The taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long bitter finish. Sticky and creamy texture.

Dourada e turva com boa formação de espuma densa de longa duração. No aroma notas frutadas e cítricas, nuances de abacaxi são percebidos, assim como especiarias e o malte. O sabor é bem condimentado e levemente apimentado, as demais notas surgem na sequencia. Corpo médio, final longo e bem carbonatada. No retrogosto é possível perceber algumas especiarias e um agradável amargor. Um clássico, cheers!!!
Great hoppy aroma with almost acidic undertones. Freshness. Like it better than the red Cimay.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 A wonderful tripel. Loads of carbonation. Made me burp almost immediately. So light like a cloud at times. Perfect balance of crisp yeast and hop bitterness as well as delicate fruit (apricot or grapes) undertones. Very dry finish. Lots sticking around on your palate. At times like a white wine. Banana or bubblegum in the aroma. Leaves your mouth super oily. Terrific. Why did it take me so long to drink this? On tap at a Belgian beer festival in Budapest.
Gylden brun klar med lavt hvitt skum. Lukter frukt, belgisk gjær og lett karamell. Smaker karamell, lett anis, noe bitterhet. Kjenner også alkoholen. Fyldig søt avslutning.

Dal colore dorati-arancio quasi ambrato, leggermente velato, con riflessi dorati, si presenta con una bella schiuma bianca abbondante, molto fine, quasi cremosa, con lunghissima persistenza. Al naso è una goduria: note molte floreali (fiori bianchi) e leggermente speziate sono conferite dai nobili lieviti trappisti. Al palato arriva abbastanza carbonata ma con un corpo sopra la media. Al gusto invece ritroviamo le note floreali e speziate, seguite da unottima luppolatura, quasi sorprendente. Il sorso è molto rotondo, per nulla secco, con un amaro finale dai connotati molto profumati ed erbacei, per una buona persistenza.

0,75l Flasche. Goldenes Bier mit schnell schwindender Schaumkrone. Riecht nach Caramel, Vanille und Malz. Schmeckt leicht süßlich nach Malz, Caramel und Coriander. Im Nachgeschmack kommt noch eine leichte Hopfenbittere.
golden beer,hops, coriander good but not a great, i think the chimay blue is the best from this brewery overall

Uitgeschonken in Chimay bokaal, goudblond troebel bier, met volle witte schuimkraag. De schuimkraag heeft een romige structuur, en zakt na enkele minuten terug tot een fijne schuimring. Het bier geeft aroma's vrij van gedroogd fruit en specerijen. De smaak van deze Tripel is net als bij de andere Chimay Trappist bieren, zacht en heeft een uitstekend gebalanceerd smaakpallet. Eerst gedroogd fruit, vooral rozijnen, daarna de kruidigheid van specerijen die kenmerkend zijn voor een tripel; koriander, nootmuskaat en iets kaneel. De afdronk is licht zoet en met een aangename hop bitterheid. Zoals alle Trappist bieren is de Chimay Tripel, weer van uitstekende kwaliteit. Mooie complexe tripel, behoort tot de betere Belgische tripel bieren.

One of my favourite Trappist beers. I dont know why but I love this beer very much. 

Bottle both 33cl and 75cl. 

Pours a white thick head equals to 2-3 fingers and it is very persistent. 

Smell: Very fruity and spicy. Muscat grape, citrus, herbal hop notes. 

Taste: In addition to the flavours I noted in the smell, I detected hints of honey. Lemon and orange notes are also available. Good finish with sweet and herbal notes.
33cl bottle. Pours golden color with big creamy head. Aroma of fruits and yeast. Taste is fruity, spicy with light bitterness in the end. Medium bitterish aftertaste. Nice beer.

Bottle bought at Delhaize. 
Pours hazy golden with a medium white head.
Taste is alcoholic, sweet taste with a bitter aftertaste.
Отличны& крепкий бельгий& эль, ароматн& и вкусный, хотя, на мой взгляд, несколь& уступаю& синему Шимэ.

Foam: white medium to large head
Colour: hazy orange gold to copper colour
Aroma: yeast and sweet caramel malt, raisin fruity notes, create the rich aroma, moderate spice 
Taste: sweet candied sugar, banana, bread malts and some light apple, pear, hops and light citrus flavours, moderate bitter with a little lasting spice coriander, cinnamon, warming finish, complex and well developed, very good beer
SB Malmö hansakompaniet, flaska. Vacker vetefärg (mit hefe). SLUT hos Sauronbolaget. Kommer inte åter. Tilltalande. Ohyggligt lättdrucken.

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 2017, Pours almost clear golden liquid, medium frothy white, head, Aroma: Belgian phenol, candied fruits, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, dry, Belgian phenols, candied fruits, yeasty, malty, quite hopy, Palate: medium to full body, oily texture, average to lively carbonation, long bitter aftertaste, Overall: quite good, nice drinkabilitry, enjoyed.

Draft at Delirum café Brussels.
Amber, white medium head.
Aroma: Caramel and oat.
Taste: Medium body, slightly bitter and medium sweet. Long nice finish
Sample at en öl och whiskymässa 2015, Göteborg. Hazy yellow with white head, Yeast, pepper, spices, herbs, alcohol. Very nice yeast forward Belgian beer.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2015 330ml bottle dated best before end of 2017 and poured into a Chimay goblet. It poured a hazy copper colour with a two finger cream head that has good retention leaving a thick curtain lacing. There were initial aromas of apple, pear and bready malts followed by sweet banana and honey. Surprisingly strong alcohol taste, but also sweet candied sugar, banana, bread malts and some light apple and pear flavours. It was medium bodied with medium carbonation and a creamy feel. Im a big fan of Chimay, but this was not one of the better tripel beers. Ultimately I thought that it was too boozy and everything just kind of got lost behind that.

Gotta love those Trappist beers, especially when your girlfriend handpicks them for you. From the bottle, this poured a hazy orange-gold appearance, with plenty of fluffy head. Candy yeast and sweet caramel malt, along with sweet pear and raisin fruity notes, constitute the rich and complex aroma. Taste has the same flavors as just listed, along with a light hoppy bitterness, as advertised. Medium bodied and lower carbonation. Very fresh tasting, moderate flavor intensity makes for a good beer to pair with food. A positive introduction to the Chimay line.

Chimay uit de fles. Net als de blauwe variant een enorme schuimkraag. Smaak is lekker fris/ fruitig met een zoete afdronk die redelijk snel weg is. Komt voor mij dicht in de buurt bij mijn hoog gewaardeerde la chouffe

Has a darker golden appearance, a somewhat hazy look. Lots of carbonation. Huge thick foamy head. Aromas of hops and malts. Taste is citrus, hops, some spices. Mouthfeel is yeasty, some sediments are quite visible. This is pretty good stuff, I would drink again for sure. The 8% abv is quite deceiving.

Pours hazy golden with a thick creamy head. Body is medium with moderate carbonation. The nose is fruit driven with moderate spice. Taste is quite similar with moderate clove and fruits. It finishes with a sharp bitterness without any lingering. Great beer

Colore dorato, schiuma cremosa.
Odore fruttato e caramellato. Corposa, sapore dolce e fruttato (qualcosa che ricorda lo spumante), finale secco.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Tumbler Supplier: Géant Casino (Béziers). Pours cloudy amber with significant head. Malty taste.
Golden colour - aroma and flavours of barley, yeasts, herbs, spices and some fruits. Low carbonation, medium bitternes, especialy on finish. An average triple.

Hazy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, clove, hops, & citrus; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, fruit, spice, hops, and light citrus; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Good classic tripel.
Mooi koper-goud biertje met een rijke schuimkraag. Intense smaak met fruit, kruiden gist.

Pours a hazy gold with a foamy white head and lacing. It has a rich aroma with spicy hops, raisins and stone fruit, coriander, and malt. The flavor is spicy fruit and malt up front with a coriander, cinnamon, and malt backbone followed by a dry finish over a medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

DWG; Drunk at Cardinal. Bottle 0,33 L. Pours large, cloudy golden with a forever lasting and tons lacings off-white head. Nose is yeasty, citrus fruity, hay and sweet fruit, light malt, caramel and spice. Taste is sweet and moderate bitter with a lasting spice, warming finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft.

Golden, medium-bodied, thick ivory head.
Nice aromas of red apple, pastry, toffee, a balsamic tinge.
Powerful, fresh and fizzy. Robust and well developed. A little bitterness in the end. The after-taste brings some citrus notes. Very well done.
Botella de 33 cl tomada en la antigua internacional de Oviedo en mayo 2003. lote 053 hasta fin de 2004. 8 vol. bastante buena.

Pours a cloudy copper towards the end of the bottle, huge white head. Very fruity, yeasty and malty bouquet. Orange zest, spices, herbs, a hint of banana chips. The palate is medium+ bodied with a hint of boosy heat, low bitterness, slight sweetness and a pretty long finish. Very good tripel, in my oppinion this is comparatively higher quality than the blue Chimay acctually.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ottima triple trappista della ormai troppo commerciale chimay che per fortuna non fa perdere il proprio buon gusto alle proprie birre. Classica ma di una perfezione di sapori e profumi. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85
Cloudy golden colour with frothy head. Crisp taste which fades to a creaminess. Nicely fizzy. Hints of vanilla. (K)
Beste van de drie Chimays. De blauwe komt na lang rijpen vaak beter tot zijn recht.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2015 Cest une excellente trappiste. Pour une blonde qui vient de lécole belge, elle est bien équilibrée sans avoir ce goût de sucre, parfois un peu écoeurant quon rencontre dans certaines classiques. Elle va bien avec un poulpe à la gallega, opinion personnelle, bien entendu.
This is how a good triple should taste like! Colour appearance smell palate, I cant say enough about it. Excellent body with lingering aftertaste.
UPDATED: MAY 31, 2015 Robe blonde, légèrement opaque.Très fruitée, fruits jaunes dominants, noisette et amande en arrière goût. Longue en bouche.Encore une excellente trappiste
Bottle in a Samoens restaurant. Pours hazy amber with a good white head. Nice rich flavour of spice, banana, aniseed, hay and caramel. Tasty stuff.
DWF. Gyllen uklar med høyt hvit flott skum. Smak av gjær frukt. Aroma fruktig sitron gjær middels co2
Dunkle bernsteinfarbe, trüb, süßlich flüchtiger Geschmack, karamellnote, würzig im Nachgeschmack
This is a very bitter beer, wich please me a lot. The color is light brown. Its also strong.
Bernsteinfarben mit schönem weißen Schaum. Aroma: Hefe, Zitrus. Geschmack: bitter und sehr trocken, die Süße wird dadurch überdeckt.

330ml bottle from Masuyos. Poured into a snifter. Aromas of citrus, biscuit, clove, yeast and apricot. Bitter on the palate. Medium body with nice carbonation. Slightly dry on the palate. Fruit and yeast flavors become more pronounced as it warms up. Little bit of arugula and white pepper in there too. Nice long peppery bitter finish.

Espuma densa y blanquecina que permanece, color amarillo anaranjado y bastante turbia, mucho aroma en nariz, en boca es muy intensa con una combinación de notas amargas que se perciben hasta el regusto que es permanente, cerveza para disfrutar con tranquilidad

WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, z niewielkimi drobinkami (prawdopodobnie drożdze). Piana mydlana, wysoka, jednak po paru chwilach opada do minimalnej warstewki
AROMAT: Owoce (brzoskwinia, winogrona), kwiatowość, ziołowość, przyprawowość, trawiastość oraz zbożowość.
SMAK: Są przyprawy, zioła i owoce, jest słodycz zbożowa i goryczka alkoholowa - średnia. Całość wytrawna. Średnio nasycone. 
OGÓLNIE: Niezwykle bogaty i złożony aromat. Piwo klasyk, chętnie się do niego powraca.
1.4.2014. Slightly hazy, dark orange, white big head. Fresh aroma has belgian yeast, fruits, banana, citrus, great aroma. Taste is peppery, spicy, dry, bitter.
Bitter sweet, finely carbonated and lightly fruity, pale orange ale with a  semi-dry finish. A beautiful beer.
Barnán narancssárga szín, sűrű fehér hab. Illata narancsos citrusos kenyeres és élesztős. Íze: kenyeres élesztős, banános narancsos és citrusos. Kissé magas szénsav tartalom. Egész jó.

Golden colour with medium-high white head. Some lacing. High carbonation. Aroma is mostly banana + some orange, you can feel some alcohol. Good but not excelent. Taste is some pilsen sweeteness, some alcohol and medium bitterness. Decent tripel but for sure there are few better in Belgium.

Belle Mousse qui semble vouloir durer. On reconnait facilement les notes dune tripel, penchant peut-être un peu plus vers les épices que ses soeurs rouges et bleues. Le corps bien rond est sans reproche. Il manque peut-être un peu de complexité par contre, sa personnalité est assez facile à cerner. Jaurais tendance à dire que cette bière représente le "standard" parfait de tripel : aucune fausse note mais rien de très spécial non plus. En dautres mots, très bonne mais facilement oubliable.

Blonde dorée foncée, énorme mousse à cratère qui laisse une grosse dentelle et qui dure longtemps, longtemps ... Nez de levure typique des Chimay, pâte à pain, houblons hernacés et épicés, coriandre, banae. Bouche épicée, levures, banane, belle amertume. Corps crémeux et très belle carbonatation, alcool présent mais discret, très bonne longueur. Une superbe bière très équilibrée.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2015 Served in a trappist glass. Amber with a big white head. Aroma is citric, herbal, bread, biscuit, peaches, apricot, yeast. Taste is yeast, herbal, bread, bananas, lemons. Bitter aftertaste.

Good trapist triple. Vinous on the nose. Pleasant carbonation. Starts a bit sweet and oily and finishes nicely dry and bitter.flavor is mostly bitter hops and yeast. The 8% is not vey prominent. Nice.

Bottle 0.33 l, Carrefour, Wrocław, Poland.
Bursztynowe, mętnawe piwo o obfitej i trwałej pianie oraz przyjemnym, lekko owocowym aromacie. W smaku gęste i ciężkie, wytrawne z chmielową, rozgrzewającą i drapiącą gardło goryczką na finiszu.
UPDATED: FEB 19, 2015 Bottle. Pours slightly hazy blonde with small head. Aroma of yellow fruits and herbs. Tastes like more of the same, but with a medium bitter finish. Really good.

Piana obfita, szybko opada. Barwa bursztynowa. Aromat niezbyt intensywny, czuć brzoskwinia, drożdże, słodowość, troszkę przypraw. Smak bardzo zbalansowany, mamy słodki, kwaśny i goryczkę - dosyć wyraźna. Wysycenie wysokie, szczypie w język, alkohol całkiem nieźle schowany, złożone zbalansowane piwo.

Fat bishops arms. Gulorange vätska. Fruktig doft av belgojäst och äpplekart. 
Äpplekart med örter och hö. Välkolsyrad

Copenhagen 4/1 2015. 33 cl bottle from Netto. Very foamy when you open it. Pours hazy gold with solid white head. Aroma of alcohol, malts and yeast. Medium low carbonation. Taste is dominated by the high alcohol content. Taste is sweetish supplemented by strong notes of alcohol. Slight bitterness in aftertaste. I have tasted better Belgians.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2017 En øl fra himlen. Dejlig smag. Flot farve. Frisk og fyldig øl, Jeg for lyst til en til.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours hazy amber with an off-white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma and flavour are citrus, spices, yeast, and herbs - with a bitter finish.
Soar, with caramel notes, copper color, with fruits and citrus. With little metal in taste
Prima zwaar bier. Vrij fris. Helder. Redelijk bitter ook voor een tripel en niet erg zoet.

Color is golden to amber, very cloudy. Head is generous and persistent till the end. Medium carbonation. Full and creamy body. Aroma is floral, yeast and dark fruits. Taste is caramel, dried plums, cloves (and other spices), bread and some bitterness. Aftertaste is sweet and very long. Up to now the best Chimay Ive tasted.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Trappistenhuis, Gent 02/2015. Creamy elderflower blossom pour. Soft pillows of gentle, floral yeastiness gain contour by perching on rich, bready & honeycoated malts and allying themselves with dry, green herbal hoppiness into a mature Northern Hemisphere earthy milkshake. I do not recall enjoying this beer as much from the bottle as from tap now - the missing link between Saison Dupont, Tripel Karmeliet, an imperial Witbier and organic buttermilk.  // 33cl Bottles @33cl at Biere mit Stil 1: Worldwide Tripel [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Freiburg JAN2016: slightly less impressive than on draught, but still very tasty, flowery, subtle and light-footed compared to many other cloying tripel. Pronounced elderflower and spring meadow hops in aroma, lovely - not just a winter warmer, but a great aperitif as well. // Rerate bottle bb12/2019 (BL sampler): quite harsh and uninspired plantstalk bitterness after the dry bananashake malts. Has this dumbed down in the last few years, like the dark Chimays? Somewhat dull&dry now, with a grainy cereal edge.
Yeast, spices (ginger, muscot, pepper), and a buttery floral scent creates a fine "Belgic" aroma. Well-balanced taste, containing yeast, spices and hints of banana. Fresh, easy to drink.

Cloudy yellow appearance with a huge white head. Aroma is floral, yeast, a faint notion of dark fruit. Taste is yeasty-sweet at first, then becomes very bitter. Still, the alcohol is quite well hidden. Medium, smooth body. Its good, not more and not less.

Part of the tasting set I got for Christmas and so served in the matching Chimay glass. The White is by far the most beautiful looking beer in the set with a sweet fruity plums, raisins, figs with a touch of spices aroma. The thick head of foam leaves incredible belgian lace coating the glass and lingers for ages in a thick film over the beers clear coppery gold body - stunning. Full bodied with a very active carbonation and some boozy heat plus warming in the pit of my stomach. Surprising from an 8% beer but it makes sense when you consider a lot of the alcohol is coming from belgian candy sugar which also gives it an incredibly dry finish. The taste is sweet, malty, sugar & earthy spicy fruits. Out of the three this may be my favorite.
33cl bottle from S&R. My very first rating. Just starting to develop my palate. Sweet, yeasty, bread.

W aromacie brzoskwiniowe, trawowe, ziemiste, lekko alkoholowe, Piana bardzo obfita, grubopęcherzykowa w swej strukturze, mocno nagazowana. Barwa złota, lekkie zmętnienie. W smaku wysoka słodowość miesza się z nuta alkoholową, rozgrzewającą przełyk. Wszystko dobrze zbalansowane w miarę, chociaż alkoholowa goryczka mogłaby być łagodniejsza. Ogólnie po leżakowaniu pewnie zyska sporo.

On tap at Brauhaus, Athens Greece. Light orange color, hazy, white head. Aroma is malty and caramely. Taste is sweet, with malts, caramel, some herbs and flowers. The aftertaste is nice and long. Medium body with medium carbonation.

Bottle 33 cl. at home. A positive surprise and a very nice Tripel though not as multi-facetted as the best (read: Karmeliet). Beautiful colour, fine champagne bubbles and head and nice fruity aroma and taste. Less "yeasty" than some Belgian classics, which suited this beer very well. Drank it at cellar temperature during winter but it would probably be better a little colder as it is very drinkable and carries its high alcohol content very well.
0,33 liter bottle. Pours a golden / orange coloured beer. Taste starts sweet and then turns yeasty, bittery.

Light copper with a nice 1 inch white foam. Malty, some spice, a little bit of banana bread and some herbal hops. Taste is sweet, nearly no bitterness, well balanced. Creamy with a lively carbonation, long spicy finish.
How: Bottle Appearance: hazy orange, large white head. Aroma: wheat, bread, banana, orange, spice. Palate: Medium to full body, soft carbonation.

Robe ambrée. Nez puissant sur des notes épicées, levurées, houblonnées et maltées, une note de banane mure. Bouche : une belle attaque épicée, de la rondeur, une bulle crémeuse, une très belle ampleur et une longue finale épicée. Une très belle triple, parfaitement équilibrée. Un régal

Pours a slightly hazy orange/golden color, topped with a quite lasting white head. Aroma is a combo of yeasty, bready and herbal notes - not too strong. The taste starts sweet, too yeasty for me with moderate bitterness. Not unpleasant, but this style just doesnt work for me.

Bottle at home. Pretty great. Everything a tripel should be in the purest sense. Pours a really attractive murky golden orange with just the right amount of white head with staying power. Proper Belgian glassware. Decent lacing. Taste is predominantly Belgian in a perfectly balanced way- spice, banana, yeast and a lingering yet not overpowering raisiny sweetness. Alcohol is definitely there and a single pour is just about right. Tempers the pace appropriately. Drinks smooth and mellow. Exactly right.

Bottle. Lightly clouded orange with small particulate sediment. Looks like a lava lamp when backlit with the iPhone flashlight. 2-inches of cream-colored head, frothy and slow-to-fade. Aroma is some scone sweetness, light caramel and brown sugar with toasted spelt. Light herbal grass with hint of lemon. Delicious. Body is oily, medium-light yet refreshing, moderate-to-moderate-heavy carbonation, creamy. Flavor is semi-sweet light brown sugar with toasted spelt, hints of yeast spice, some very light apple and pear. A little bit of kettle corn. Overall: an excellent, malt-heavy tripel. Delicious.

33cl bottle. Mitchells Wines, Sheffield. Hazy, pale amber. Thin, dense, lasting, white head. Bready. Yeasty. Sultanas. Light spice. Some green hop. Taste is sweet, first off, turning spicy dry, then moderately bitter. Full, smooth, lightly oily palate. Well matched carbonation. Finishes spicy dry, and long, light bitter. Not had this for a long time. Nice to try it again.

Bottle. Cloudy dark yellow poor with a white head. Mild almost hoppy aromas. Mild wheat like smoothness with very mild citrus and a hoppy bitterness. Good body and mouthfeel. For a tripel it doesnt have that candy sweetness, which for me is a plus.

Complex light aroma of grass and yeast. Pours a rich honey gold, cloudy. A tight white enormous head that lasts and produces nice lacing. Big sour taste with hops, malt, lemon, almost yogurt notes. Round and complex with a looong finish. Really nice work by the brothers.
faint malt aroma. golden in color with a nice foamy head. taste is malty, finish has a slight hop flavor.

A golden coloured beer with a frothy white head. A strong bready aroma, yeasty definitely, with a background hint of fruity hop. Medium mouthfeel. A rich taste, loads of bready, yeasty and malty flavours, caramel and a tiny hint of butterscotch, dried fruit which brings forth a more sour fruitiness that lasts into the finish. Tasted at the Delirium Cafe, Brussels.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 La cerveza de Triple de Chimay es la más reciente de la abadía y se etiqueta como "Cinq Cents" en la botella de 750 ml. De un color dorado, la cerveza trapense combina el sabor dulce y amargo en un equilibrio poco común. El aroma de la cerveza que se siente en la boca proviene de los perfumes de los lúpulos: por encima de todo, hay toques frutales de pasas de uva y uvas moscatel, incluso de manzanas maduras. Esta tradicional cerveza belga se saborea mejor cuando se encuentra fresca, a una temperatura de entre 6 y 8 °C.
http://www.estucerveza.com/chimay-blanca- 2,19
http://www.elcervecero.es/product/87/0/0/1/1 2,25
Couleur dorée avec un mince col blanc durable. Arome dagrumes, bananes, céréales, herbes, épices. Interessante!

Pours beautiful golden color. Hint of smoke, leather. The palate is smooth, slick and perfect. Soft carbonation.

The taste carries to every corner of mouth immediately after sips, and it remains there for a bit. It shines. Good feeling. Dry aftertaste.

8% it says, but it is not overwhelming. Be careful, dont drink too much because its still 8%. 330ml is also perfect amount.
w smaku czuc slod i owocowosc,zapach typowy niczym sie nie wybija,genialna duza goryczka,ogolnie jedno z lepszych piw w swoim gatunku
Bottle at home. Pours hazy golden color, white head. Aroma is spicy, yeasty, malty. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, spicy, malty, hoppy.
Hazy yellow-orange color and big white head. Aroma is yeast, wheat, citrus. Taste is same. So good. Done well, clean. Refreshing. Thats when you know its good.
Yeasty and fresh koriander aroma. A bit cloudy yellow colour, big foamy head. Sharp dry bitter taste, some malts, yeast, bread and grassy herbs. Bitter yeasty dry lemonlike aftertaste.
This beer has a very nice head and a pleasant floral, fresh and fruity aroma. The taste is rather sweet and pleasant but a little bit light. The finish is quite short with a touch of bitterness.
the aroma of malt, citrus and toffee, very spicy... the taste is well-balanced, malty with hints of dry wine, flowers and spicy grasses... some shades of caramel... dry and bitter aftertaste...

Not for dinner if you are a lager person, but superior with a plate of assorted cheeses or just a stand alone have a glass of something. Satisfying body and distinctive taste. Absolutely must use the correct glass to set the head up properly. Never a bad choice for good company

Very complete tripel. Appearance is a pleasant deep golden. Aroma is surprisingly fruity, which stands out in this class of belgian ales. Very nice. Taste is equally pleasing, which mixes the fruity citrus taste with bitterness. Nice on the palate for a tripel. Overall an excellent beer, but the chimay blue is superior in both complexity and palate.

A classic Belgian Tripel. It seemed to get better as the bottle progressed. Strong yeast flavour and moderate bitterness, caramel and toffee flavour. Very good and the strong Gravity was also agreeable.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka. Duza, choc nie drobnopecherzykowa piana, opada dosc szybko, malo zostaje na szkle. Aromat glownie slodowy i owocowy, zwlaszcza banany, troche cytrusow. tez przyprawowosc (pieprz, nie ma kolendry). troszke miodu. W smaku dosc analogicznie, przez wiekszosc czasu slodko, pod koniec delikatna goryczka. dobrze ukryty alkohol. Duzo mniej tresciwy od wielu innych. mily, lekki w odbiorze. troche zbyt mocno nasycony jak na moj gust. za zimny jest pusty i wodnisty, trzeba dac mu sie troche ogrzac w szkle. warki nie spisalem, ale ta butelka dala odczucia  dosc mocnej goryczki, o przyprawowo-ziolowym charakterze. reszta (w tym ocena) bez zmianOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

11.2 oz bottle into a Chimay goblet.

A: Pours a murky copper color. The head is about two fingers high, and off-white in shade. Im really impressed with its retention in particular. A decent amount of lacing is left behind.

S: This has a very pleasant creamy aroma compared to other tripels - having said that, it seems to subdue some of the fruity esters some. There are some good banana notes, though. Black pepper and doughy yeast help round out the aroma. Im a little disappointed over the fact that it doesnt really open up when allowed to sit.

T: The flavor of this tends to lean more toward peppery than fruity. After the initial pepper flavors, it finishes with a nice cream note. I swear theres also something on the back end suggesting noble hops, too. Or maybe its just clove. Whatever it is, I really enjoy this beers mellow bitterness and subdued sweetness; my only real complaint here is that the fruit esters tend to be too understated at times.

M: Like most good Belgian ales, the dry finish is really pleasing. The relatively full body helps take the edge off of the intense carbonation, too. This isnt particularly chuggable, but it is very easy to sip. It certainly doesnt taste/feel like 8% by any means.

O: Honestly, this might be my favorite of the three Chimay beers. And to think I expected this one to be my least favorite! It isnt terribly complex, but it is very enjoyable to savor. This is the only one Id go back to on a regular basis.

Hazy orange body capped by a frothy white head. Considerable lacing.
Aromas of Belgian yeast, cloves, and some lightly sweet citrus fruits.
Taste wise, more of the same but with the addition of some bitterness.
After a while, all Belgian beers can start to taste the same, but this one would hold its own in a crowd.
Pours hazy yellow/orange with a fluffy white head. Aroma is citrus and barnyard. Lively carbonation, finishes dry and bitter.

Bottle. Orange color, hazy. Big white head with lots of lacing. In nose corriandet, lemon, orange. Corriander and lemon also in mouth with some peppery and grassy notes. Too agressive alcohol in flavor. Some sourness in aftertaste. Lemon stays in mouth after. Actually, this beer easy going. But alcohol taste could be better hidden. Good beer.

Reinheitsgebot, its not. And that means something to me, not just in the abstract. The Chimay brews are among my favorites, and perhaps it is unfair to judge them against all others, but more fair to judge them against themselves. Compared to the sublime Blue, and the wonderful Red label, this is a lesser brew with an unattractive aroma and a confusion of unrelated barnyard flavors. Possibly I got an older bottle? Came with the chalice.

Old rating rerated 25.12.2014, 0,33l bottle (best before 2009) @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is mild oxidized and slightly sweet, honey bread, hay, caramel malts, raisins, candied sugar, toffee, almond cake, yeast. Taste is slightly dry and mild oxidized, hay, yeast, candied sugar, honey bread, grain, raisins, alcohol, almond cake. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.
750 ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with a nice white head. Aromas of Belgian yeast, candied sugar, light spice. Medium bodied, very nice.
The head is robust, body is brown orange cloudy. It smells yeasty, malty, refreshing, light sweet-fruity-creamy. The taste is malty, yeasty, refreshing, sparkling, less hoppy, belgian. Nice

Pours ahazy bronze color with a lofty cream colored head. The smell is sweet toasted malt, yeast, fruit, a touch of caramel. The taste is as it smells ending dry and yeasty. Medium body with active carbonation. A tripel that isnt too clogging which is nice.
Intensely fine carbonation with predominant Belgian yeast, decent hoppy bitterness and orange aromas. Extremely balanced.
One of my favourite beers, smooth ritch aroma and very enjoyable, prefere the 75 cl bottle

A Tripel not unlike the Belgian Strong Ale like Pauwels Kwak, and that means MASTERPIECE! Well within the like of Belgian beer anyway. Its just pretty much your perfect Tripel, so harmonic and friendly youll never notice the strength. I sense nutmeg and plums with perfectly measured hops to make this heavy brew light in taste and hazy in looks. Good Stuff!
Pours brilliant gold thick fluffy white head, aroma of pears and clove. Light grainy malt body, pear apple flavor. Finish is spicy.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2015 Bottle. Pours sparkling golden, hazy at the 2nd half of Bottle, with huge with frothy white head with some big bubbles. Really foamy soaplike. Aroma is wheat, bit citric, wheat, banana, some clove and bread. Estery and yeasty phenols. Taste is sweet malts, white bread, some ripe fruits, banana and yeasty spices. Full body and creamy, with dry booze in finish which is bit too sharp. Bubblegum and jenka.

Bottle @ home with DroolYeast. Aroma of hops and yeast. Pours with a big white head and a hazy golden colour. Yeasty and fruity taste with a medium bitterness. Medium body, soapy texture and average carbonation. Long bitter finish.

Bottle @ home, shared with TurtleBrain. Aroma of yeasty esters, hops, spice. Pours with big white head. Hazy golden colour. Tiny head lasting. Moderate sweetness, light bitterness. Full body, oily texture, average carbonation, logn body.

Pours a cloudy amber with a big white fine head that lasts "forever"..the lacing is good and i would say the carbonation id lively.
Aroma would be fruity with yeasty smells and it has a sour taste and you can taste the fresh hops...Mouth feel wise, its full... and the finish is smooth with a med-dry finish.
An enjoyable beer.

33 cl bottle at home. Very lively pour with sediment disturbed, leaving a slightly cloudy orangey beer. The white head is loose but rocky. Aroma is perfume and peppery hop with yeasty bread - very nice indeed. Taste is slightly sweet, then becoming very bitter. Very lively on the tongue, almost acidic orange bitter finish. Almost astringent with a thin mouthfeel. For a tripel, it is almost refreshing due to its sherbet-like acidity. Not bad at all.
Light and cloudy golden with snowy white head. Aromas of yeast, bread. Taste slightly bitter, nice alcohol feel. Medium body, fizzy. Classic tripel
This secondary fermented ales have neither been pasteurized nor filtered and only natural ingredients are used. Great combination of fresh hops and yeast of the chimay cinq cents.

The aroma is full of bread/yeast, fruit and wheat. The taste is bitter and notes of wheat and fresh hops are present indeed. It feels very smooth on the tongue. The color is hazy golden. A really nice beer!
33 cl White head, lots of staying power. Golden clear. Aroma, light fruity. Taste, clean, fruity, soft alcohol, light bitterness, light malt. Dry mouthfeel.

Hazy amber colour with a white head. Creamy in the mouth and rather gaseous. I hadnt started typing when it graced me with a burp. Alcohol is rather felt. A well balanced beer which is reliable choice if you are worried that you might offense your friends tongues.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a huge white foamy head. Lots of lacing. Malty and fruity aroma. Taste is of malts, yeast, bread, hops and fruity notes - especially citrus ones. Full body and high carbonation. Bitter and spicy finish. A lot better than Id expected.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours a hazy, golden colour that leaves a big, foamy off-white head with long lasting lacing. Aroma of yeasty, banana, spices, fresh lemons, cloves, grass, pine. Taste follows the nose, clove, yeasty and rich in sense of bananas. Bread and peaches. Moderate bitterness from the hops. Light-medium spices. Full bodied, heavy carbonated. Refined, balanced and beautiful creamy mouth-feel. Recommended.

Flasche (75 cl) von BierPost.com, abgefüllt 2010, 3 Jahre im Keller gelagert (MHD: 2013). - Orangegelb, klar; stabile sahnige Schaumdecke. - In der Nase milde herbe Hopfenwürze, Muskatnuß, Orangenlikör. - Antrunk weich und komplex würzig-herb mit deutlicher trockener Bittere. Noten von Bitterorange, Kräutertee und Muskatnuß, perfekt abgerundet mit einer leicht kellerig-modrigen Note. Die plumpe Süße, die frischen Exemplaren eignet, ist einer profunden Trockenheit gewichen. Mild rezent, sehr weich und rund, herrlich mineralisches Mundgefühl. Im Abgang milde Herbe und eine zart schmelzende Fülle würziger Aromen, alles vornehm zurückhaltend und abgerundet. - Bei diesem Bier lohnt mehrjährige Lagerung unbedingt! Frisch und gar vom Faß ist es nichts besonderes, aber in der Flasche findet eine wunderbare Verwandlung statt ...
Bottle at home. Hazy golden with a fluffy white head. Sweet grapey taste with slight bitter aftertaste. Oily texture. Complex yeasty malty beer. Love it.

Appearance: Poured into a chimay glass, 3 finger head that settles to a one finger head slowly, nice lacing, dark golden brown, visible carbonation.
Nose: yeasty, cloves, banana, spices, vanilla, bubblegum, hops, raisins, citrus, grass, pine, cedar, 
Palate: Thick, heavy carbonation at front then becomes creamy.
Taste: Banana, grass, strong moderately bitter hops, yeast, something like sprite, slight spiciness. 
Overall: A complex and interesting hoppy tripel, I feel like Id have enjoyed more if it was slightly chilled (Im not drinking this chilled) but still overall a lovely beer, highly recommended.

Honey-golden colour woth a rocky white head and lush lacings. Aromas of floral light fruity zesty hops are dominating. Effervescent texture with a medium-full body. The flavour is somewhat sweet, caramel like, with fine acidity developing. The finish is actually lasting for quite some time but rather mellow leaving impressions of bright fruity hops drying out eventually.

A nice sweet aroma, yeast. A hazy golden color with a frothy white head. A medium bitter taste. Medium body, creamy, soft carbonation with a bitter finish. Was a bit dissapointed by the previous ratings. For the price I will be buying something else-

Not a huge fan of Belgian beers many are too spicy and have that clove taste and Im not a fan of that. Finally decided to try a Chimay white at $6 for a 11.2 oz bottle. Splitting it with my wife. This smells like a prosecco. Taste is sweet and fairly mild.
Good triple beer which leave good aromas on the palate. But I was disappointed by the smell at first.
75 cl bottle @ Poteaupré. Hazy golden colour whit beautiful white head. Aroma and flavour of fruits, caramel, spicy yeast. Dry finish
3,3dl Flasche. Rotgolden. Viel Hopfen in der Nase und wenig Hefe. Rechts spritzig und gut bitter, fast keine Säure. Bitzeli süss, nicht von Malz. Rutscht fast zu gut für 8%. Bitterer Abgang.
belle couleur dorée; mousse blanche moyenne; arômes maltés; goût malté, houblonné et épicé; bon équilibre douceur-amertume; finale amère qui dure; la meilleure des Chimay

Great gold-orange appearance with huge head. Floral hop aroma, paired with spices from the yeasts. Taste is dry, citrus fruity and hoppy. Bitter finish. Quite carbonated. A very good hoppy triple, too easily drinkable for its 8 ABV.

Wspaniały pełny złoty kolor, piana biała, średniopęcherzykowa, trwała i bardzo obfita. Piwo jednolicie zmętnione. Aromat delikatnych cytrusów, bananów, odrobiny drożdży. Gorycz, kwaśność, smak alkoholu, wszystko w perfekcyjnej harmonii. Wysycenie odpowiednie, nieinwazyjne. Na języku szerokie.
UPDATED: NOV 24, 2014 Bottle from Smatch, grocery in Brussels. Nice aroma, average beer according to my taste

Aroma: Fruity sweet with yeast. 
Flavour: Floral sweet with notes of caramel and banana.
Colour: Golden amber with a white head.
Aroma of Belgian yeast, malt and raisins, cloudy gold. Colour with a lasting white head. Dry feel with a sweet banana raisin taste an a Belgian yeast finish.
Great tasting tripel. My fav among the Chimay ales is still the blue but this one is also a great beer on its own.
Pours cloudy with serious thick white head. Aroma of a bit of raisin with some hoppitude. Tastes of raisins, gingerbread and maple syrup. Oily mouthfeel and lingering aftertaste. Really nice.
Hazt colden color - small White head. Fruity, spicy, herbal and yeasty aroma and taste.

Hazy pale amber with big fluffy white head. Good retention and lacing. Nose is nice bittersweet grass and lemon, dough, yeast and malts, spicy earthy-grassy hops. Taste is malty-yeasty, semisweet with noticeable citrusy bitterness, clovey spiciness and alcoholic zing. Kinda watery palate, but dry, grainy mouthfeel and medium body, thin prickly carbonation. Finishes fairly bitter. Not loving Tripels but its good to have something like this every once in a while.
Nyami. Belga söreim egyik kedvenc darabja (elsősorban akkor, amikor szűk kínálatból kell választani. Viszonylag könnyű hozzájutni itthon)

Aroma: Medium Yeast fruity, banana, light leathery, clove. Medium malty, bready. Light spice, light alcohol.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
18C. Belgian Tripel

0.33L bottle. Clear golden with a huge, rocky white head. Aromas of dough, some bubblegum, bread, fruit; raisin and apricot. Flavor is medium sweet with cereal grain and bubblegum. Quickly transitions to a complex bitterness, part yeast, part herby and citrusy hops. Quite spicy, with some hints of clove and ginger. Light body with a slick mouthfeel and active carbonation. Overall, some nice complexity to this beer, and different for a tripel. Malt sweetness is balanced well with a lingering, complex bitterness that stands out relative to the style.

Blonde un peu cuivrée, carbo moyenne, collet moyen de grosses bulles. 
Aromes fruités, pain et levure.
Bien ronde, et fruités. Final à lamertume bien contrebalancée par le sucre.
Full-bodied and full-flavored brew with some flowers, a fair bit of yeast, and a fruity tart bitterness that is quite pleasant. Alcohol is noticeable but not dominant. Quite pleasant.

Has a beautiful color, powerful carbonation, thick persistent head. Aroma is light, malt, wheat. The palate is full bodied, thick, fulfilling. Has a refreshing taste where the wheat shows; the alcohol really doesnt. Gets more bitter in the end. Very well done beer with a winning recipe.

750ml ($9.99) Very good beer, Chimay never lets you down. flavor is very good and the brand consistently brings a great beer to market. of course Id buy again, now its just a matter of price hunting ;)

11.2 oz. bottle, consumed on 10-21-14. Im surprised I havent rated this one yet. I had assumed I had consumed it earlier, but now Im not so sure. Strong, yeasty aroma with scents of orange, lemon, honey, challah, and apple cider. Pours an initially clear, dark gold. Highly effervescent. Large amount of creamy, off-white head. Produces good lacing. About as good-looking as a golden-colored beer can get. The latter pour is cloudy tan and with much suspended particulate and thick head. The latter pour also looks quite appetizing and appealing in a different way. Bready, vegetal, dry, sophisticated, very nice taste. Flavors of tobacco, candy sugar, caramel, orange, and a touch of booze. Dry finish. Medium body. Fluffy and frothy in the palate. Good Belgian ale palate effects. This is the type of beer that is brewed only in Belgium and makes all but the best American takes on Belgian-style beers look like pale imitations. It has been too long since I have had a Trappiste ale outside of my Orval and Rochefort staples. This beer reminds me that, with all the innovative beers young American breweries are pumping out, Belgian monks still make some of the best beers on the planet. Chimay White is a lovely and complex classic with no weaknesses. Its nice when a beer has those flavors that you cant actually describe but that you can ascribe only to a great brew.

Bière Belge très subtile.Tout est en douceur et subtilité.Le savoir-faire est palpable.Lamertume est ravissante. Pas trop pétillante ni trop levurée pour une belge.Texture onctueuse.Une de mes belges préférée.Houblons aromatiques et amérisants discret mais non effacé par le trop plein de levures.
Bottle @ Delirium. Hazy light golden pour with a generous head. Yeast, grains, cereal and some grains.

Bottle at Bottle Cap Bar. Hazy pale golden body with a massive white head. Lively carbonation. Great lacing. Aroma of sea salt, musty lemon and tiger bread. Flavour of white pepper, sweet red apple and yeast. Medium body with a powdery texture. Soft fizz. A lovely Tripel.

750 ml bottle into signature chalice, bottled on 6/24/2012. Pours fairly cloudy deep golden amber color with a 1-2 finger dense and fluffy off white head with incredible retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Dense soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a large amount of streaming carbonation retaining the dense head. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of lemon, pear, apple, white grape, apricot, light banana, pepper, clove, candi sugar, bread, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast, pale malt, and light earthy hop notes; with good strength. Taste of lemon, pear, apple, white grape, apricot, light banana, pepper, clove, candi sugar, bread, light honey, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Large amount of earthy/peppery yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, pear, apple, white grape, apricot, pepper, clove, candi sugar, bread, light honey, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Outstanding complexity and balance of fruity/spicy yeast, pale malt, and earthy hop flavors; with a great crisp malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. High carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and fairly dry finish that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an incredible tripel! All around outstanding complexity and balance of fruity/spicy yeast, pale malt, and earthy hop flavors; and extremely smooth and crisp to sip on. A highly enjoyable offering.

more interesting and complex than the double, but not neccesarily better. the spiciness in many triples is a bit too much for me, and this one is no exception, but it is a solid, complex brew. the hops are nice as well."

One of the most flavoursome tripels I have tried and also one of the most balanced which is no mean feat. Worthy of the Trappist logo.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 18C). Bottle 33 cl - Batch L14-281. AROMA: complex aromas of floral and orange notes. spicy background. low malt character. APPEARANCE: deep gold color and hazy. average white head with medium-low retention. some lacing is present. TASTE: a combination of citrus fruits (oranges) and some floral notes. soft malt background. low intensity alcohols. medium-high bitterness that lingers beyond a dry aftertaste. PALATE: medium body with medium carbonation. efervescente. OVERALL: a good example of a trappist triple with nice aromas and flavours.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330ml bottle poured in a chalice.
A: Pours a cloudy dark orange color forming a huge-creamy-fluff white head. Good retention and lots of soapy, lingering and molasses lacings formed and left in the glass
S: Sweet, fruity and spicy on the nose. Notes of honey, bubblegum, candy sugar, sweet bread, sweet pale malts, caramel malts, orange zest, flowery hops and alcohol
T: Follows the nose: Sweet upfront, followed by fruity and citrus notes. Strong notes of honey, leather, bready Belgian yeasts, caramel malts and flowery hops. Excellent bittersweet balance. Authentic Trappist beer. Alcohol is well hidden
M: Medium and molasses body. Medium carbonation. Great malty and fruity aftertaste. Bittersweet
O: Great drinkable. Delicious Trappist
[ BA Review @ 11/30/2010 ]

Warka do 2015. Ostatni rok przelezalo w szafce. Kolor ciemnozloty, lekko zmetnione. Piana wysoka, ale szybko sie dziurawi prawie do zera, mocno oblepia szklo, ale mimo wszystko dosc mizernie to wyglada. W aromacie bardzo intensywne estry jablkowe i brzoskwiniowe, z wyrazna przyprawowoscia i lekkim, szlachetnym alkoholem o sliwkowo-winnym zacieciu, genialny aromat. W smaku za to dominuje syrop kandyzowany. Piwo nie jest slodkie, ale ma wyrazny smak syropu cukrowego. W tle pojawiaja sie delikatne akcenty slodowe, karmelowe, przyprawowe i estrowe oraz lekkie musniecie szczypiacego alkoholu. Smak nie jest szczegolnie bogaty, ale jest ciekawy i calkiem przyjemny. Alkohol jest dobrze ulozony, piwo jest polwytrawne i gladkie, ale jednoczesnie dosc wysoko wysycone. Goryczka niska, ledwie wyczuwalna, lekko ziolowa i lodygowa.

330ml bottle from Vanuxeem. One of those old favourites that have thus far eluded my ratings. This has always been fantastic. Beautiful full tripel flavours with mild spice and teasing bitterness. Lovely stuff.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014 The former white Chimay (Blanche), renamed Triple some years ago to avoid confusion with witbier. Poured in its own glass, it shows a thick, cream white, dense and moussy head with good retention and leaving delicate lacing on the edges. Colour is a beautifully warm orange blond, cristal clear with a steady column of bubbles rising up from the bottom and supporting the opulent head; with deposit, it becomes an equally clouded, light and warm orange. Strong and characterful aroma, impressions of both fresh oranges and orange peel, ripe peaches, rosemary, cheese, thyme, single malt, soap, cloves, grass, banana, coriander, strawberry, some sweaty grains as it warms up and a very faint kind of saltiness. In the mouth, citrus freshness and exotic fruits constitute the onset, with a sharpish, sourish, minerally carbonation, after which a tangy spiciness takes over (coriander is quite noticeable), all built on a smooth, soft, mellow, caramelly maltiness with the very vague salty touch from the aroma peeping through; the finish is long and well-structured, with some spices and citrus persisting, but dominated by a peppery, leafy hop bitterness drying the throat along with some warming, whisky-like alcohol. I know this brewery has received criticism for speeding up brewing in order to increase sales, and making compromises on quality in the process; though I cannot but agree with this criticism, I still recognize this beer as one of the leading examples of its style. This is what a tripel ought to be: malty, fruity, rich and opulent, with enough hops in the finish to balance out the sweetness. I did not find any obvious flaws - and I do not expect to find those, considering the reputation trappist beers have to live up to. Great classic, also in the 75 cl version called "Cinq Cents", which has good ageing potential (though I usually recommend to consume tripels at young age, there are other beer styles more suitable for ageing - Chimay Grande Réserve, for example).

La Chimay Cinq Cents est une bière trappiste brassée à l'Abbaye de Scourmont.
Le logo "Authentic Trappist Product" certifie que la bière est produite au sein d'une abbaye trappiste sous le contrôle de la communauté monastique et que l'essentiel des revenus sont destinés à l'entraide sociale.
Dégageant un parfum de houblon frais et de levure, la Chimay Cinq Cents se déguste fraîche à une température de 6°C à 8°C. C'est la plus claire et la plus récente de la gamme de bières de Chimay. Sa mousse blanche est serrée et de belle tenue, sa couleur dorée reste limpide, la saturation est moyenne.

Colore ambrato, con tendenze allarancione lucente. Schiuma bianca alta tre dita, fine e persistente. Lodore è splendido, di iva e pesche, di frutta insomma come vuole lo stile. Il corpo scarno rende la birra troppo liquorosa ma comunque buona e godibile, secca dopo la dolcezza iniziale.

Single small bottle from Julios. Poured into a snifter. A deep cloudy honey color with a frothy off-white head that settles to a thick lace. Aroma of spice, bread and fruit. Body is on the heavy side with more bitterness than fruit. Lingering dry bitterness on the back side. Could this be the original "Belgian IPA"? Enjoyable overall.

Transfer from BA review on 7-27-13-

 Poured from bottle into a chalice glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a cloudy yellow-orange amber color with a one finger white head of a more fizzy nature. The head has a lighter level of retention, fading over about a one minute time frame, to leave a light level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is of a bready and biscuit nature mixed with a moderately strong yeasty and orange citrus smell. The yeast with it bring some nice spice aromas of coriander and clove mixing with some banana smells as well.

 Taste  The taste begins with a lighter bready flavor mixed with a moderate amount of orange citrus flavor. As the taste moves on the orange dries out some with lots of yeast and spice of clove and coriander coming to the tongue. As the orange gets lighter it is replaced by a light banana taste as well as some grassy and herbal hop flavors. Overall the taste gets rather dry at the end and when combining with a bit of an alcohol flavor it leaves a dry and yeasty bread taste to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the medium to slightly thinner side for a brew of 8 % abv with a carbonation level that is on the higher side with tons of prickly carbonation bubbles. The feel is very nice for the style with the slightly thinner body making it very drinkable and light in composure and with the prickly carbonation level accentuating the spice and hop taste all in all making for a more exciting drier champagne like feel which match the tastes well.

 Overall  A classic triple for a reason. It is dry and yet exciting brew with a drier, moderately yeasty, lightly hopped and nicely spiced flavor.

Flavors of sweet liquor, strong roasted malt, slightly chocolaty, strong cloves, some nutmeg, bitter orange and orange peel, fruits notes , light cooling mint. Amazingly crisp, and tangy, really enjoyable to hold in the mouth:sweetness, tangy alcohol, spice, crisp, cool and lightly carbonated. After taste is gently bitter, somewhat sticky, slightly sweet, but mostly dry. Great.

Litt uklar gyllen med et hvit skum, skummet hang fint i glassveggen. Aroma av malt, frukt, karamell, krydder og gjær. Smaken følger opp her også, lang søt ettersmak.
