Color ámbar tupido y espuma blanca. Aromas dulce y afrutados de manzana verde y levadura. Cuerpo medio inicio dulce y afrutado de fruta cverde con final de amargir moderado y seco. Muy rica.
Deep golden pour, with a tall creamy head but not a lot of lace. Aroma of citrus, Belgian yeast, mild hops. Taste is fruity, apples, some cloves, pepper. Medium body and quite drinkable.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2014 Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Instant gusher.Gylden uklar farge. Moderat karbonert. Hvit skumtopp. Smaker gjær, karamell, brød, nøtter, sitrus, urter, nellik. Ikke noe å si på denne. Rett og slett veldig god
Helt enkelt jättegod. Inte lika söt och maxad som den blå. Snarare en bättre balaserad trappist.

Smells like jubes. Typical tight fluffy head. Leaves a bitter aftertaste which lingers a bit too much for my taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Deep gold with a billowing white cloud head and heavy lacing. Subdued aromas of bread yeast, spicy hops, rum, raisins and muscat. Strong hop bitterness on the front palate leading into caramel malts, rum, raisins and muscat. Spicy hops abound in the finish and the alcohol is present without detracting. Incredibly smooth mouthfeel.
amber, cloudy, frothy, white foam, nutty, mild bitter, nice smooth finishlight body, thin feel, oily feel, lively, smooth subtle long finish
Cosa vuoi che ti dica la birra è più che buona ma sono ore che ordino le birrette fruttate il momento del giudizio non è sobrio.

Birra bionda con schiuma abbondante ma poco persistente. Aromi di frutta secca e uvetta non lasciano spazio al tipico floreale dello stile. In bocca piuttosto bilanciato con note speziate ed agrumate. Finale lungo e leggermente alcolico. Nel complesso non una birra che entusiasma seppur una buon birra da meditazione

Bottle 750ml. Nice hazy golden-orange with medium off-white head. Light sweet fruity aroma, oranges, bready. Balanced sweet and bitter flavor, citrus, a bit of sourness. Bitter aftertaste. Medium body.
Caramel, citrus, aarde, bubblegum, kelder aroma, deeg, bubblegum, butterscotch, kruidnagel, kruidnagel, bladeren, kruiden, kruiden, bubblegum, gekookte groente, kruiden, gekookte groente, toast, deeg

Bottle (23 years old) after RBSG 2014 Grand Tasting at Schlafly Tap Room. Golden brown with off-white head. Aromas of caramel, dark fruit. Tastes of caramel, dark fruit, syrup, big funk. Medium body with a dry finish.
Nasty! Too wheaty. Too much lemon peel and coriander...............................

very fruity aroma as white grapes and pear.
bitter and hopy. suitable for all kind of food especially for sea food
33cl bottle. A classic. Hints of apple and cinnamon. Alcohol strength doesnt take away from the subtlety of the beer and the flavour. Nice bitter finish but surprisingly refreshing and sweet,
Bottle. Pours a golden color with a white head. Nose is yeast, malt, spice, brown sugar. Some nice pear is the taste. You can taste the alcohol.
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 Bottle 33cl. Brussel. Blonde pour with a big frothy head. Aroma is yeast and some malt. Great tripel.

Initial sour aroma replaced by vanilla, green apple, cinnamon and yeast. Tangy in taste but flavoursome. Fruity and hoppy. Not sure there better Belgian tripel. Monks were right. 8% 330ml bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I was excited to try this beer, but didnt like as much as I thought I would. Very nice smell, caramel color, and very carbonated. Flavor was more bitter than sweet. Not bad, but wouldnt get again. Bought a three pack sampler and looking forward to the other flavors.

(Flasche) Es hat eine orangene Farbe, ist trüb mit einer orangenen, festen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist fruchtig-süß, mit süßer Grapefruite, vllt Noten von Kiwi, ein klein bisschen Malz und Hefe. Der Geschmack ist samtig, hefig, leicht süß mit karamelliger Note und grünem, kurzen Abgang. Die Bittere ist harzig, kurz und mittelstark. Die Karbonisierung ist gut und es läuft einfach gut.

Habja dús és tömött, illata pedig nyilvánvalóvá teszi, hogy hibátlan darabbal állunk szemben. Elsőként egy vajas, tejszínes aroma bontakozik ki, melyhez hamarosan csatlakozik egy élesztős, gabonás zamat egy leheletnyi vaníliával megspékelve, végül pedig a komló szinte menetrendszerű felbukkanása és igencsak hosszas utóíze zárja le a sort. Egyszerre szomjoltó és laktató, remekbe szabott főzet.

Eccellente esempio di triple, la chimay tappo bianco si distingue per dei toni fruttati, soprattutto di mela matura, che evolvono in un amarognolo squisito. Per questo è decisamente da abbinare col pesce, anche pesce grasso (perfetta col salmone).
Verfrissende trippel die fruitig en fris/verfrissend in de mond voelt. Compact van smaak met een flinke bitter in de afdronk dat zich ontwikkeld.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2017 Rerate as maybe this was the first decent beer I had had in China for a long time back in 2014!

Pours hazy golden brown with a white head. Aroma of malt with some spice. Bitter finish, a little metallic. Ok but nowhere near Westmalle.

Bottle 330ml from Charter Mall supermarket, Chongqing Lu, Changchun, China. Golden orange with a generous head. Very enjoyable tripel.
Un classique. Difficile à décrire, un bon équilibre de tout, de la douceur à lamertume en fin de bouche.

It has a slightly hazy, peachy golden colored body with a thick, heavenly, white and foamy head. It is supported by an active carbonation and it very slowly recedes to a much thinner creamy layer of foam that leaves behind sticky white lacing. The aroma has delicate fruity character with dry yeast notes and a just a hint of medicinal phenols and hops in the distance. The flavor has mellow fruity notes of Muscat, golden raison and apple mixing with pale malted grain and dry earthy yeast. Hop flavor is mild but adds a mild slash of herbal spice and mellow bitterness. Its 8%abv is well hidden but adds to the overall complexity and smooth rounded mouth feel. It finishes with some light phenol flavors and mild spicy hops fading off the tongue. Its texture has perfect carbonation and a nice rounded feel with a medium body that is very drinkable and sophisticated.

Pours a dark & hazy pineapple with a slim white cap. Its a brisk tripel, with a brisk champagne-like mouthfeel & satisfying dry finish. I like the arc in this brew, how the flavour profile soars & falls from start to finish. Fantastic sipper while watching the World Cup.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.
Hazy pinkish orange with a half inch of head. Nose of yeast and grains with some citrus. Taste is bitter and sour. Finish is dry.
Classic tripel. Golden color, fluffy white head that leaves great lacing on glass. Sharp hops, nice balance with malt. Dry finish.

Bottle. Clear dark golden with foamy white head. Yeasty and fruity aroma. Some spices in the taste, muscat. The amazing thing about this beer is its softness. No carbonation. It slides down the throat
Frothy unsteady white head. Hazy orange liquid. Carbonation medium to light. Medium to heavy sweetness. Medium to heavy bitterness, bitter aftertaste. Full body.

Bottle at the Merchants Inn, Rugby, first time in a while with this one ... 04/06/14.
Cloudy orange amber with a good sized off white head that retains well.
Nose is yeast esters, caramel, spice, citric peel, no suggestion of 8% booze!
Taste comprises dark fruit peel, caramel, faint citric rindings, light booze, malty, Belgian yeast esters, fruit loaf tinge.
Medium + bodied, soft massageing carbonation with a light coating of booze in the close.
Decent Tripel.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours well. Golden brown l I ghy tan head. Aromas of grain. Full flavored taste with a clean finish

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2015 Blonde un peu orangée, légèrement voilée. Belle mousse blanche persistante, dépôts.
Aromatique portée sur lhoublonnage fruité. Epicée, maltage et levure bien perceptibles également. Belle complexité et rondeur. 
En bouche plutôt maltée et sur les levures en début de bouche, ensuite les aromatiques dhoublon; agrumes-citron, un peu résineux. Belle longueur en bouche accompagnée par une amertume subtile.
Très bonne bière, complexe et balancée.

Great color and a great head on a mediocre pour. Flavor wasn't up to par with the other Chimays I've had. But still an above average beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: OCT 15, 2016 Draught. Pale colour, hazy. Aroma is rather poor, with malt and alcohol. Disappointing.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2014 Several times on tap, now getting some review notes from the bottle. Pours a large nice creamy head, dark golden hazy colour. Actually doesnt smell neither tastes nothing special or particularly definite, rather than typical belgian tripel notes: malts, yeasts, sweet notes, spices turning to a good balanced bitter.
I find the tap version to be a lot more intresting, complex, tastier and better overall, sort of more spiced and aromatic. I dont have any specific notes about it, but the on tap version is easily among my preferred tripels. The score is almost entirely due to the tap version, actually I finded the couple of bottles I tried a bit disappointing compared to the draught.
blanche arome de fruit légère amertume gout de sucre candy tres bonne mousse qui part rapidement
Helder geel bier met veel schuim. Smaak is bitter, hoppig, drop en lichte rook. Blijft gemiddeld hangen.
Amber light color. Very dense hite head, but it quickly disappears. Citrus and sweet belgian hops smell. Bitterness is prominent in flavor, also some fruity touches, with hop hints.
An okay abbey tripel from this monks, hoppy, balanced, dry with hints of yellow fruits and yeast.

Pours a golden color with a white head and thick lacing. Yeast, malt, spice, fruit, sugar and light hop aroma. Yeast, clove, pear, apple, malt, wheat, spice and sugar flavors. Medium light body and lively carbonation. Wheat, fruit and spice finish.
Nice golden color. The aroma is dominated by fruit. Also tastes fruity, with a tone of malt. Well balanced bitterness.

330ml bottle, served in a Chimay glass. Golden orangey amber colour with a foamy white head and aroma of caramel, raisins, fruity, bready, yeast. Taste is sweetish grains, caramel, citrus orange peel, raisins, bread, yeasty, wheaty, spicey plus some light bitterness. Spikey mouthfeel, medium bodied, medium carbonation, dry lingering tangy bitter finish. Complex, very drinkable.

Small bottle pours hazy toasted orange with a finger of head. Nose is fruity yeast, spicy grain, candied orange, raisin. Taste is crisp bright palate with lots of earthy spice, fruity yeast, grain, light raisin. Finish is dry yeasty fruit, bread, cereal. Tasty!
Pours a gold with heavy white head. Has a strong yeast and citrus aroma. Taste is mostly yeast, citrus and wheat, with some grains.
Bright topaz in colour. Straw, sour peaches, meringue, with a touch of nice funk on the nose. Wonderfully bright and fresh, completely coating the palate. Leaves a long lasting finish.
Golden, very big head. Banana, spices, yeast. Medium bitterness, some sourness. An excellent prototypical tripel.
Draft. Light pour with a fruit aroma. Sour fruit flavor with orange, grapefruit, and a little licorice. Very flavorful. Slightly bitter finish. Very well done.

Som med de fleste trappister (med undtagelse af Westvleteren XII) jeg har smagt er karboneringen lidt i overkanten. Det til side, er både aroma og smag frugtrig og humlet til perfektion. I glasset er øllet gyldent og uklart, hvilket hinter af hveden brugt. God øl - mere af den!!

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 It pours a dark cloudy apricot, lasting thick large bubble head, fantastic head. The aroma is of hay and wood. It has a very bold earthy flavour, creamy and moreish.

Re-rating, strong aroma, bread, dough, yeast, has something sharp in the background, grapefruit? The alcohol comes through in the taste a bit, still a smooth drink.

Ah, a wonderful day outside. Its one, I just put my daughter down for nap and decided it was time for a beer. (If thats wrong than I dont want to be right.)

Golden leaning a little toward the orange with a couple of fingers of white head that fairly quickly broke down to some sheeting with some lacing up the side. Smells of cereal malts and doughy Belgian yeast. The taste is predominately malts, with hay and bread, a little sweetness to it, with an acerbic aftertaste. Not my favourite Trappist, but not a bad beer.

Beautiful blond slightly hazy orange dress. Foam is abundant, airy and persistence is average. It exudes medium intensity smell of citrus and wheat. It is slightly spicy in the mouth and the texture is moderately dense. The final dominated by wheat is medium and opens with aromas of citrus and a slight bitterness to the aftertaste.

Light brown beer with a foamy beige head. Citrus and yeast on the nose. Crispy and foamy mouth feel, some sparkling wine elements there. Some sourness, sweetness, yeast and citrus: lemon at first but bitter grapefruit in the after taste. This is an awesome beer with a great balance. I love it.
Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Light fruit, subtle hops, and some raw wheat come through on the nose; all follow onto the palate. Chewy mouthfeel. Finishes sweet.
Nice fresh aroma with thin head. Great gold dark colour. The taste is also very fresh and hoppy with a little hint of belgian hint. Grater beer!

Couleur orange trouble, forte mousse blanche.Fort nez de malt, agrumes et fruits secs. Gout houblonné et amer, texture onctueuse, le tout bien balancé et leger. Differente des trappistes "habituelles" Pas mal
Blonde pour with a big frothy head, aroma is apricot and sweetness. Taste is hops bitterness, some fruity sweetness and a bitter finish. Very nice

330ml bottle from Intermarche, Lagoa, Algarve drank chilled out of a wine-stained tumbler. Been waiting for an apt or appropriately desperate and beer-starved moment to rate this and here it is. Turreted hazy apricot. Aroma of hay, sherbet, OJ, perfumed spice and citrus green herb. Mysterious perfumed Belgian flavour with the impression of mandarin and maybe passion fruit hop but all from yeast and spices of course. Coriander, kumquat and lace. Bitter and husk-hinting for a Trappist; kind of a Trappist DIPA. Considering its Europe-wide supermarket distribution a surprisingly fine beer with most of its magic still intact.

750 ml. bottle from our local ruffian liquor store. Pours golden amber with a thick two finger head that lasts and leaves chunky lacing, impressive. Aroma of pear, wheat, citrus,and honey, clean and enticing. Tastes rather dry and spicy with a good, clean, noble hop bitterness at the tail end. Moderately sweet, well balanced. Very nice, would repeat.

Poured into Chimay glass a hazy amber with a nice thick white head that settled lumpy but lasted till end. Thick lacing. Aroma was yeast, malt, some hops in the background. Taste is yeasty, malty, spice and some pepper in the yeasty long finish. Feels thicker in the mouth but slick. Fantastic.

Tasted on draft. Smooth flavor with accents of citrus, wood and malts. I have tasted better.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Pours yellow with a nice head. Smell is belgian yeast, pretty clean, pretty refreshing, some citrus, loads of bubblegum. Taste is clove, some leather notes, a bit doughyfeel to it, but very dry, and some grass bitterness from the hops. A bit over carbonated, but my prefered Chimay.

On draught at Roscoes for Belgian Beer Summit. Fizzy clear golden color. Aroma is apple, pear, and light yeast. Taste is grape, apple, pear, light spiced yeast. A fairly light tripel, with a refreshing fruity yeast finish.
Un mélange d amertume et d acidité. goutée il y a quelques temps.Follow me on instagram : splatch25
Bottle bought in Belgium. Bottle conditioned. Typical Begium aroma and taste, A bit sweet. Quite good.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en www.biirkonnen.com. Color ambar. Sabor a malta, levadura, alcohol, con regusto a caramelo.

Pours a slightly hazy amber with one finger of loose white head that gradually compacts slightly, light lacing. Nose is malt forward, banana, Belgian yeast, apples and pears, earthy and spicy. Taste is bread with honey, peppery yeast, bitter aftertaste. Mouth feel is medium- to full-bodied, with a lingering bitter finish.
Much less fruit than the Chimay Red or Blue. A straight tripel, very well done, and much more sessionable than the Red or Blue, but perhaps a little less interesting.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2015 Bottle. Poors a beautiful honey color, quite strong on carbonation which fades rapidly, generous foam head. Delicate grain and yeast aroma, slightly acidic from citrus and dried oranges. Very nice. Taste is creamy, sour kick with a beautiful development of tastes, mostly wheat that resembles Weissen -but much much more delicate and refined, silky smooth-. The residu of the bottle pours a little darker and gives the beer a touch of freshness that resembles Hoegaarden. One of my all time favorite beers, no doubt.
Bottle 330 ml from Alko. Pours amber with huge head. Aroma with some caramel and alcohol. Taste with some medium sweetness. Ok beer.
UPDATED: JUL 6, 2016 Tasapainoinen. Ollakko vai eikö olla hyvä? Elinan kesäterassi alkuillasta. Huonoin Chimay. Edit. Perusolut. Ei tuossa mitään ihmeitä. Iso vaahto, viina maistuu.

Une de mes préférais en pression!! J'adore sont amertume mais elle et complètement différente en bouteille car je n'arrive pas a trouvais quoi mais je n'arrive pas a la finir alors qu'en pression j'en boirais des litre ^^

Cloudy amber color, average sized white head. Small lacing. Full body, average carbonation. Aroma is malts, hops, yeast, spices, fruits, freshly baked bread. Medium sweet and medium bitter taste with very pleasant bitter aftertaste. I loved it.

Oh yeah, thats it...thats it. Just so clean so fresh so perfect. This is what a Tripel should be. I can go on and on about this but just go get one and drink it slow and appreciate the work that goes into it. This beer is just perfect. I cant say anything else.

Pours a hazy amber body with a thick and lasting head. Typical belgish aroma and a fresh and nice taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 330 ml at Pivkan, Zagreb. Pours amber with large white head. Spices and yeast aroma. Spicy and yeasty flavor with some fruits.
UPDATED: JUL 4, 2014 Donkerblond, bijna amberkleurig bier met aromas van gerst, tarwe, citrus. Lekker romig in de mond met een heerlijke afdronk. Een van de betere tripels.
Chimay Tripel is een mooi donkerblond bier. De verse gist is duidelijk waarneembaar. Fris aroma. Absoluut binnen mijn top 8!

miły, owocowo-drożdżowy aromat, lekko słodki. kolor prawie pomarańczowy, mętny, nieprzejrzysty. piana skąpa, ale dość trwała. w smaku chmiel, zioła, owoce i lekka alkoholowa goryczka. bardzo mocno nasycone.
Backlog. On tap at Green Lion Inn. Yeasty with loads of spices, a bunch of citrus and some hay.
cereal, banana, floral, golden, cloudy, minimal head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation,

Cloudy peach/light amber color with a white head. Aromas of yeasty esters and phenols. Taste is straight up Belgian yeast/malt combo that is oh so typical these days. Flavors of Belgium. Raise the fucken flag, we are being invaded.
Belle mousse et couleur orange brune. Goût houblonné et levure, a la belge. Bonne triple
bottle 33cl from Alko @ home. Pours hazy orange with a large white head. Aroma of citrus, yeast. Spice, citrus, yeast in the flavor, high CO2.

Medium-strong aroma has sweet caramel and a bit alcohol. Bit reddish yellow color with white light head. A bit hazy liquid. Strong taste with flavors of sweet caramel, peach, banana, some hops and yeast. Very balanced with wide taste spectrum. Long, yeasty aftertaste. Light-medium palate with medium carbonation.

Pours a deep golden amber with frothy white foam. Has the aroma of banana, hops, and yeast. Has a mass erection of flavor involving Belgian yeast, hops, banana, and a malty caramelish note. Very good.
Moins intéressante que les autres Chimay, elle reste une bonne trappiste à déguster.
Bottle, pours amber with a white head. Tastes of banana and yeast with some bitterness. Nice balance and a good beer.
Een lekkere tripe van Chimay. Grasaroma, duidelijke hopsmaak. Drinken met het gist dat in de fles aanwezig is.
bottle. deep golden with one finger head. sweet and lightly fruity. nice yeast and spice. its good, but not deserving of the classic status that its achieved.
Aroma of malt, yeast, citrus. Rich but refreshing. More bitter than sweet. Pretty good.

W kolorze złota. Bardzo obfita piana, prawie biała, ładnie znaczy szkło jak opada. W aromacie świeżość, owoce, chmiel. W smaku cytrusy i goryczka, mogłaby być bardziej wyrazista. Wysycenie wysokie. Ciekawszy był dla mnie Chimay Bleue.

After tasting so many different triples it feels great to return to a true classic. 
Nice golden colour, lasting head, strong malty taste, hints of spices, typical yeasty notes, alcool shines through but not disturbingly.
A classic.

Poured into official glass. Amber with a lot of yeast and a finger of frothy, white head. Smells fruity, almost like champagne and bready. Tastes like dark fruit, malt, and a finishing bitter, kind of sticky and floral. The palate is medium and velvet. Had it before, pretty tasty!

Hazy amber, airy white head. Fruity, hoppy, malty aroma. Mothfeel is soft. Taste has a hint of wheat. Solid, but not overwhelming.

Forte... Bastante amarga..gosto acentuado como toda trappist... 
Existem melhores.. A propaganda vale mais do q a cerveja

Aroma: wheat, fruity malts. Appearance: hazy pale gold, big white head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: dry bitters coming up, low carbonation, some wheat notes again. Overall: decent Abbey Tripel. Bottle at The Champion, Bayswater.
UPDATED: FEB 1, 2015 la miglior chimay e una delle migliori birre mai provate in generale. dissetante.

J ai pas vraiment aimer à vrai dire, très oublonner, fort goût de malt, onnsent beaucoup l alcool, non, vraiment, je vais pas y revenir.. Ça reste un bon rapport qualité prix, à 1,21? en promo chez leclerc...
On tap, poured into a trappist glass..straw yellow color..thin head..aroma of fruits, yeast, wheat..didnt taste like aroma..disappointing
Tap. Aromas of pine resin, spice, clove, citrus and banana. Flavor is sweet banana and citrus with some spice, clove, and yeast. Medium.

bottle bought at a local supermarket. poured a cloudy yellow colour with a white head. belgian yeast, banana, sweetness of honey, some grass, floral, and bread notes. well def. not my favourite trappist
Cest pas ma chimay favorite, elle nest pas non plus affreuse cest pas vraiment ma blanche favorite

Pours a slightly cloudy orange with a fluffy white head. Funky slightly banana aroma. Slight raisin aroma with some alcohol notes. Taste has some tang to it with an effervescent carbonation. Medium mouthfeel.

Aroma improves as this beer opens up. I smell perfume a bit of alcohol cheese light caramel and light fruit. Beer is a foggy burnt yellow.

Appearance: Foam lingers, although it was chilled it easily generated a two inch head in my wine glass. Foam lingers around for 15 min and settles to the edges of the glass with a thin island of foam in the center of the glass that remains throughout your drinking experience. 

Taste: This triple is bitter and dry. Light fruit is present but I wouldnt describe this beer as sweet. There is a definite basement mustiness that works well with sence of a honey comb that could also be described as soap. vAs a note the fruitness really comes out on the palette when/if you burp.

cheese, mild fungi, basement and 

Palate: Thin and dry. Alcohol is warming to the palate and beyond. 

When I think of triples I tend to lean towards a stronger fruit profile along with the funk this beer is able to present to us. That being said this is a lovely beer that is perfect when I am looking for something dry and bitter. A pleasant change to my usual preferences.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein oranges Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig süß, alkoholisch, Nüsse, Früchte.
Geschmack sehr süß malzig, dunkle Früchte, hefig, leicht alkoholisch.

10oz goblet at The Abbey DC. Pours a clear orange with a lot of thick, filmy white head. Nose of perfume, sugar, lemon, mild soap, yeast, honey comb. Flavor is nice, sweet, sugary, honey, mild spice, a little white pepper, soap, yeast, brie rind. Full finish, creamy. Classic.
I like to drink beer this summer. I drink a refreshing fragrance taste like Muscat. Its also beer pleasing a lot there is also a hop is like beer.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2014 Pours cloudy golden, almost opaque, with a thick white head. Aroma of honey, yeasty malt, banana and slightly of caramel. Taste of sweet bready malt, banana, along with a mild sourness, bitterness and hoppy flavour. Excellent beer.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours hazy gold with a white head. Taste citrus, spice, orange. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a slightly hazy, golden amber hue. Presents a bold off-white head, which has a creamy, rocky density that is in no rush to dissipate. Wafting out of the foam are wonderful toffee, caramel and cereal aromas from the malts. A bouquet of cloves, cinnamon, dried fruits, banana, orange peel and pumpkin emerge likely from the unique yeast. Hops provide moderate hints of Muscat, white pepper and citrus, but are most pronounced on the long-lasting finish. Flavours include: orange pith, dried apricot and clove. This elegant tripel has a rich, dry, creamy and slightly warming mouthfeel.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2014 Poured from a bottle a hazy yellow with a healthy white foam head. Has a sweet yeast aroma. Flavor is also sweet, with a touch of honey and fruit. Has a medium body feel, pretty smooth.

75cl bottle, at home @10°C
One of the best beers I tasted so far. Perfect palate and finish. A taste you wouldnt expect when you see the light color. Must-taste beer!

Bottle.

A- Banana, tropical fruits, wheat, spices.

A- Golden color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Strong alcohol taste, banana, mild citrus, wheat.

P- Medium body, average texture, medium carbonation, strong finish.

O- Quite overrated. Definitely the lesser of the three Chimays. Strong alcohol tones that dont fade until towards the end. Decent fruit tones, but still not worth the price tag.

Two brothers beer tasting night beer 9. Hazy yellow orange colour decent white head + lacing. Aroma is yeasty banana. Taste is yeasty banana nice spicy hop bitterness. Medium body and carbonation. Good stuff
2 brothers beer tasting beer 9. Hazy golden amber with small head. Aroma of yeast and citrus fruits. Taste is spice, yeast, citrus fruits and some herbs. Medium bodied and a little oily. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Pours a lovely bright orange woth a large frothy, slowly settling whote head. Aroma is orange, citrus, apricot, funk, coriander, herbal notes. Taste is citrus, apricot, orange, coriander, honey, funk. Mouthfeel is crisp with lots of carbonation. Aftertaste is citrus, funk and honey.

From an 11.8oz bottle. Medium gold color. Has a big white head that dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma is yeast and some malt. Taste is sweet, some yeasty-sourness with a very mild bitterness on the backend. Highly carbonated - a bit too much for my tastes. Very refreshing and pleasant - and thats coming from an IPA fan whos not big on Belgian beers, but Im expanding my horizons. This beer makes me want to try more of Belgian-style beers.

DATE TASTED: February 16, 2014... GLASSWARE: Chimay 125th anniversary chalice... OCCASION: snow/laundry/Olympics and Game of Thrones--a good night! APPEARANCE: semi-opaque orange-brown body; soap-like bubbles create a prolific head atop the glass; solid lacing... AROMA: brilliant banana and allspice; light citric scents of orange and coriander; tart and punchy--promising...PALATE: signature Chimay body--drinkable and quenching; 8% ABV never tasted so agreeable...TASTE: banana, spices--pepper?--with some citric kick--orange?--and pear/apple---a round, fulfilling taste... OVERALL: a joy to revisit an old venerated ale; this beer strikes the quintessential balance of finesse and strength, the holy aspect of brewing that blesses and breaks in equal sips...

Hazy, but youre stil able to see trough the beer. With a nice white head. citrus and malt aroma. Medium carbonation. Dry in taste, oranges and berries with a slightly bitter aftertaste. A beautiful, fresh tripel. Excellent on a summerday in stead of a white beer or a normal pilsner. But to be honest is is great on any occasion.
Bottle from McTapps ta Sabine. Hazy yellow with a huge head. Aroma is yeasty wheat. Flavor is fruity citrus, yeast and caramel on a dry sweet finish.
Drank with Rik 20-2-2014. Okay beer. Average blond. A bit metal taste. Lacks richness.
On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Pours a hazy amber color with a bit of head. Mild maltiness and belgian yeast. A little citrusy.

Rigtig lækker tripel, lys, ufiltreret og rig på skum. Dejlig gæret aroma og sødlig smag, som dog har en bitter afslutning. Lækker og meget tilgængelig øl.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Gouden kleur met stevige witte schuimkraag. Ruikt super, naar banaan en hop. Smaak is super, beetje zoet, bittere nasmaak.
Hazy gold with a firm creamy top. Yeasty and quite some hop. Finish is medium long and relatively dry / bitter. A bit of vanilla and muscat.
Pours a hazy gold. Aroma is fruity - bananas and spices. Strong taste that starts sweet and ends with hoppy bitterness.
Cloudy. Golden yellow color. Medium carbonated. Fruity aroma with yeast. Taste of apricot and yeast. Relatively low sweetness. Bitterness in the finish.

11.2oz bottle poured into a goblet. Strong banana and clove aromas jump out right after I finished pouring. This was accompanied by the smell of fresh baked bread, some hints of vanilla and some spices (some black pepper perhaps?). Near mid-glass, the dominant aromas turns to raisin and honey. It pours a hazy, straw gold color with a creamy, pillowy white head that retains well and leaves a decent amount of lacing down the side of the glass. Medium levels of sweet and bitter balance nicely on the tongue with maybe a touch of sour (maybe a touch of astringency?) tucked away in there. Its a medium-full body beer that feels syrupy smooth, creamy and buttery going down - helped in part by a soft carbonation. Some buttery and caramel flavors come forward on the tongue with some berry and light fruit flavors. It finishes somewhat dry, but clean, with a mellow roastiness and some resin qualities as well as a light alcohol warmth. The roasted and resin qualities stick around for awhile in the aftertaste.

Decent sort of Belgian blond beer. Quite cloudy with quick fading white head. Fruity, yeasty and alcohol - not too complex but nice tasting. Nice small amount of bitterness aftertaste. The 8% is going to my head...!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Burnt orange color. Nose of overripe fruit, citrus, orange, fruit peel, and herbal hops. Flavor is citrus, toasted malt, light banana, and herbal bitterness. Heavy carb finish.

Cloudy yellow pour lots of light white fluffy head that sticks to the glass like ice sticks to my shitty winter tires. Aroma - honey, light hops, grass, lemon, melon, yeast, and spices. Taste - light bitterness, honey, butterscotch, spices, no heat on the finish. Very well balanced, really nice.

11.2 oz. bottle. Appearance: two fingers white foam, golden orange-yellow color, cloudy. Aroma: light floral, tart fruit, light earthy tones, slight caramel. Palate: lively carbonation, dry finish, light body, sparkling texture. Taste: nice enjoyable mild sweet and very light tartness that ends when you swallow. Overall, very nice. Enjoyed with a chicken cordon bleu and matched relatively well.

Nice tripel. I look for light fruit notes first and foremost in this style. And this one has them. Hard to go wrong!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Hazy gold with a big white head leaving lots of lacing. Aroma is Belgian yeast and fruity esters. Lots of competing fruit notes in the taste with a honey like sweetness. Rich creamy palate and moderate carb. Very nice.

Bottle in Jerusalem. Exp date: 2014. Already looks hazy even in the bottle, with lots of sediment floating near the bottom. Pours a pale lemony orange, hazy, with a finger of yellowish white frothy head. Carbonation in the glass is calm. Aroma is subdued initially -- some skunk, more vegetables, spicy, some grassy hopes as well. Not particularly appealing and even somewhat unappealing. As the beer warms, though, it develops a soft butter-on-a-fresh-roll aroma thats quite rich and pleasant. Taste is lemony and champagne-like with a mildly bitter finish that leaves a slightly sour note on the back of the tongue. However, it becomes sweeter as the beer warms, suggesting butterscotch, but not really anything to write home about. Body is medium with high carbonation. Lacing is decent. Bottom line: meh; not something my palate will remember a day from now.

Im going to leave a short review. 
I pours and opaque dark golden colour with white head.
Aroma: Grassy hops and notes of malt
Taste: Citrus, malt, lively carbonation, grassy hops

Poured from bottle. Appearance is the most lacking in this beer; appears yellow and similar to a lager. Smells of banana, spice and yeast. Silky on the palate. Tastes of yeast and honey. Notes of sweet hay.

Bottle. Hay, citrus, yeast and some hops. Really great aroma and some really nice sweetness in the taste to go along with the nice flavors. One of my favorite tripels with the characteristic carbonation of Chimay.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A hazy orange-brown beer with a good head. Light persistance. Fruity aroma, herbs, floral, bread, alcohol. Nice bitterness over light sweetness. Medium body and texture. Lively carbonation. Dry bitter finish. Overall, a very good tripel : dry, nice hop aroma.

Pours hazy golden honey color. Nose is unique Belgian yeast, cracker. Taste is very dry bordering on metallic, little bitterness, Belgian yeast. Pretty one note, and extremely dry, mouthfeel on the thick side. Disappointed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden-orange with big white, long-lasting creamy head. Aroma of orange, pepper, honey. Taste of lemon peel and orange with peppery and anise note and characteristic belgian yeast taste. Nice bitterness in the finish. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Great, complex tripel.

Reviewed from notes.
She pours a decent hazy golden orange color and leaves the same colored body with a finger and a halfs worth of foamy head that rises just a bit and falls leaving some sporadic foamy lacing in its wake.
The aroma is bready and fruity - more so with that normal "iced apples" thing I always get in most Tripels. Light spices round her out a bit.
The taste is spicy and sweet all the way through the entire beer with an "iced apple" aftertaste and a dry spicy finish. On the palate, she sits about a light to medium, comes across somewhat sessionable. The ABV seems to hide itself pretty well. The carbonation is there but still has a nice smooth quality to it but not so much as the harshness is there but not overly done. Overall, Im always glad I always give Chimay a try every holiday season. This is a good Belgian Tripel Id have again.
UPDATED: FEB 24, 2014 Fiquei um pouco desapontado com essa Chimay. Ela é mais lupulada, o que a torna diferente, mas tem um gosto muito evidente de álcool.

One of my favorite beers. We serve this often at our café. It tastes better drafted compared to the bottled version. This triple has enough bitter and a little sour in it to counter the typical sweetness of some Belgium triples.

Clear golden amber, white head
Bread, yeasts, cereals, winey, riped fruit, passito
Sweet fruits, bitter ending and aftertaste
Bottle 33 cl. Color is dark golden, hazy, foamy head. Aroma: yeast, hint of fruits and alcohol. Taste is medium bitter. Average carbonation. Good beer.

Bottle. Hazy orange pour with huge long lasting white head. Fresh wheat like aroma with clear malty notes. Complex taste with high alcohol but it comes out wery well balanced. Intense bitterness. Lovely

33cl bottle. Pours a hazy dark golden color with foamy cream-colored head. Aroma is a bit of banana and fruitiness. Mellow bitter flavor. Bit of orange in the flavor. Creamy mouthfeel and bitter finish. I enjoyed this.

Bottle to chalice. Dark hazy gold pour with a creamy white head that laces down. Nose is sweet belgian yeast, honey, some spice. Taste is nice dry bitter sweet front, belgian yeast sweetness, some bubblegum and earthy bitterness in the finish. Nice and smooth, a bit warming.

Bottle. Color is dark golden, hazy, rocky head, excellent lacing. Aroma: grass, yeast, hint of fruits and alcohol. Taste is bitter with a little sweetness, hay, grass, alcohol, ginger (?). Lively carbonation, bitter finish.

The cork came away with a healthy pop that hinted at the carbonation contained within, it pours a hazy amber with a large off white, creamy head that lasts. The aroma is initially hard to get but once you suck the head down a bit it gets through as a spicy yeasty shot of deliciousness. The tastes were lovely, it starts with soft, slightly spiced caramel, changing more towards the yeast notes then finishing with a slight bitterness that lingers for a little while.

33 bottle. Golden colour, huge white head very lasting, good lacing. Aroma is fruity, yeasty with alcohol. Taste is malty, yeasty, some fruit. Strong bitterness finish. Strong carbonation, medium body.

Aroma: Cheesy, yeast, hey, light hint of citrus, hint of banana Appearance: Gold, yellow, quite some carbonation, hazy, white head, big bubble, moderately disappearing head, medium lace Taste: Banana, (vanilla?), bit of cheese, slightly dry low bitter end

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2014 If you could ferment bubble gum mixed with overripe fruits, bananas and mushy bruised apples this is what it would taste like. A little carbonation, little coriander, lots of bubble gum. Not good bubble gum either... stale rotten bubble gum and decomposed rotten fruit with just a hint of velvety smooth wet cat pillow. Did I mention that it tastes of bubble gum? I tried to blow a bubble with a mouth full but I just blew chunks all over the shih tzu!

750 bottle, a hazy gold tan color. Honey, fruit, rasins, and some peach nose. Mildy sweet with some grape flavors, bitter and dry. Smooth with some creaminess. Lets not forget this is as authentic as it gets.

Bottle poured a murky orange hue w/ huge rocky slowly diminishing white head. Moderate bready aromas. Initial flavor is light sweet w/ a moderate bitter finish. Tastes are golden raisins, vodka, hay, grass, and resin. Medium bodied, lively carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, and warm finish.

Cloudy orange beer with light but durable head. Aroma has bananas, peach, tropical fruits and yeast. Taste has yeast, fruits and bitter hops and grainy malts. Really high carbonation and medium body. Too carbonated for my taste but good anyhow.

Cloudy golden liquid, small creamy white head. Subdued (maybe too cold) spicy aroma with almonds, some caramel and alcohol. The taste is way more powerful and quite bitter, as in bitter orange peel, bitter almonds and yeast with a long dry aftertaste. Medium carbonation with lots if tiny bubbles, rich mouthfeel. Not the strongest but definitely the heaviest of the classic Chimay beers.

Bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy dark gold body under a large frothy white head that climbed above my Chimay chalice rim. Looks right at home in this glass indeed. The nose is hard to get to through all this head at first. The nose is nicely fruity, but it doesnt come across as being from a lot of residual sweetness, just from the yeast. Some nice floral hops, bready malt, Belgian yeast, a slight white grape juice like note. Finishes with just a touch of alcohol and its still pretty dry despite the use of the candi sugar. Lots of fizzy active carbonation at first, but it blew off quite a bit of it after sitting 15 or 20 minutes. A pretty nice Triple, nice to revisit a beer after a long time and still see its as good as you remembered. Currently the beer with the most ratings on here that I have yet to rate.

Pours a medium golden color with two plus fingers of puffy thick white foam. The nose is earthy grain with hints of golden raisin, yeasty esters. Palate follows the nose with great balance between the fruit and the grain. Perfect carbonation and mouthfeel with a clean lingering bitterness.

A fresh Belgium beer with a surprisingly hoppy finish reminiscent of a good IPA. This is a beer to savour:

Rated by BrewTom

Shy aroma with murky presentation.
Tastes fine, but rather forgettable palate that leaves an uninspired impression.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had this from the bottle and on draft. I definitely preferred the draft. Yeasty aroma with some fruit and alcohol. Poured golden honey colored with a thick white head. Looks wonderful. Tastes of mild yeast, hops and some fruit. Both sweet and bitter at once. Wonderful example of the style. I need to drunk this more often.
Fruity aroma, bananas and spice. Pours hazy orange with a frothy white head. Great smooth flavor, goes down smooth and easy.

Utseendet er upåklagelig, uklar mørk gul med fluffy høyt skum. Aroma av gjær, banan, humle og mariekjeks. Smaksbildet er stort sett det samme, godt balansert og behagelig å drikke. Litt bitter ettersmak, mye kullsyre, ganske tørr.

33cl bottle @ home. Clear top, hazy bottom, golden color, average white head. Aroma banana, citrus, biscuit in the nose, then yeast, hops, bit fruity, grapefruit, pine resin, soap. Taste light sweetness, medium bitterness, bit salty at the end. Light body, bit dry, lively carbonation, long lasting moderated bitter finish. Delicious!
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 A brilliant example of the style. Could have been a little fresher, other than that this is near perfection. Not too dry or sweet, well balanced.

330ml BB 2013
Snagged this a couple of years cheaply due to mislabelling; obvious yeast coming into suspension in the bottle.
Pours a murky orange gold body holding a dense white head.
Spicy aroma; white pepper, clove, stewed apple and pear, sour cream, light candy sugar, bit of Camembert funk and cereal grain.
Thin on the palate, distinctly so, age taking its toll. Dry overall, the abv is an afterthought.
Palate doesnt deliver as much as the nose promises, but still plenty of spicy phenolics, light fruity esters, and mild cheesy funk. Low bitterness to finish, dryness to finish.
Sadly age wasnt kind to what is usually quite a rich pale beer, but certainly accentuates the yeast character.

Poured into a tulip glass there was abundant head and a nice yeasty aroma, a little sweet smelling. Cloudy amber appearance. Nice yeast flavor with slight bitterness from the hops. Lots of carbonation and a fruit like finish. A great beer.

Farbe: schön gelb-orange mit cremig-weißem Schaum 
Geruch: nach reifen Früchten, süßem Kuchenteig. 
Geschmack: Der Antrunk ist cremig-süßlich mit leichter alkoholischer Schärfe, im Hauptteil wird das Ganze herber, mit süßen Obst-Anklängen. Der Nachgeschmack ist sehr herb-scharf, so dass die restlichen schön süßlichen Aromen fast gänzlich überdeckt werden. Auf der Zunge bleibt eine starke Herbe zurück, mit ganz leichten süßen Tönen. Für mich schmeckt das Ganze etwas unausgewogen. 


Test vom 10.3.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,7,7,4,12,6 - 6,90

A: pours a hazy honey ale with three fingers of yellow head which falls slowly to a quilt of the same. Spotty lacing.

S: Lemons, grain, coriander, candy sugar, some bits of yeast. Nice nose, less intense than anticipated.

T: Spicy, yeasty, bready and sweet. 

M: Heavy for the style with lively carbonation. A little thick for the style IMO.

O: Good stuff. I prefer Westmalle, however, for the win.

Serving type: bottle

07-22-2011
Buena cerveza tripel con un excelente aroma, color ambar amarillento, sabor a caramelo y amargo

(33 cl bottle from Belgisk Bryg; BBD: 2016; L13-434) Pours a mostly clear amber with big, fluffy foamcap that seems to stick around for a while even if occasionally small holes pop open in the cap. Lace clings to the sides of the glass when gently bopping it from side to side. Aroma is grain, belgian yeast with spicy notes, alcohol along some notes of greenish hops. Oily texture, medium carbonation, medium body with a lingering bitter and slightly dry finish. Flavour is mostly bitter and dry with spicy aroma notes.

12oz bottle from Brewmasters compliments of Kent R. Straw colored, murky clarity with mostly diminishing white fizzy head. Yeast & fruit aroma, I had a hard time with this. Tasted like apple juice with a kick. Fizzy carbonation on the palate. Not for me.
Fantastica cerveja belga. Bela aparência e na boca remete ao frescor característico deste estilo.
Nice golden color with not very big white head. In aroma malt and citrus hops. Balanced taste. Great beer in my opinion its better than the red one.
UPDATED: MAR 5, 2014 Hazy golden, with big white head. Belgian yeast, cloves, green banana, light malty character. Medium bodied, slightly slick feel. Classis tripel, very good for what it is.
Hazy gold body with a nice thick white head. Sweet aroma of banana, a bit floral, some citrus. Taste is sweet with a very slight bitterness. Very pleasant to drink. Easy refreshing beer.
nice citric aroma,a little apricot,no bite to it .definitely made for sipping or drinking with light fare.

330ml bottle at home. Pours a hazy gold with a big white head. Aromas of banana, vanilla and orange, good yeastiness too. Taste has a light sweetness then a good kick of bitterness. Creamy texture and long clean finish. Very nice.

BB 2015, 0,33L bottle. Intense sweet aroma, there is yeast, apples, other fruits, hints of dryness. Pours clear golden with white head. The head stays for a long time. Taste: sweet apples, raisins, rather yeasty, nice bitterness. Bitter finish with lingering fruits. Alcohol is also in the taste, but not dominating. Lively carbonation. Overall: my favorite of the "regular" Chimays. It is sweet, but also bitter, alcohol isnt too strong. Nice one.
Pours hazy about with a nice head. Sweet malt, almost vanilla like flavour.Just enough bitterness to set it off.

Sampled side by side by side with the other chimays. clearish golden straw with good white head. Sweet straw nose with hints of vanilla. Has a bitter grassy hoppiness. Muscatty. definitely my least favorite of the four, but not bad.
On tap at Biercab. Orange-golden colour with white head. Fruity, malty aroma. Sweet, fruity taste, slightly bitter and malty. Medium to full body.

Golden dark yellow color, quite large and firm head. Complex and full, aroma, light malt and notes of bread. Full and rich body, lots of malt, dry fruit with a good bitterness. Long and rich finish with pleasing bitterness.

Bottle: cloudy haze, amber red and great head. Huge malty, fruity lift. Dried fruit. Christmas pudding, raisin, date and dry fig. Dense yet bright. Dry to off dry. Freshness could be slightly sour or acid. Low to moderate bitterness. Chocolate, rich, dense and long flavor. Dried fruit. Caramel. Layers of flavor. Nothing pokes out. 
Its just balanced without any raw obnoxious edges.

Pours golden and hazy with robust head. Lively carbonation. Yeasty aroma and taste with typical Belgian hops. Some sourness detected. Bitter finish. Similar to the 3-hopped version of Duvel. Nice one.

Dark golden colour, somewhat hazy, with a firm head. Aroma from fruity hops (citrus) and yeast. Taste is hoppy. Hints of banana. A gentle sweetness which disappears for a nice bitterness. Alcoholic (not overwhelming) and dry finish. Recommended.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours hazy yellow with big foamy white head. First sensations are an nice smooth bitterness blending with good Belgium yeast. Notes of banana, raisins, orange, grassy, earthy. This one is pretty straightforward and one dimensional kind of drink. Not as good as i was expecting from a Chimay but very smooth and easy drinkable still.
Poured from draft at Driscolls in Austin. Just understand that this Belgium beauty is outstanding. From draft, awesome. Get it if you see it.

From a bottle. Clear pale gold with thin white head. Smells great, balanced, dry, notes of raisins and plumbs on the palate ... Deliciously drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice and crisp tripel. Slightly more bitter than your average tripel, but this doesnt bother me at all, as long as it is well balanced. As this was the case with the other Chimay beers, same thing for this tripel. Probably one of the best tripels out there.

På fat @ Ölrepubliken, Göteborg. Dimmig orangefärgad med vitt skum. Citronskal, örter, svag vitpeppar, banan och apelsin i doften. Smaker av torkad frukt, banan, citron, apelsin och vitpeppar. Medelstor beska, medelsötma, fyllig kropp. Lättdrucken trots dess höga ABV.

Nice fruity aroma with no overwhelming banana or other bad fruit in it. pale, cloudy, white foam, only downside a sharp alcohol taste sometimes seams too much. Overall near perfection, but dont want more than one at the time.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2015 Deep amber to orange color, creamy white head. Belgian yeast nose, fruity, candi sugar, almonds, hint of alcohol. Sweet taste, caramel malt, candi sugar, nuts, fruity notes, hints of apple and alcohol. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, creamy texture.

[ASPETTO] 			
Oro carico, tendente al marroncino chiaro, velata, fine residuo; schiuma bianca, abbondante, molto compatta e cremosa			
[OLFATTO]			
profumi di cereali, crosta di pane, lieviti, un leggero biscottato, miele e con un tocco erbale, speziato e note alcoliche			
[GUSTO]			
un approccio iniziale dolce, note maltate e miele, che si mescolano fin dallinizio con sentori alcolici, i quali vanno in crescendo traghettando verso note amare nette , erbali, ed un tocco pepato finale.			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio, vellutata la palato, carbonazione moderata, sentore alcolico evidente			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
il nome è garanzia per una tripel di ottima fattura, forse un po scarica al naso, ma ben equilibrata e consistente al palato. Ottimo rapporto qualità -prezzo.
Pours a hazy orange with a small/medium head. Slightly hoppy and yeasty aroma. Delightful sparkly taste of dried fruits/raisins. Bitter aftertaste, but doesnt linger.

Pours a cloudy yellow/orange with medium sized white head. Whoo...tangerine hops knocking through. The citrus is very present for the aroma. Also lovely yeasts and bread. Yes, the hops are boss, very herbal and floral citrus fruit with of course the coriander. Great taste. Awesome bitter linger. Again the bread, a nice and heavy wheat brown bread. Cream...loosely whipped cream mouthfeel, especially after rolling the goodies around for a few seconds. One of the better tripels for me. Really love the fruity hoppyness. Prize catcher.

Cor dourada escura, com boa formação inicial de espuma que depois ficou com uma fina camada. Aroma e sabor alaranjado e comum entre as belgas tripel. Conjunto muito bom, mas achei que não se destaca entre as belgas tripel do mesmo estilo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Persistent head. Cloudy golden color. Slightly sweet, raisins and a little peach, soon trumped by a persistent sourness with a long aftertaste. Quite refreshing but not complex.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Greal as a tripel, but not my top 100. Aroma of yeast is very strong. Head is high and long lasting. Worthy to try

I enjoyed this beer as a social sipper. It has a full bodied flavour and taste, with a head that never dissipates during the journey of the glass, but one or two of these treats at the most. The 8% says enough. An introductory exploration into the Trappistes extensive collection. Lovely.

golden hazy ,small long lasting foam; fruity and floral aroma with some coriander?; medium sweet and bitter, very slightly sour; rather full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long bittersweet finish;
Overall: very well-made tripel, without a flaw

Pours light amber with white head. First impression of aroma - wtf? Smells like a Tuborg from a can. After shaking in the glass some other aromas came out, like typical Belgian yeast, a bit malted flavors. Tastes a bit overcarbonated, nice hop bitterness then malty sweetness comes in and a bit alcochol at the end of the tongue. At the end of the glass it tastes better, must get used to it. Overall nice beer, but there are better belgian light beers to my particular taste.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2013 Petite mousse persistante et éparpillée. Il y a un dépôt dans le fond, peut être parce que je l?ai gardé trop longtemps. L?odeur qui s?en dégage est super agréable je trouve, un peu fruitée. Le goût est d?abord doux avant de laisser un palais très amer qui dure assez longtemps. Au final une très bonne trappiste qui se laisse deguster avec beaucoup de plaisir.
Looks tasty in proper glass. Light head. Malt sweetness balanced with fruity bitterness, last long in mouth.

Bière blonde au fut@ La Maison du Peuple. Profil chimasien reconnaissable rien quau nez :amertume fine, malt pâle léger, froment et eau faiblement minéralisée. Cest un bel assemblage équilibrée sur des notes amères minérales prononcées qui simposent sur la longueur. Comme le service au fût offre une dégustation plus légère quen bouteille (la garde sur lie en moins), il fait bien ressortir les différents malts et les différents houblons au point que le palais plutôt sec et un peu aigre et suret ressort bien sur larrière goût avec des notes fruitées marquant les papilles sur la longueur.

Appearance with amber / golden color and high, dense and persistent head of foam.
Fruity and sweet aroma.
On the palate: caramel malt, hops and bitter sweet.
Excellent Belgian, one of my favorites!

Pours hazy and deep golden. Head is just perfect with numerous tiny bubbles. Exactly what I expected. Aroma is mainly malty, but you can feel dried fruits, raisins, some peach. Taste is sweet and malty in the beginning, but finish is long bitter and suprsingly heavy for me. Something like bitter orange peel. Its not bad, but not really what I expect from tripel. Average carbonation. Great example of tripel, but I wouldnt call it top one.
Colore biondo carico e schiuma bianca e compatta che forma dei bei riccioli. Il profumo promette un bellamaro poi mantenuto alla beva. Una buona birra!

Pours hazy amber with a handsome white head. Aroma is very fruity, especially pear and apple, not very much citrus. Also some earthy, farmhouse yeastiness is around. Taste is balanced between grainy maltiness, earthy yeastiness and some moderate, herbal hoppiness. Fruitiness isnt as pear and apple -based as the aroma suggested but grapefruit is around more. Overall the taste is dryish and nicely long. Full-bodied, smooth palate is very Belgian. A good, well balanced tripel.

Bottle at Eds party. Pours a cloudy orange colour, with a frothy white foam. Aroma is yeasty, spiced with coriander, light citrus. Taste is light hoppy bite, yeasty sourness, and a nice light sweet note of citrus, coriander.

caramel, bready aroma, citrus, herbs, leaves., slighty banana bubblegum, clear golden amber, minimal head, white foam, 
very clear rich floral whilst also light taste. Very high quality but not as exciting as I like.

Very nice triple served and the goblet glass nice head that lasted through the entire tasting.... mouth feels a little too bubbly for me but on par with most triples

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

i may have been drinking for a little while now, but that won;t stop me from snuggling up with a big bottle of Chimay. Poured into a lovely Trappist chalice, cloudy amber topped with a lacy white head. Aroma of what I con only describe as Belgian; citrus and spice and sweetness. Rich mouthfeel, surprisingly good bitter hops, calming orange zest and coriander. Heaven in a glass.
Bottle cloudy orange body with white not very lasting head nice Aroma of fruits taste is malt with lasting bitter finish great classic beer
Cloudy orange with small head. Aroma of spice, yeast, malty. Taste is yeasty, malty with a balanced high bitteress and finishes with a warming alcohol. Dry finish
Mørk strågul i fargen og lyst skum. En del frisk hvetesmak i brygget kommer godt til sin rett sammen med rekemåltidet. Fruktig aroma, som er godt balansert med en ikke for påtrengende bitterhet.

God trippel fra chimay

Meget grumset af gær

En af de bedre trippel øl fea Belgien

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cor âmbar com boa formação de espuma e boa persistência. No aroma, frutas amarelas, damasco, malte. Sabor com médio dulçor e amargor, damascos secos. Amargor com media persistência ao final. Ótima cerveja. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Model tripel for me. Not the best one I drank as it is not breaking any rules provoking your senses but a decent Belgian Tripel. Beautiful hazy golden colour, dense creamy head, striking aroma of peaches, herbs and hops. Quite bitter with long hoppy finish. Worth coming back to it.

Cerveja tripel trapista. Aroma frutado, saborosa, com toques de fruta e um pouco de caramelo. Apesar de alto teor alcoólico, tem um drinkability bom com relação a outras do mesmo estilo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Weak malt flavour, too bitter, a bad aftertaste, a so-so aroma.

Way worse than other tripels.

330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Big white head which lasts a long time. Excellent lacing which seems to last forever. Clear golden body. Sweet aroma of citrus, grass and yeast. A little bitter on the tongue. Sweet vanilla taste, perhaps a little too much. Excellent palate.

0,75l cork bottle. Body is nice orange to amber colored. Head is white and medium dense, sets rather quickly. Aromas are fruits, orange , apricots, berries, herbal hops and creamy maltiness. Palate is medium full, with good amount crispy carbonation and mouthfeel. Taste is balanced, fruity , floral, tart and somewhat vaguely bitter and dry (from ABV). Overall very good Tripel.

Draft flight. Amber, clear, 
Medium-full body, rich, refreshing, beautifully balanced mouthfeel, 
Bitter, dry, more than I'd expect for the style, but with an off-dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a 750ml bottle. Some malty sweetness, possibly from age. Honey, malty, bitterness in the finish. There is a perfumy note in the beer.

Somewhat hazy, as there is a little sediment in the bottom of the bottle. A sweet, candyish aroma with some malt and raisins, the same in the taste which almost approaches sickliness, with some bitterness tempering it at the end. OK but not really my type of beer.

Bottle. Golden colour with an off-white, good lasting and nice lacework. Aroma is ainly yeasty, fruity and citrus hints, wheat is also present. Flavor is fruity with notes of tangerine, orange and citrus, good maltiness with wheaty notes, yeast is highly present, rest of sediments are visible. The final is fruity with a light bitter and fruitness.

Bottle poured into a nucleated chalice. Hazy orange/gold, with a rocky white head. Smells like oranges, sweet malt tastes. One to revisit and make proper notes on - consider this review a placeholder.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2016 Pours a hazy golden with a substantial white head. Aroma of malts, some fruits, herbs and especially hops. Medium carbonation, just about right. Moderately bitter aftertaste. This is a tasty tripel, should definitely drink again.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2014 Dunkel lys farve med lyst skum. Lukt av malt, gjær, hvete og karamell. Smak av malt karamell og krydder. Fruktig. Melkebaren.

Re- Rate onTap @ Melkebaren 20140702.
Duft av humle og karamell. Dekkende skum. Dunkel gulbrun farge. Fin frisk smak av katamell med en litt syrlig smak.
Dark blond/amber, hazy. A lot of carbonation. Yeasty and hoppy beer with good balance between sweet and bitter.

Serving type: bottle

Apearance- Pours nice golden amber with a good white head, nice lacing and lots of bubbles.

Aroma- Smell is of wheat and a subtle spiciness; you can defiantly smell the alcohol in this one. 

T/P- Very heavy on the carbonation. The beer kind of burns due to the alcohol. Some spiciness to it a bit bitter at the end also some fruited characteristics.

Overall- No my favorite, I would not go out to get this one again especial at the price point.
Hazy, orange/amber color. Medium lasting, white head. Aroma of peach. Medium bitterness. Finish is bitter. Fizzy carbonation.

Bottle @home. Pours golden with a big white head. Lemons, dried apricots and general felling of it being like a white wine, its almost as if i should be talking of the terroir. A very subtle and slight oaked note on the finish.
Medium white head.. clear amber/yellow colour..smell of yeast malts and wheat taste wheat yeeast little herbs.. overall solid if not normal tripel.. drank at buitenlust..
Yeasty. Fantastic floral nose. Light, like champaign. Effervescent. Bright, and a beer best served cold as recommended.
Un peu moins jolie que les autres triples trappistes, moins intéressantes que les autres Chimay, elle garde cependant une belle longueur et une belle richesse en bouche un must à goûter absolument !

25cl on tap into tulip

Overall: different than when i have had it out of the bottle. Seemed more spicy and bitter, body was a bit more thin. Still a very good beer. 

Apperance: Thick lucious head. lots of lacing. cloudy blonde color

aroma: floral notes, a little musty, yeasty, spciey, 

Taste: dry, slightly bitter, 

palate : medium full texture, finish on the bitter side.
Smak och doft av karamell, malt, farinsocker, brunt socker, äpple och jäst. Mycket fruktig, välbalanserad och med mycket smaker. Riktigt gott.
Hazy amber thin foamy rimming offwhite head; light malty aroma; Flava is soft grainy semi sweet and dry hint of bitterness; feels silky medium with fizz; finishes dry and bitter

Serves hazy amber. White head, persistant. Nice hoppy taste , w just enough bitterness and carbonation. 
Would recommend as always w Chimay

Appearance: Hazy amber with an ivory finger thick head.
Aroma: Orange, floral, bread/toast, honey, raisin and dried fig.
Taste: Low sweetness with medium bitterness and sourness. A medley of orange, honey and vinous notes.
Palate: Smooth thick texture and medium body, prickly carbonation and an abrupt finish. Initially there is a blend of honey and orange, this develops into vinous and bitter notes. Throughout there is a citrus tartness.
Comments: Tasty and enjoyable, left a glass lace.
Banana bread aroma. Crispy plum tart flavor, grape hops, bitter caramel finish. Lovely deep and complex Belgian brew.
very nice beer. nice taste of hops and it smells delicious. despite the high alcohol it is a beer that is easy to drink. an all time favourite !

(Bottle): Pours a hazy golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of yeast, apples, banana and sour bubblegum. Malty, yeasty and spicy flavour. Well balanced with the alcohol presence slightly noticeable. Prefer the darker abbey beers but this is very nice.
Pours yellow gold with small white head. Aroma typical of style, slightly fruity, strong yeast. Taste slightly sour. More watery than id like. Disappointed for chimay, was expecting more.
Cloudy golden pour with a fluffy white head. Aroma is yeast, grain, spices. High carbonation and a dry finish. Yeasty, grainy, a bit of alcohol warmth and spice. Nice.
Bottle from Fakta, Hammel - fuzzy light gold colour with good white head. Yeasty, malty, with subtle hoppy notes, banana, some slight herbs and floral nuances and slight spice. Very nice.

Het aroma van de Chimay Tripel is eerder neutraal. Er zit en vleugje gebrande candij in, maar dit blijft eerder op de achtergrond. De gist aromas blijven achterwege, ook al betreft dit en bier van hoge gisting met hergisting op fles.
Het uiterlijk is troebel goudkleurig, ook al werd bij het uitschenken de gist in de fles gelaten, wat mijn persoonlijke voorkeur geniet.
De smaak is vooral zacht bitter. Zoete of fruitige toetsen ontbreken, alsook een uitgesproken gistsmaak. De afdronk is neutraal.
Het mond gevoel is aangenaam maar eerder weinig verrassend.
De chimay tripel is een aangenaam zwaar bier dat ik graag aan mijn gasten zou voorzetten op een gezellige herfstdag.

Golden hazy color, big white head. Aroma of malt, wheat, yeast, sour apples and some berries. Taste has malt, hops, citrus, grass notes. Medium body and lively carbonation. Dry sweet with lovely bitterness in finish. Great ale, very enjoyable.

Color is between amber and gold. Big white head. Aroma of fruits , malt, hint of hops . Fruits and spice in taste , alcohol and bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 mL bottle. Pours honey colored with a slight haze and a foamy white head. Aromas of candied apple, raisin, earth, herbal hop and yeast spice/funk. Slightly sweet but well balanced by the alcohol and a touch of hop bitterness. Finish is long and laced with belgian candi sugar. Medium body and full carbonation.

Coloração âmbar alaranjado, turva, com boa formação de creme mesmo a baixas temperaturas como 4C, que perde volume mas mantém uma camada que se afina e persiste durante toda a degustação.
Aromas de fermento, malte e frutado.
No sabor o que destaca é o amargor pronunciado de leveduras, com sugestões de frutas. O caramelo do malte dá o ar da graça à medida que a temperatura sobe, mas sempre ofuscado pela levedura. Percebe-se o álcool, mas de forma extremamente sutil, pois o conjunto é impressionantemente bem balanceado.
Tem bom corpo e adstringência forte, resultando num final seco.
Belíssima trapista!


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a light, bubbly amber with a frothy, disappearing off white head. Aroma of zesty fruit, almost like a Wit in places. Medium body, flavour of red berries, not very sweet, with a dry, bitter end.

Tasted at 2013 Dayton Alefest- the second in the triple play - red white blue. A raisin foamy mouth with the taste that the foam expands in the middle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Very nice beer. Clean and crisp. Pours a hazy gold. Some banana. Some yeastiness. This is one of my favorite triples.

Bottle at Sangria with Taylor. Pours funky orange with clumpy head. Aroma is fresh Belgian fruit, diacetyl. Taste is sharp belgium fruitiness, with a full bodied diacetyl bite. Somehow light on the finish. Meh.
Slightly hazy, golden with a big white head. Aroma of citrus, banana, some yeast. Oily texture, medium carbonation. Pretty good beer.
Guldig färg med ljust skum! Malt och lite humle finns där och tyvärr lite alkohol smak!

Darker golden homey colour, med to lge head. Smells..sweet caramel malts, banana, yeastamda little spice. Tastes.. Hops and banana and fruity, yeast present, spices soft but big malts. A great triple.
Bottle. Hazy amber body with a huge white head. Aroma is banana, fruit, chewinggum, yeast. Flavour is yeast, alcohol, fruit. Nice.
Tap. Might have been a little flat. Classic belgian style. Fruity and crisp with good alcohol taste. Very good, still not my favorite chimay.

Bottle. Cloudy orange colour. Fruity and spicy nose. 1 finger head that stayed with lacing. A nice dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

.33l bottle @ Harrys
Pours cloudy apricot with high head. Aroma is yeast, malts, herbs, fruits. Flavor is mostly same. Nice one.

Bottle from Fakta, Hammel DK. Light hazy golden colour with a large white head. Yeasty aroma with little citrus fruit notes. A little bitter taste of hops and some citrus. Nice warm intens mouthfeel. Light bitter finish. Nice beer.

Aroma: The fruitiness is mostly old pears, some earthy, stable, leather aromas.Appearance: A dark golden, slightly hazy beer, an off-white rather small head that leaves some lacing.Taste: Brown sugar sweetness, sour milk and a quite offensive bitterness.Palate: Low carbonation, rather flat.Overall: Not balanced and a bit flat, could it have been old?Note: On tap, beer tasting at de Klomp. Reviewed 2010-07-10.

Bottle 0,33L. Hazy orange - copper colour with creamy off-white head and intensive visible carbonation. Beside fruity and malty aroma, there is herbal, pepery aroma with note of lemon. At the start of the sip lively carbonation hits your mouth and makes a crispy mouthfeel, before you acctualy feel the real taste. Fully mouthfeel, Light bitter taste at the start turns into moderate bitter aftertaste. Medium to full body and oily texture.

330ml stubby bottle 8%. Pours a cloudy orange colour, with a frothy white foam. Aroma is yeasty, spiced with coriander, light citrus. Taste is excellent, light hoppy bite, great yeasty sourness, and a nice light sweet note of citrus, coriander. Delicious.
Lovely aroma of fruits, citrus and herbs. Appearance is Golden Hazy with a lovely foam head, smooth and creamy on the palate, not acidic and has a good long finish, fantastic Tripel.

Light honey pour with a massive effervescent head that never fully leaves the glass. Belgian yeast, bubblegum, cracked white pepper, banana, lemon zest, and esters. Somewhat subtle for the style, or what the style has become. Even the ABV is down a tick or two. Highly carbonated, which distracted the palate somewhat. Meh.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2013 El equilibrio perfecto. Una cerveza de abadía potente con todos los aromas que puede dar la malta con un lúpulo potente y refrescante. La cerveza más moderna tiene 100 años. Perfecta.
Bottle. Pours an orange/brown with a white head. Yeasty, fruity and malty.
Wheat base will quite clearly without for the sake of tightening the wit or weissbier, rather the saison. Many complex flavors and relatively good bitterness.

Pours cloudy pale yellow to orange, huge rocky, thick top, average lasing. Aroma - well combined sweet malt with herbal hops and fruity esters, min sour also. Taste is dominant hops-yeast oriented light to medium bitter with light sweet malt backbone, good fermentation level, deep indeed, dry mouthfeel, floury-thick-slicky texture, average carbonated. Astringent it is lightly. Bitter and light sour aftertaste. O.A. - well balanced between bitter and maltiness, no jump out aspects so pleasant brew. I would prefear more thick, malty profile, and I really start to dislike that floury finishes. Not best tripel I have tried.

Bottle poured into trappist glass. Appearance is golden amber with a thick off-white head. Aroma is Belgian yeast, bread, light malt, and light fruits like banana. Taste follows the nose. Very good, especially for a tripel.
My favourite of the Chimay Red White and Blue brews. Mainly because it is the one most like one of my all-time favorite beers - Duval.

Bought a 330ml bottle in Taipei. Found pineapple on my nose. Very serious carbonation. Nice golden color. Smooth feeling in mouth. Taste of citrus and pineapple also. It did not surprise me, but still a nice triple.
Har aldrig riktigt varit någon större anhängare av den här stilen men den här tilltalar mig. Precis lagom av det typiskt belgiska tonerna. Lite kryddig doft och lagom kropp.

This might have poured hazy and been darker than I expected, it might have had more sour on the nose than I expected, and been a little thin on length..... but its a really nice beer, and Id buy this again without any hesitation at all. Its not as good as the Blue and for me better than than the Red. A beer that made me smile with satisfaction at drinking something that I enjoyed and didnt have to make a justification for. Ace.

From backlog/offline notes: Fruity, bready, some yeasty esters. I cant quite put my finger on exactly what. Full body. Rated on a bar in Spain, bottle shared with a friend, in correct/authentic glasses.
Very fresh earthy aroma. Smooth body and nice spicy flavor. Alcohol well hidden. Good but price point puts it way behind some great domestic triples.
I dedicate a nice hop flavour which I like because ipa is my preferred brew. A good hop maleness with nice flavour from the yeast. Will enjoy again

A good triple, slightly on the dry side, must be poured very slowly - serious carbonation, head never dissipates completely. Very complex beer with slightly hoppy finish. 7500ml bottle, from Gift Specialists Oceanside, California.

Bought a bottle at Albert Heijn. Has a light hazy golden color with a large white head, is perfectly carbonated. Has a strong yeasty aroma like bread dough, gras and hops with a little citrus fruits and oranges. Taste of apples and some citrus. Also has a little bitter with some species and is light grassy because of the hops. The aftertaste is warm and intens and has a light bitter. Afterall, a very nice Abbey Tripel, but the trappist Westmalle is just a little better.
A great trappist and a great tripel. It has the Belgian sweet yeastiness, but with a good herby bitter tone.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2013 0,33l fles thuis.Mooi oranjekleurig troebel bier met een witte schuimkraag die lang staat. In de geur gist, iets kruidigs en ook hop. Smaak is een mooie balans tussen zoet zuur en het bittertje dat subtiel opkomt richting de nasmaak. Redelijke tot volle body. Zeker geen verkeerde tripel.

Belgian triple with taste of banana, clove wheat and spice. Had it as part of a flight from as draft. Well balanced and very tasty.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2017 Hazy pale amber with medium quite stable white head. Lacing
Aroma.. fruity, citrus, yeast, malty, wheat, spices
Sweetish with decent bitterness.
Decent drinkable and refreshing beer, thou nothing too special

This is by far the most bitter of the Chimay beers with a slight piny note. The malt and yeast provide a nice backbone with flavors of bubblegum, cracked pepper, lemon zest, and a hint of over-ripened banana. Overall very good, but probably my least favorite of the Chimay beers.

11.2 fl oz / 330mL bottle into a trappist glass. Served cold.

Aroma: Lots of fresh yeast. Kind of a little bit of raisin. Pretty nice!

Appearance: Hazy, near opaque dark golden body with a creamy, large white head.

Taste: Fresh yeast, some pretty strong malty sweetness.

Palate: Moderate - full bodied, moderate sweet malt finish.

Overall: Pretty nice, pretty sweet. Its a good beer.

Classic tripel, perfect balance of spice and yeast - have absolutely nothing bad to say about this beer, except I wouldnt call it one of a kind. There are other tripels that are similar, but its in the upper tier for sure.
Its nice, definitely an old world staple. It has a slightly astringent grassy/straw flavor, but I kind of like it. The Belgians do it best as far as drinkable high alcohol brews!
Mooi honingbruin bier. Minder mooi schuim. Ruikt bloemig. Smaakt kruiden en hoppige tonen.

Pours a hazy golden with a big, white head that leaves great lacing. A lot of sediment is noticeable on the bottom of the glass. Strong yeast is present on the nose, giving off aromas of bubblegum, banana, and various spices. Taste is subdued compared to the nose. Medium bodied beer with a short, bready finish. Ive had better Tripels before.
Bottle pour hazy orange. Nose spicy clove and beady malt. Taste. The same with some apple and decent bite from the bitterness.
very nice beer from abbaye de scourmont nice triple very good taste !!!!!!!!
citrus, banana, yeast, all the typical belgian goodness comes through here without too much of the triple alcohol dominating. yumyum.

Pours a hazy golden amber with a white head and nice lacing. Aroma of citrus, coriander, orange peel, sweet malts, cereal and yeast. Taste is cereal, sweet malts, balanced nicely with bitter orange peel, spices and some fruity esthers. Overall an excellent triple.

Bottle from Total Wine in Boca Raton, FL. Snifter. Yellow gold pour with serious haze and some sediment. Thick white fluffy head. Some decent lacing. Aroma of cereal, fruit, raisins, flowers. The taste is initially bread and cereal with an aftertaste of fruit and raisins. The mouth is creamy and carbonated and it does have a fairly bitter, dry finish. So SO good.
Hazy amber appearance. Aroma of yeast and banana. Lightly carbonated mouthfeel. Very smooth and balanced. Notes of alcohol, slight bitterness, banana, and honey.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 Bottle: Nose is banana, hay and floral tones. Taste is bread, some orange ,pepper, spice. floral tones and a nicely bitter finish, very slight resin. Undercutting the taste is a fleeting sparkle of sugar. Mouthfeel is light for the strength with nice alcohol warmth.

A nice beer. 

Edit: I think this beer is getting worse over the years with the banana now overbearing, and very little depth in the beer and an unpleasant metallic finish. By 2015 an average beer by general standards, a poor beer by Belgian tripel standards.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2014 Fortunately a white label does not indicate wheat starch in the bottle, but I think a very decent content. This triple looks definitely fine in hazy & light amber color,  hoppy nose, full body, thick texture and surprisingly nice bitter palate.
