33 cl på fad, 8 %, Café København, Hillerød, 19. Juni 2013.
Ravgylden øl med hvid skumtop ca. 1 1/2 - 2 cm. Frugtagtig aroma, hvor der anes rosiner, men ikke kraftig.  
Blød perlende i munden, med bitter eftersmag, hvor man tydeligt fornemmer alkoholen. Hen ad en IPA med belgiske aner. Ikke Chimay's bedste øl, men hæderlig er den.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Just getting around to rating this one. Good abbey tripel thats pretty widely available at bars in the states.
Nice white head, staying throughout the drink, and golden colour. Aroma of alcohol, citrus and banana. Nicely bitter and refreshening. Lively fitting carbonization.

On-tap poured into Chimay chalice. Good appearance: pours a cloudy golden-orange color with a large frothy white head, nice lacing on the glass. Banana, citrus and spicy aromas. Taste is very balanced, sweet, light fruitiness, slightly bitter finish, alcohol is pretty hidden. Medium bodied, high carbonation. Great brew.

The aroma is subtle with a blend of sour fruit and caramel malts, but the appearance is very gorgeous with its opaque and cloudy dark orange color, its medium white head with amazing retention, and the medium-grain sediment that sinks towards the bottom of the chalice. The taste is mildly sour and slightly sweet, and the palate combines a lively carbonation, medium body, thick texture, and a long astringent finish.
Presence of phenolic components and some fruit (peaches). Great taste with notes of clove and bitter from hops dry finish that asks for one more sip.
Pale amber, hazy rich head. Banana aroma. Lively and complex. Very flavourful and fruity.

On tap at The Mayor of Old Town.  Golden color and slightly hazy with lacy white head.  The aroma is crisp with pepper, spices, Belgian yeast, fruit, earthy/leafy and light bitter hops.  Similar flavor with a medium body and a smooth feel.  Always a good decision ;)
330ml bottle at home. Full white head. Orange color,hazy. The taste is spicy. Nice one.

Poured from 330mL bottle. Hazy orange-ish yellow with full white head, fairly active.  Rich caramel, yeast, and malt on the nose.  Mild sweetness to start, followed by bitter yeast with some nice spice and wood notes. Mildly dry finish.

0,33 Bottle. Giant longlasting head. Fruity aroma. Floral, bitter longlasting taste. It was better couple a years ago from big Bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2017 Hazy orange colored beer with a huge white head and lots of lacing on the glass. The aroma has lots of typical blonde Belgian beer yeast in it with some fruits as well. The taste is balanced and the mouthfeel is solid. There is also a nice amount of hops for a tripel-styled beer.

2012 Vintage, about 4,5 years age. Crips hops gone, more toffee sweetness, yeastiness still present, still carbonated, no off flavors. Still enjoyable, but different.
UPDATED: NOV 2, 2013 Poured with large head. Yeast smells with slight fruit. Bitter taste with not much to off set it. Lingered on the palate which I did not enjoy.

Moderate aggressive pour.  Aroma of yeast instantally upon pour.  Three finger head - fluffy off white color with "english muffin" craters and bubbles both big and small.  Beautiful lacing.  Aroma is packed with bready/yeasty notes, slightly spicy citrus tones and pleasant bitters.  Liquid is  a dark orange, cloudy and murky.  Palate has an average body, I was expecting something slightly heavier.  Taste is full of yeast with a very clean and semi dry with light hop overtones.  Finish has a slight alcohol warmness as well as sweet overtones and wine barrel character.  Overall, I had more enjoyable tripels, but will give this another taste again, however more chilled as recommended on the bottle.  Wouldja = True Maybe
Draught at Mad Mex. Poured hazy orange with white head. Sweet yeasty aroma. Very smooth floral wheat flavor.

330ml bottle from the LCBO.  Pours golden and hazy with a white head.  Yeasty flavours and hop aromas make it very easy to drink.
Solid beer!
Bottle. Cloudy golden colour, billowing head, very lively. Typical trippel aroma, but I found the taste crisp, dry, and dangerously easy to drink for the high ABV. Very good.

The slight bitterness of this beer really balances out the sweet nature of the Tripel.  Combine that with the big head and liveliness of this beer and it makes for a really delicious drink.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2013 Crisp aroma with hints of vanilla. Pours a hazey straw colour with a white head that lingers. Spicy taste. Slight bubbly carbonation. A delectable beer. Will buy again.
Belle robe mousse impeccable, amertume légère et rafraîchissante surtout en terrasse lété. Lamertume se dévoile encore mieux à la bouteille.
Cloudy golden amber, on tap at BXL Cafe near Times Square. Crisp, dry, I expected it to be sweeter but it isnt overly bitter either.  Well balanced, I could drink it all night if ABV wasnt so high.
Golden yellow colour with white foam head. Smell is hoppy/grassy. Taste of grapefruit and a pleasant bitterness.
Pours hazy gold colour, white head, looks beautifull. Aroma is citrus, spices. Taste is also spicy, some citrus, sweet malty finish. Medium body, very nice triple.
33cl bottle.  Pours murdy orange brown with foamy head. nose is fruity and sour. spicy bitter taste with caramel and hops.  alcohol heat in the aftertaste.  balanced and delightful.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2013 Blonde dorée trouble, belle mousse assez persistante, pétillance moyenne. Agréablement houblonnée, moyennement amère, retour légèrement fruité, petite astringence en fin de bouche, belle longueur.

Pours a dark hazy golden color with a nice head that fades to ample lacing. Aroma of citrus, fruit and spice. Taste of citrus, bit of fruit, spice and trace of sweetness in the background. Has a bitterness that lingers for bait. Medium body, crisp and flavorful. Nice beer for the style.
On tap at A La Morte Subite, Brussels.  Cloudy amber with a small head.  Weak citrus taste with a dry finish.  Grapefruit.   Not all that drinkable.  Prefer the bleue.
Bread, cereal, nuts, herbs, grass, citrus, herbs, clove, raisin, fruity touches of muscat grapes and ripe apples, after taste bitterness, refermented in the bottle and not pasteurised

Bottle 33 cl. Produces a thick, foamy off-white head. The colour is somewhere in between amber and blonde. Aroma is complex, dried fruit. Taste is somewhat similar, but more spicy and sweet. Soft carbonation. It then ends bitter without disturbing the balance. Very good, as expected from a trappist.

Draft - Lemon and citrus with some yeast sweetness.  Cloudy yellow with a thin head.  Nice, crisp, citrus and yeasty sweetness.  A quick hit of bitterness then clean finish.  Great summer beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma deliciosamente cítrico. Cor dourada. Espuma cremosa e duradoura! Sabor tipicamente trappista!  Desce muito bem!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Haven't like the other chimay's that I've tried.... But this one had good ratings so here goes: light smell, light taste. Not terrible, pretty decent compared to the others I've had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

BOUGHT THIS STRICTLY CUZ OF THE KILLER RATINGS,  have hated every chimay ive ever had so far,  bottle into lint glass, hazy orange pour,  thick white head, fruit aroma, taste is biter alcool , i can actually tolerate this one,  but wont seek out
Medium to heavy body filled with malty sweetness. The smell is too light but has hints of citrus and yeast. Foamy head that stands for a bit and leaves marks on the glass.

Bottle pours a hazy gold with a full white head, marginal lacing. Nose is yeast, orange, slight hops. Taste is a bit astringent, bittersweet and a hint of hops. Some pale ale character, which is a testament to the alcohol masking. I expected a bit more fruit in this one.
Very malty, low hop bitterness, incredibly yeasty in flavor and aroma,  Good mouthfeel, drinkable, but not excellently so.
750 mk bottle at home - taken from notes. Pours hazy medium yellow to golden. White head, quickly gone. Aromas of yeast, spices and citrus touch. Balanced body,
Light and foamy from the tap. Crisp, almost sour flavor for a tripel. Gets more complex and fruity as it sits.  A nice tripel for sure.
Starts with a high quality appearance with good lacing. Aromatic leading into a hoppier than anticipated initial taste. Slight sweetness but predominantly bitter...ends smooth.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2014 33cl bottle.
Appearance: clouded blonde beer, big stable head.
Nose: oranges, hops, some grain, some bitterness, lemon.
Taste: dry and bitter finish, fruity start, some spices, lots of hops.
Very nice drinking beer.

On draught at freakin frogs - pours cloudy golden, fine white foamy head.  Nose of yeast - very faint aroma.  Taste of floral lemon and yeast.  Slight dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours cloudy gold with large frothy white head. Aroma- fruity and apple. Wheat? Taste is apple, fizzy, and sweet middle citrus. Dry hay hop end with slight bit of tackiness. I expected more.
75cl flaska. Gyllengul, lätt dimmig öl med vitt skum. Doften är jäst , hö, gräs, honung och lätt kryddighet. Smaken är lätt maltig, örtig, kryddig, jäst med lätt bittermandelsmak.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2013 Hard to say which is best, blue has more aroma, but this is very easy to drink with no need to think about the strong flavours. Everything about the beer is still present but slightly toned down version of the heavier brother.
I like it, they are equal, depends on what You want, tough or easier.
Yellow orange haze, stable top, less aroma then the blue, ripe bananas (peach) and sweet, and the taste is similar without much of a change from nose to mouth.

A melhor tripel que já experimentei até hoje. Não é tão doce. Não filtrada. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Slightly sweet/sour aroma with a hint of malt. Orange/gold color with persistent light creamy head. Pleasant hop that balances well with the sour - smooth and drinkable.

Head, big, off-white, frothy. Colour: amber and hazy.

Aroma: yeast, fruity, honey, but mostly dry. May be a bit of alcohol too. Taste: slightly sweet, mostly dry and a good bit of bitterness. Soft carbonation. Very well balanced and exceptionally easy to drink.
banana, hay, pale, cloudy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, lively. Not bad, but a very heavy white beer...

Tap at Gollem, Antwerp. It pours clear amber with a medium white head. The nose is sweet pear, melon, apple, floral, spice, hay and dough. The taste is straw, decent bitterness, dough, floral, spice, herbal notes, light apple, melon, alcohol warmth and a touch of icing sugar. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Well balanced. Not my favourite style, but a well-made example nonethess.
Aroma fairly hoppy.  Maybe aroma of fruits. Golden amber color.  Taste of strong fruits with a long palate.
Very nice and balanced beer. One of the best Tripels Ive already tasted. Its a complex beer.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a diminishing off-white big frothy head. Aroma is sweet with coriander,wheat, banana, light raisins, sugar, clove, orange peel, red apple, floral hops and pepper. Taste is light+ sweet and near medium bitter. Body is medium+, texture is creamy/thick, carbonation is moderate. Finishes bitter and quite dry with some warming alcohol and lingering muscat.

Bottle @ home. tra le chimay che si trovano in commercio, è una delle più buone. profumo alcolico, di lievito, e con sentori di luppolo. Molto fresco e invita allassaggio. Colore giallo carico, quasi dorato, con schiuma fine non molto persistente (1 min. circa). Gusto luppolato come ricorda il profumo, ma anche piacevolente bilanciato dallalcool e dal dolciastro sentore di zucchero di canna.  Corpo medio, poco carbonata, consistenza viscosa, per via del lievito  in sospesione. Piacevole tripel anche se commerciale e quindi senza troppo carattere.

Pours a slightly cloudy very dark orange with a tall white head. Nose has yeast, wheat, herbs and fruits. Taste is sweet at the beginning, leaving a mild trail of hoppy bitterness and the warmth of alcohol at the end. Carbonation is just right. A nicely balanced and pleasant beer.
UPDATED: JUL 13, 2016 330ml bottle. Amber body, white head. Fruit, yeast, lemon, spices and a hint of alcohol.

Hazy orange with big head.
Mostly sour yeasty aroma with some vanilla.
Taste is spicy and dry, not very longlasting.
July 2010. From bottle. Poured golden yellow with a white head. The fruit and yeast are very dominant on the nose. Finished slightly bitter. An ouotstanding beer.

Bottle. Hazy hay liquid with medium to big white head. Aroma of banana, clove, bubblegum, grain, vanilla and bread. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of grain, clove and banana. Medium bodied with high carbonation. Nice, not too sweet.
very nice, orange, white foam, rocky head, resin, herbs, leaves, floral, alcohol, lightly bitter, lively,

A near-iconic beer that I've waited too long to try: the quintessential "tripel".

Pours a good-looking hazy honey colour with a respectable white head that lingers and laces. Aroma of pure "Belgian yeast", nicely rounded with caramelized tones and subtle cider spices. The taste is delightfully dry, with the bitter finish nicely complimenting the 8.3% ABV alcohol warmth. It is well balanced and transitions to and from a sweetness with depth. Elements of ripened stone fruit support the fundamental yeast flavours.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy copper, big foamy white head. Sugar, raisins, clove, boozy, sherry trifle aroma. Sweet stewed fruits and banana in the flavour, underpinned by bready, yeasty malt. Big enough body and lots of tight carbonation. Clean enough finish, some warming alcohol. Nice.
Bready nose. Crisp on the palate. Subtle fruit notes. Banana? Alcohol well masked. Nice.

Bottle with Devin.  Havent had this in years. Pours a murky copper with thick white head that fades down to a thin covering and provides decent soapy lacing.  Nose of wheat and some floral hops. Herbal flavors, sweet honey, lots of wheat and hay. Well concealed abv and decent hop bitterness on the finish.  Really solid.
Beer pours an amber color with a large head. On the nose it has citrus, spices and yeast. taste has raisins & herbs. A good balance between bitterness and smoothness which gives it easy drinkability.

Lovely aroma of  fruits in the basement, an old barn, I suppose the trappist yeasts, but all behind a thick whiff of honey and caramel. The beer loooks like hazy amber, with a creamy head, where bits may fall in the cushion and stain it with honey colour. Nice and attractive so far. But the flavour is just overwhelmed by the alcohol, losing complexity and excitement. Not my favourite style.I had tried other tripels before and never really liked. This rating is shamelessly just for the tick mark.

Bottle from the LCBO, this beer poured a hazy golden straw colour with a minimal head. The aroma was of distinctive trappist yeast, caramels, fermented fruits and alcohol. The taste was just delicious, with notes of brown sugar, deep dried fruits, caramel, and a mildly bitter finish. This is a great beer!
Grand Tripel Trappist. Extremely full beer that melts in your mouth and asks for more.
Sweet smell almost of brown sugar...almost zero carbonation...unmoving sediment suspended in beer...interesting...not a very sweet taste...good though

Appearance: murky gold with an aggressive white head.
Aroma: Chalky, dusty attic.
Flavor: Malt, candy sugar with floral notes, alcohol and a moderately bitter, dry finish.
Palate: Medium bodied, medium-high carbonation.
Overall: Complex - aroma and flavor evolves as it warms up.
A very beautiful looking beer. The taste on the other hand was a bit average. Light bitterness with a medium body, oily sticky texture and a soft carbo.
Een van de laatste trappist bieren die ik drink, maar overtuigd me niet. Smaak combinatie is goed, alleen te bitter.
750ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color. Aromas of lemon, orange, grassy notes, and Belgian yeast. Taste is citrusy, fruity, with some spiciness, and yeasty characteristics.
220313. Bottle at Naamat, Tampere. Pours hazy copper with a nice head. Aroma licorice, Belgian yeast. Full bodied. Very well balanced. Not Bad.
Pours a cloudy yellow with a thick white head that persists. Probably the Chimay that I like the least, but it is always a Chimay.

Another beer i seem to have forgotten to rate 

Ppurs blonde 
Tadtes realy bad to me . Fithy sweet , very unpleasant

Bottiglia da 33cl. Bel color dorato carico con un buon cappello di schiuma fine nocciola chiara. Al naso miele, frutta e malto che si ripetono al palato con  laggiunta di un ottimo amaro. Birra con un buon corpo.

Cerveza dorada, con espuma muy blanca. Olor afrutado, algo cítrico. Sabor complejo, malteado, cítrico a naranja, con buen balance entre el amargo y el dulce donde se nota la presencia del alcohol. Cuerpo medio, algo graso, y con gas muy vivo en la boca. Para disfrutarla bien hay que tomarla a temperatura fresca, ni muy fría ni a temperatura ambiente.

330ml bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy golden caramel colour, with a large off-white head.  Faint lemon, black pepper, yeast, faint honey, alcohol, mineral notes, and banana on the nose.  As for taste, surprisingly bitter with metallic hops, lemon herbal notes, black pepper, faint pastry, with mineral, and soapy notes in the spicy finish.  Solid.

16/III/13 - on tap @ Poteaupré (Chimay)  - BB: n/a (2013-242) 
Clear orange beer, irregular off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: some banana, chemical touch, paint or rubber, bit of hay. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty metallic, bitter hops, some banana, malts. Aftertaste: very metallic, bitter, banana, bit spicy, cloves, hops, pretty grassy. Not too bad, but in my memory it was better... Maybe the draught version isnt as good as the regular one, you know, with bottle conditioning and stuff... Have to retry this...
A true classic. Nice floral aroma. Super balanced brew that hides alcohol very well. Alot going on with citrus and spices. Awesome

0,33l bottle. Hazy golden color with big head. Aroma is fruits, yeast, hops and malt. Taste is mostly malt, hops,yeast and just a bit of coriander. Its a good beer, but the alcohol is a little much too exposed for my opinion. Otherwise, it has nice and sweet aftertaste.

Fra flaske på Cardinal en hyggelig lørdagkveld, takk til Gunnar! Første gang jeg smaker denne klassikeren, som er en nydelig bekjentskap, lett og elegant på alle måter. Fruktighet, krydder, sødme, gjær, bitterhet og alkohol går opp i en høyere enhet. Farlig lettdrikkelig - definintivt vanedannende. Hva skulle vi gjort uten belgiske munker?

Beautiful golden hazy color with a tall white head. Wonderful spicy, fruity, boozy aroma. The flavor is of spicy/ coriander and orange with dried fruits. The flavor delivers on the promise of the aroma except it is too quickly overtaken by the flavor of alcohol. The beer is creamy on the palate. One of the best Ive had.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2013 Goudkleurig, mooie plakkerige kraag.  Behoorlijk hoppig. Gedronken in de klep, niet echt de geur en smaakfinesses kunnen detecteren  dus moet nog een keer op herhaling. Goed te drinken in ieder geval.

Sometimes the hype is well deserved, as is the case with this brew. Not too much of the flavors that are usual for this style, but just enough to make it a classic. When will other brewers stop bludgeoning their customers over the head with flavors and just let the natural processes develop on their own? Beautiful head.

Over carbonated.  First taste was really great - sweet, rich, balanced bitterness.  However, this taste fades away and youre left with a highly carbonated sweet beer with the odd burst of a promising aftertaste.  Quite good, but not remarkable.   There is a lot of potential there, they just havent quite nailed it.

Had on tap in a flight. It came with a nice thick head and looks completely transparent orange. Almost no nose but the taste is amazing. The perfect balance between hops and malts and tastes like a great tripple

Had in a flight. Amazing head with a lot of lacing. Beautiful amber color. Nose is meek, its almost not there at times. What is there is good. Taste is a great balance of hoppy bitterness and malty delicious sweet. This is a great beer very belgian. Definitely worth drinking before you die.

33cl on tap @ Metropool, Leuven
Aromas of orange, apple, coriander.
Orange gold colour with a lasting and lacing head, lovely sparkles.
Summery taste, herbs, orange peel, apples.
Slowly appearing bitterness. Warm and lively mouthfeel.

Draught at Bierhaus. Pours a cloudy gold with a nice foamy white head. Sweet and appetising nose of caramel, hay, wheat and light herby (coriander?) notes. Strong but not overpowering sweetness at first, mainly caramel and banana flavours, with a hint of light sour citrus and a nice lingering bitter aftertaste. Palate is a bit lively for my liking, and a little bit dry. A terrific beer, but probably my least favourite from Chimay (though that doesnt say all that much!)
Golden cloudy with thin white head.aroma of lemon, honey, apple. Sweet honey, apple, citrus hops, yeast, high carbonation, long drying finish.
Légèrement ambrée, magnifique teinte dorée. Mousse fine et onctueuse. Très équilibrée, notamment au niveau de la saturation, avec une légère amertume. Un léger goût de fruits secs.
Pours dark orange with a thick long lasting head. Aroma of bananas, ripe fruits and yeast. Taste very similar to the aroma. Palate quite carbonated. Some bitterness follows. Premium trappist tripel.

Botella de 75 cl. Muy maltosa y dulzona. Color dorado, muy bonito. Sin mucha espuma. En boca destaca su densidad y cuerpo...casi masticable. Para mi excesivos los 75 cl ya que el alcohol se nota bastante.
Another winner from these very smart monks.  33cl bottle, Nice froth to the head,  Lovely soft hoppy taste with citrus tones. One of the best tripels available.
Golden yellow with a thin white head with good retention. Nose of bicuit and grass. Taste follows with a big creamy body.

Delicious brew...so fitting for the dark days of winter. It does wrap your belly in a delightful warmth. Perfect as the first one of the evening or dessert drink. If youre browsing this site and havent tried it yet...shame!
Pleasantly dry beer, creamy monthfill, long after taste, yet the aroma a bit absent and not in ballance with the taste.

Pours a hazy golden complexion, with large head which slowly diminished into a moderate head. A fruity aroma. The flavour was complex, a rich fruity, hoppy taste. The beer was viscous in consistency and such. Overall a very tasty beer.

Not sure on the bottling date, but it reads L12-293. Im guessing the 293 day of 2012?
Appearance: The body is a slightly hazy amber with a towering foam head that is neat at first but dissipates unevenly into a thick coating leaving foam all over the sides as some of the head sticks around.
Aroma: The aroma is light with some spices and light banana notes, perhaps some other fruits with a slight chalk dryness to this.
Taste: The flavor is very clean on the intro, slightly malty with a touch of citrus to it, but as the mid sip and finish come along a strong cloves hits with banana and a citrus dryness, perhaps grapefruit.
Palate: Full bodied, almost chewy, with soft carbonation.
Overall: This is a good to great tripel, but its pricey. I do enjoy this though and the glass this came with is very nice. This is worth trying.

What more can be said of this legendary ale? Copper-orange glow, fluffy off-white foam and strong aroma of yeast, dried cherries, toffee and floral hops. Perfect balance, smooth taste that follows the aroma well and nice warmth from the alcohol. Excellent!
330 ml bottle. Golden with white head. Spicy, peppery, yeasty aroma with floral hops. Spicy, yeasty flavor with some bready malts.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2016 orange colour, moderate off-white head; aroma of yeast, fruits and maybe some malty sweetness; very well ballanced taste of yeast, sweetness of biscuits, and bitterness;excellent trappist ale.

Hazy pale yellow poor with a great fluffy white head. Aroma reminds me of a really good Belgium wheat beer which carries on through to the flavour.  Nice beer but not a great beer for me.  So easy to drink though, little dangerouse.

A classic delicious brew.  Chimay is chimay.  Lots of flavor, lots of aroma, and a very smooth easy drink.  Worth the price tag is to be debated, but thats purely opinion.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Unbelievable. Chimay might make the best Trappist beers. The price is a little up there but well worth opening up the wallet

Excelente Tripel belga, essa trapista tem cor dourada com ótima e persistente formacao de espuma. Aroma frutado, lembrando fermento belga, algo maltado. No paladar, bom corpo, com gosto frutado, lembrando frutas amarelas, especiarias, pouco amarga. Final duradouro, com especiarias. Retrogosto duradouro e frutado. Maravilhosa!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy orangy yellow with a a thick, creamy, off-white, lasting, lacy head. Smells of mostly Belgian yeast, with caramel, soft spices, malt and some wood. Medium oily body with medium soft carbonation. Tastes of sweet malt, biscuit with orange peel and then moves to mostly yeast with a dry bitter peppery almost herbal finish. I dont find it that balanced but rather bitter. I enjoyed drinking it but Im not a fan of that super yeast taste. Nonetheless a decent been in the large scheme of things.
0.33l bottle. Golden body, white head. Spicy, peppery, yeasty aroma with floral hops. Spicy, yeasty flavor with some bready malts. Floral hop bitterness in the finish. Very nice.

Wow! Yum. Everything in this beer seems so well balanced. Pours a beautiful golden colour and has a great belgian yeast aroma thats slightly sweet. Head doesnt quit and lacing is excellent. Carbonation was just right and he mouth feel is nice and silky. Taste was really balanced between the malt, hops and yeast. An awesome beer!
UPDATED: FEB 19, 2013 On tap at Maxs. Taste is Belgian eaters, spice, and floral. Smooth and wonderful
Not my favorite Tripel but that doesnt mean its not good! Floral and grassy with a sparkly light finish.

Bottle (330 ml). Courtesy of czar, thanks! Hazy golden/orange with a huge quickly diminishing white head and decent lacing. Aroma of spices/pepper, belgian yeast (almost Saison-like) and slight citrus. Taste is moderately sweet and yeast with malt, fruits, spices and alcohol. Grassy finish. Medium body. Good Tripel with superb balance. A tad too grassy for my liking though.

Poured from a bottle, San Diego. Gorgeous, hazy brownish amber. Yeasty aroma. A very light-tasting beer for an 8%, very refreshing. Not at all aggressive or biting, anyone could drink this. Not the best beer, honestly I was a little disappointed, but I could drink this literally all day and not get particularly tired of it. A very solid beer, and an extremely refreshing and pleasant beer. If I was stuck on an 18th-century frigate, Id gladly replace microbe-laden fresh water with this hardy beer.
Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, sweet malt, pineapple and banana. Taste follows, crisp and clean. Hides alcohol well, very good on tap.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2016 När Chimay hamnar på bordet höjs uppmärksamheten en aning och sinnena vässas. Inte en klunk går obemärkt förbi. En ren njutning för den som har förstånd att uppskatta bra öl och slit utfört av herrar i celibat.

This pours a cloudy golden color with a bubbly, off-white head. There is a scent of citrus, wheat, and hops. There are lots of bubbles constantly rising to the top. There are tastes of smooth, yeasty wheat with a slightly hoppy finish. Overall its creamy, delicious, and well made.

Appearance:  some suspended yeast (?) in a hazy amber ale, covered by a near-perfect, creamy head. 

Aroma: tart citrus, yeast, and some bready malt.  The fruity taste is well below that of the best Belgium tripels.  Medium body with excellent, soft carbonation, but also with a bit of a bite. 

O: Only non-stellar Chimay in my experience.
Hazy gold color with a banana nut bread scent. A complex, yeasty taste thats still easy on the palate. Slightly boozy finish. An any-season beer, one of the classics.

On tap at Mellow Mushroom. Pours a golden color, slightly hazy. Good head that settles and stays throughout drink. No lacing. Aroma is floral, seems like I smell bananas. Taste is good. Very smooth, not too thick, but a good medium body. Good triple overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2014 2013/01/24 - Pours a hazy gold color with a thick white head that lingers. Aromas are yeast, banana, citrus, grapefruit, floral hops and biscuit malts. Taste is same as nose with a long, slightly bitter aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, lots of carbonation and smooth finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2oz bottle into Chimay trappist glass.  Cloudy gold pour.  Poured very slow to try and keep the yeast in the bottle.  Yeasty aroma.  Slight banana.  Not nearly as stong on the yeast as others Ive had.  Very carbonated.  Has almost a champagne quailty to it.
Poured with a massive white head...Pale orange in color with a nice aroma.  Great smooth and somewhat creamy flavor....Very good beer....but I knew that already.

Corked & Caged 750 ml Bottle. Bright golden orange colored with substantial off-white foam and active carbonation throughout the glass. Aroma is a tart and yeasty mix of pear, green apple, orange peel and brown sugar. The taste opens up with white grape, lemon and Belgian yeast notes followed by some honey, banana bread and clove rounding things out. Champagne-like mouthfeel leads to a dry, peppery finish. Overall, one of the more unique and flavorful Belgian Tripels.
Forte, com sabor marcante. Teor alcoólico elevado, mas não demais. Uma das melhores cervejas que já tomei.

Pale orange color with 1 finger white head. Aroma of peaches, bananas, citrus it smells a bit like a nice German weizenbeer. Taste is fruity, light bitter and a bit boozy. Light body, oily texture,  avarege carbonation. Pretty nice tripel
11.2 Oz. Bottle Poured Hazy Golden with a huge beautiful white foamy head. Nice strong fruit sweet aroma, citrus notes. Dry, bitter some sweet malts and fruit notes. Nice Beer.

dark hazy blonde with fluffy white head that holds well down the glass and fine cappucino yeast sprinkling. Rich Belgian ester nose, fairly dry with "fluffy" mouth filling texture, medium carbonation, some malt sweetness and spicy wheat notes. Warming but far too easy drinking for its ABV, a great tripel.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours clear golden with huge creamy white head. Intense lacing. Aroma is of candi-like sugar, malt, belgian yeast. Taste is of candi-like sugar, malt, fruits, alcohol. Biter enough. Some nuts? Palate: Dry, ligth-medium body. Overall: Fairly good.Surprsingly bitter for a Chimay.

Big light foamy white head a beautiful hazy foggy golden colour.  Aroma was not overly alcoholic but refreshing.  Great beer... Could see this being a nice spring beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden-Brown color. Intense fruity aromas with  some citric nuances from the hops. Subtle metallic hint.  Medium bodied and carbonation, slightly sweet flavor but bitterness is dominant. Dry finish. Quite nice beer. Nose better than mouth. 

Filip
A great triple. This one is indeed better then the red one.

way better than the red, blue still is my favorite chimay so far but the yellow(triple) is a great beer and a good aroma with a standing finish 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

3-y-o-ish, possibly op to 4, 75L bottle, chilled, drank from a tulip. Yeasty and  flowery aroma. As for the taste, yeasts and hops are somewhat strong but not too overpowering and it is overall quite balanced. Relatively sweet with medium body and nice bitterness. The alcohol is much less evident than in the younger/different colour chimay. I wish I have had another bottle at hand.
UPDATED: JUL 30, 2013 Amber colour, white, creamy but small head. Smell is fruity, with citrus hints. Taste also fruity, but finishes quite bitter, maybe too much. Good, but not great.

Poured from an 11.2 oz bottle, it was just like the ad says, "golden colour, slightly hazy appearance".  Thick head quickly rises, but settles quickly as well.  The suds hang on the glass, but theyre not sticky and dont lace.  Aroma is of malt, bread, floral hops.  Medium body, average carbonation, and light bitter.  A very nice beer, but missing a stellar trait.

Bottle. Pours with a frothy big head, clearly wheat induced. The appearance is hazy golden to light amber. Attractive. Aroma is very discrete, vague notes of fruit and spices. The taste is quite full and soft in the mouth, spicy bitterness dominates with a long dry aftertaste. Overall, it is full tasting beer, typically dry and bitter, but without strong identity.
The Chimay blanche was tasted along with La Trappe Tripel and Westmalle Tripel: It was the most pretty beer to look at and equalled La Trappe in taste. The aroma on the other hand scored lowest. Narrow win over La Trappe.
Bottle - Hazy golden orange with great head.  Yeast aroma with notes of banana.  Flavor is dry and yeasty, very bubbly.
Light, almost floral, bitter scent.  Orange, golden color.  bit foggy.  excellent head. Light citrus, floral taste.

Pours Hazey, Rocky head. Couldnt resist tasting so no notes on aroma. 
First sip - smokey oak
feel- Silky 
Bitter linger
A great triple !

Bottle at Ultime Atome (Brussels, Belgium)
Aroma: Bread, raisins, banana, basement aromas, and some olive.
Appearance: A hazy golden color with a white head.
Taste: Bitter. Not much sweetness.
Palate: Full bodied, thin, and an average carbonation. A bitter finish.

Earthy and floral hop aromas, and notes of golden raisins and angel food cake.  Hazy, dark orange, thick, creamy, white head with great retention.  Taste is lightly sweet, with spicy and herbal tones, subtle flavors of caramel and lemon seltzer water, and fragrant, brilliant, floral aromas that drift up into the sinus cavity.  Full bodied, with fresh, full carbonation, and a refreshingly clean finish.  An excellent and very earthy triple.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Yeasty and hoppy aroma. Quite lovely to smell. There is a touch of banana and raisins in this beer. A classic golden color and a lovely pour. First drank in Belgian and followed up many times in the US. The finish has a slight bitterness but not overwhelming. An excellent beer.

Great floral aroma.  Citrus yeasty bitter alcohol taste.  Least favorite Chimay.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark orange color with great head and good lacing.  Floral aroma with some citrus and spice.  Hoppy bitterness with some raisin in taste.  Medium body that is dry and fairly easy to drink.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ulkonäöltään tämä trappistituote on todella vaahtoava, vaahdon jäädessä lasin reunalle ja pieneksi kukaksi juonnin aikana. Väri on vaalean kullanoranssi. Haju on hedelmäinen, belgihiivainen, mausteinen ja hieman marjainen. Maku taas on vahvan hedelmäinen, mausteinen, kaktuksinen ja hieman pähkinäinen. Suutuntuma on melko täyteläinen ja saa veden kielelle. Kokonaisuutena yksi parhaista tripeleistä, todella monimuotoinen tapaus.
Hazy golden. Medium frothy white head. Some sticky lacing. Aroma of booze, Belgian yeast, banana, citrus. Pleasant hoppy finish. Lasting citrus hop aftertaste. Medium bodied but fuller mouthfeel
This beer is a pleasure due to its citrus taste and floral aroma. If you like a bitter beer, this is the one to go with!

Cinq Cents pours a cloudy orange with an off white head of very fine, very soft foamy bubbles.  The nose is floral hops and bright citrus. Grapefruit.  Superb retention and lacing .  The taste is smooth. creamy and not a hint of alcohol until it warms you in the long dry finish.  Crisp. Its perfectly balanced so that the citrus is not at all sour.  Its perfect and elegant.
Gold foamy head. Big banana aroma. Flavor is bananas, Belgian yeast and hops. MMMMM!!!

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2013 33 cl bottle. Exquisite hoppy/yeasty aroma. Hints of herbs, citrus, grass, banana. A flowery aroma. The appareance is great too, with good head retention. The taste is bitter for a tripple, which for me is perfect. Medium body, thick texture and lively carbonation. The finish is bitter and satisfying. Another gem from Chimay.

Bottle from Rootz, Den Haag. Poured a cloudy yellow colour with a thin white head. The aroma is yeasty and alcoholic. The flavour is all about the alcohol with loads of alcoholic bitterness, liquorice and Belgian yeast. A nice beer, but not necessarily for someone who isnt a triple fan.
This brew has a nice citrusy taste that dances upon the tip of your tongue when taking the first sip. It is lighter in appearance than Chimay Red, with more fruit flavors and a higher ABV.

Bottle shared at Rootz.  Pours hazy amber golden with an off white head.  Aroma of yeast, citrus, grain, light fruit.  Flavour is moderate sweet and light bitter.  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Bottle. off-white head. aroma of hops, citrus and malt. bitter and hoppy taste.
Pours cloudy straw with a nice white head. Aroma: Pale malt, yeast, fruits. Hay hops. Taste: Medium (+) sweet, some bitterness. Bread. Palate: Medium body, quite high carbonation Pretty good.
Chimay doesnt produce any bad beers, so naturally this is quite good. Pours with a thick creamy head on top of a dark amber body. A bit more bitter than other triples, but still one of the best.
UPDATED: FEB 19, 2013 Good cloudy orange color, hop notes in aroma and taste, tripel style is not my favorite for the bitterness in many label beers

Bottle. Pours hazy amber with airy off-white head. Distinct aroma of hops and malt with a note of citrus. Pleasant, bitter, hoppy taste, offset by the sweetish note of yeast and abundant carbonation. Dry aftertaste. Quite good.
Part of the Chimay Holiday pack... Golden orange tint with a white foamy head. Aroma of yeast and berries. Tastes of wheat, dark fruits and nuts. Slightly carbonated. Ends hoppy but smooth.

Aromas are yeasty and straw like, also a little fruity and malty. Huge fluffy cloud like white head, shimmers down to a thin snow cap. Very dark yellow in color. Nice bubbly mouthfeel is noticed before the flavor. Highly carbonated. Slight bitterness and dry, touch of white wine, alcohol well hidden initially yet there is a slight rum like aftertaste. Very warming after a few sips. Light bodied with a dry finish. Decent but not as good as I anticipated. Overall just bland. Body is great though with the creamy bubbly mouthfeel.
golden in colour, great aroma, med-full bodied, leaves great finishing palate aftertaste. Enjoyed trying an actual trapist ale!

Sweet and nice fruity aroma, but a very bitter taste. Probably because of the yeast in the beer. I cant find the sweet tast back. If i didnt knew any better, i would have sworn that this is an Heffe-Weizen beer...

Zoet en lekker fruitig aroma, maar de smaak is erg bitter. Waarschijnlijk door de gist dat door het bier zit. Het zoete is dan ook ver te zoeken. Het is dat ik weet dat het een triple abdij is, anders zou ik zeggen dat het een Heffe-Weizen zou zijn.
Un nez dagrumes avec un goût initiale un peu sucré qui se transforme en blé et après il y a lamertume dhoublon. Plein de carbonation mais avec les bulles doux.
Nice colour, good head, great flavour. Nice company made this one a keeper.
Good aroma and flavor,first Chimay,remind me of Westmalle,some fruit and honey. golden with white head

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2013 Cloudy dark brown colour; Very big head and very frothy (I love it!); With fine smell of banana, yeast, and faint smell of caramel and hops; Apparent taste of sweet stout with toffee and banana; good lacing; Compare to the "Red" its bitterness has stepped up a bit but still very subtle and nice, typical of this kind; Taste is lively and organic throughtout with  sweet after taste. At Abv 8%, its quite strong but get to your head slowly, and nit easily drunk.

Comment: Definitely a level up from "Red". Leffe Brune is the competitor but it seems to lack the organic taste this one has. No wonder it is highly regarded by beer lovers around the World. Next, bring on the ultimate, Chimay Blue!
Bottle.  Classic Belgian triple with more bitterness than you usually see in a Trappist which I appreciate.

Great aroma and flavor. My first Chimay, so I have nothing to compare to; I read the others are better, but this is quite good. Smooth; delicate malts and yeast; mild fruits. I dont get much in the way of hops.

One of the classics. I just wonder how could i delay this rating till now, cause the first one i had was almost 20 yearas ago. Classic belgian triple, with the unique character of the Chimay yeast. POurs golden, quite hazy, with good white head. Crispy texture, high carbonation, medium body. Taste is some fruit, hoppy and yeasty. Nice brew.

Bottle of 330 ml, at home. Poured on a Chiamy glass.
Colour is of honey, non transparent at all, with two fingers head that slowly becomes just one finger, but with very good retention.
Aroma is of banana, pears. Some caramel too.
Taste is sweet and fruity, the alcohol very well concealed, but you can tell that this is a strong beer.Sometimes leaves a banana aftertaste.
Thick on the body and average to high carbonation.
Bottle from market District in Pine ,PA.  Not as nice as the Red label, more of a wheat note with fruits like pinneapple and wine.  Lighter in color and a bit more fizzy.
Not as good as the Red or Blue. Dried fruit, some peach (I think thats what it is), and a wheat beer yeast taste. Certainly drinkable, but the other two Chimays are better.

From a Chimay giftset I had purchased:

Pours into Chimay-branded goblet a hazy-light orange, with foamy white head about half-a finger thick,sticking around a little bit. Minimal lacing.

Very sweet nose of fruit, pineapple, malted barley, bread, oranges. Nice.

Good medium body, with full carbonation; flavors of sweet fruits, nuts, with a nice hop bite at the end. Very pleasing, not too heavy at all. Could drink all day.

The only thing setting this one back is the price. Otherwise, this is as good a beer as Ive ever had.
Bottle pours a dark yellow has a nice foamy head. Smells tastes of pepper spices banana yeast little malt not much booze. Pretty good beer solid with really nice finish.

bottle, 33 cl. amber honey colored body. Good two finger width creamy head. Aroma reminds me of hay, citrus, tropical fruits, grapes, apples and honey. Medium body, oily. A little of something which leaves a metallic aftertaste wich i found a little disgusting. Complex, sweet but a little monotonous taste. A classic.

Another one where Im trying to figure out how I missed it. Bottle. Pours orange-gold with a high, coarse-grained, long-lasting head. Nose is lemony with champagne-like dryness. Bitter on the tongue, then with sweetness kicking in at the back of the mouth; still drier than I expected. Long, cleansing finish. Yum.

Nose of Belgian yeast, lemon and coriander orange peel - subtle though it may be. Tastes of confused Belgian bitterness - yeast, bready, lemon citrus. Looks pretty, feels ight - decent tripel, could be more vibrant

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at bar. Golden color, white head. Sweet taste with citrus, earthy aromas, bread, nuts and toast. Bitter, fruity finish. Excellent abbey brew.

Pours a golden brown with large foamy head which hangs around until the end. Big aroma of banana, belgian yeast, bubblegum, lovely thick palate and nice carbonation with a bitter finish. Very enjoyable
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2014 Golden copper colour, medium head, sweet honey hoppy, sour hints flowery smell, bitter a bit sharp and sour taste, a smooth honey touch

caramel, cereal, citrus, grass, earthy, golden, amber, hazy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, 
Corked bottle pours a cloudy golden amber with thick white head. Nice lacing remains. Immediate aroma of citrus/bubble gum showing Belgian Yeast, with some light grass and earthiness as drinking progresses.  Light sweetness and bitterness working well together - no alcohol flavour. Nice carbonation with a medium mouthfeel. Finish is smooth with just a light bitterness that barely lingers.  A very nice tripel.
Probably the only abbey I like on the face of the planet. Sweet but not to winey. Bubbly foamy head, cloudy amber pour.

Aroma: clean and intense smell, variety of fruits

Appearance: nice thick head, golden and not completely transparent or opaque 

Taste: smooth beginning, light caramel and light malt taste, hop taste starts very light and builds up to a moderate hoppy aftertaste

Palate: nice froth on the tongue with a creamy sensation as well



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Chimay chimay ya chimay yam chimay yay
Gimme the mic so I can take it away.

Pours a hazy yellow with a nice, billowing head that stays. Aromas of Belgian yeast, and some fruits as well as some woody notes. The taste has a big amount of hop bitterness with a tinge of spice and some nice caramel malts coming through slightly. Leads to a slightly dry finish that leaves some bitterness lingering around. This beer reminds me of Orval in many ways, yet I find it just a tad more drinkable, but both are outstanding offerings. CHEERS!

On tap at Csakajósör, Budapest. A bit hazy, orange color with big, creamy, white head. Soury, yeasty, fruity odor. Complex aroma, yeast, fruits, some alcohol and a bit cheese. Some hop also appears. It makes the beers bitterness balanced. The taste is delicious, bitter-sweet. Medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Long, complex finish. Its a very well balanced beer. Its strong and intensive, but its easy to drink. Its underhand, it makes you drunk suddenly.

750ml->stem.  Cloudy orange with decent white head that lingers.  Aroma has yeast, bread, and some grass.  Tasteis citrus, bready malt, and yeast.  Slightly unpleasant metallic aftertaste.  Very good.
Bottle from Barton Arms; pours hazy orange creamy white head, grassy aroma, taste is yeasty, grassy pronounced spice quite good hides the 8% ABV well.

I ordered a case of this beer when I was in college not knowing how expensive that would be.  Shocked at first, but worth every penny.  Slightly more dry and hoppy than the others with a less pronounced fruitiness.  Still, a great beer.

Pours a large creamy off-white head that diminishes mostly and gives excellent lacing. Body is golden yellow and hazy. Aroma contains hops (fruits like citrus or lemon), yeast (dough) and pepper or spices. Palate is medium to full, texture is creamy and carbonation lively. Flavor starts of light acidic with fruits, then goes to yeasty to finish off with bitter and warming alcohol. A very good and enjoyable tripel.
Together with Chimay a la biere cheese the yeast of the beer is pushed away and most of the bitter, leaving a very fruity beer. The cheese also loses bitterness and becomes softer and more fruity. A fresh combination, but complexity of the beer is lost.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

#397
Im Mort Subite gibts das Chimay Blonde vom Fass eingeschenkt: Goldene Farbe mit viel Schaum, serviert im Original-Chimay Glas. Ein schönes hefiges und auch leicht fruchtiges Aroma nach Pfirsichen. Der Antrunk ist voll, der Körper erstaunlich trocken und fest. Die Fruchtnote ist auch im Geschmack wiederzufinden. Überraschend herb für ein Trappisten! Die Alkoholnote ist im langen, hopfenherben Abgang nicht wirklich störend! Gutes Blonde!
	
Test vom 14.12.2009, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 12,12,12,12,-,12 - 12,00

Pours very light yellow with giant white head. Aroma of yeast and a bit earthy.
Medium body but quite heavy carbonated. Medium sour but not much bitterness.

Well, not bad... but not as good as I thought it would be. Smells pretty good, plenty of aromas, citrus, coriander, caramel but once you drink it you find out that the taste of alcohol is too prominent in my opinion. Eventhough, still a nice beer.

Pours a slightly hazy deep golden color with a huge frothy white head that shows remarkable retention and tons of lace. Smells of pepper and light sweet sugar with hints of orange marmalade. Tons of yeast and fruity esters with little to no hop presence. The flavor is filled with sweet sugary maltiness with honey and light sugars being in the forefront. Sweet light fruit flavors of orange and tangerine with a light sweet cherry flavor. Lots of pepper and yeasty phenols round this out quite nicely. Medium body with a spirited level of carbonation and a sweet prickly mouthfeel. Very well balanced well made beer, as common as this is its hard to believe it took me this long to try it.

Hazy golden yellow, creamy white lasting head. Yeasty hoppy perfume aroma and taste, with a unique spicy bitterness and a floral fruitiness. Softly carbed, medium bodied, moderately hopped. Spicy hoppy finish. NFL (Not For Lagerboys)
UPDATED: SEP 6, 2013 On draft at  Ketch 55 in avon NC. Pours a fairly clear orange with a white head. Pleasant tropical fruit aroma. Flavors of orange zest and cardamon. Muted bitter finish.

Dark gold with hazy appearance. Unfiltered so yeast still floats in the beer. Good malty flavor with smooth mouthfeel and no real unpleasant features. 12 oz bottle poured into a chimay goblet. Four finger head which dies quickly. Lacing is very nice. Good beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home.
Pours hazy orange. Strong nose with plenty of peach, malt and blood orange. Taste is very full and follows nose. The wheat is certainly there. With strong fruits and alcohol, but to much for my taste, but a very well balanced trippel. Nice booziness...
Pours a hazy gold with a foamy white head. light spice, bananas, spices medium carbonation

Bottle. Aromas: yeast, cookie dough/flour, honey, fish eggs. Cloudy honey color, huge ice cream cone head. Thick sweetness in initial, the fruit  is concentrated but mellow; mid palate exposes yeast; final has alc. warmth and gentle bitterness. Medium body. Very smooth, warming, full of restrained flavor, yeasty but manageable. Usually better on tap, but this is still damn good.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2014 Nice frothy head and steong fruit and yeast aroma. Flavor follows with steong yeast mixed in some banana, fig, and some belgian tang. Very nice beer. Chimay may be my facorite Belgian brewery.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
golden amber fast orange . hazy. freshness of hop. citrus to eat. yeast intensive. fruit bitter and dry. top beer
Cant believe I never got around to rating this one- Ive been drinking it for years. Really one of the benchmarks when it comes to the style.

330 ml bottle. Pours a sediment-filled golden dark-yellow, nice white head. Smell is wheat, cereals. Taste is fruits, pear, malt, mint, pepper, hint of bananas, spices. Finish is very spicy. Very dry shot of herbal hops at the end. Medium body, touch of viscosity ; medium to weak carbonation. Very good!
pours a hazy gold colour with a foamy white head.lots of banana esthers follow through into a full and clean triple. nice and smooth with a solid malt backbone.

Pilsner malt, light spice in aroma. Gold, hazy, white head. Flavor features pilsner malt, cracker-biscuit-like character, light spice, some pear-like fruitiness. Very drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cost me five cents and a bit... esters were strong, nice rounded malt character, some spices, definitely could taste the alcohol more than other tripels Ive had.. the star was definitely the finish, which tasted like pure fresh butterscotch and lasted forever. One of the best finishes Ive ever tasted, in fact.
Its a round taste and nice on the tung. Its sad for the big alcoholig strength 8%, but one is no problem
UPDATED: FEB 5, 2013 Bottle at praha, tampere. Hazy orange color with white head.  Aroma of banana, sweetness. Sweet aroma, banana, hops, co2.
Pours a nice golden yellow with a thick white head. Strong hoppy aroma, greeted with a hopped, haylike flavour.

Ottimo aspetto. Al naso gli esteri tipici delle belghe si fondono armoniosamente con sentori agrumati e floreali del luppolo. Bocca alcolica, secca con un buon amaro amalgamato con sentori di pera e banana.
When I try a tripel, this is the one I always compare it to.  Clove, banana, Belgian sugary sweetness.  In love.

si presenta con un bel colore dorato tipico di questo stile, così comè tipica la schiuma, molto morbida. al naso si sente chiaramente laroma di uva passa del lievito utilizzato per tutte le Chimay, con delicate note floreali. birra per nulla stucchevole, con un giusto equilibrio tra dolce e amaro con laggiunta di un tenue velo acidulo. al palato si nota un corpo leggero, una carbonazione sostenuta, ma vellutata e una consistenza agile. il finale, a onor del vero, non è lungo ed è sottilmente amaro. birra precisina, perfettina, e, come accade per le cose troppo perfette, priva di componenti emozionali spiccanti. bella, ma come una statua di cera.

Yeast and spices. Raisins. Very well balanced. Cloudy orange with thick foam head.  Easiest drinking chimay for me

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It doesnt get any better than Chimay when it comes to Belgian ales. The Blanche is no exception to the other two by Chimay. Smells of raisins, and other very fruity elements. Tastes of raisins, very carbonated. Overall a great beer!

By far the best of the three Chimays I drank. Perfect look, creamy and durable head. Round, full taste, strong bite. Excellent balance of hoppy bitterness and fruity sweetness. Is there some mango in there?

Yellow bodied, it exhales spicy esters. Taste wise it is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is malt, hay, spices and yellow fruits. Overall this is my least preferred Chimay but still a good one to have once in a while.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2016 Pours a hazy golden orange on tap with fluffy white head that dissipates to thin lace and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma of belgian yeast, spiciness, and banana notes from the wheat. Taste follows, with a slight bitter finish and sweet yeast notes. Good stuff, but dissapointing for a trappist.
Pours a hazy golden with decent carbonation. Aroma is yeast and sweetnes. Taste is similar. Alcohol is presant. My least favorite from Chimay.

Ottima! Laspetto è splendido con un colore dorato e intenso e una schiuma fine, corposa e persistente. Laroma è inteso con il luppolo che si fa sentire e lascia un piacevolissimo amarognolo in bocca. I corpo è pieno e la carbonazione non risulta affatto fastidiosa. Da notare che il finale è veramente lunghissimo, con laroma e lamaro che si prolungano mescolandosi.

330ml bottle into a chimay goblet. Stamped with a "L09-284". I believe this is at least a few years old.

A - Clear and dark yellow/amber body. Sudsy two finger white head settles into a patchy cap with nice edging. Decent lacing and retention. 

S - Lemon, apples, light banana, bready malts and a lingering spicy Belgian yeast. Smooth and well balanced with a nice little alcohol tinge. 

T - Follows the nose with lemons, apple, hay, bready malts, and a nice banana/yeast ester finish. Light on the spice with loads of fruits and dark bready flavors. This is some tasty stuff! My only gripe is that it has an almost oxidized aftertaste. 

M - Medium bodied with loads of carbonation. A swish in the mouth creates a great deal of foam. Alcohol is really well hidden. 

O - Maybe its the slight bit of age, but this beer is much more impressive than the first time I tried it a few years ago. Delicious fruity tripel that doesnt go over kill on the spice. Well done Chimay, well done.

From notes: bottle poured into branded glass.  Poured hazy golden amber, with a pillowy, 2-finger white head.  Aroma was mild, yeast mixed with fruity notes and a touch of spice beneath.  Medium body with a creaminess from the head and a nice, long finish.  Mild citrus flavor with a decent amount of earthy yeast funk mixed in.  As it warms, notes of banana ester and black pepper come forward, along with a tingly astringency to the finish.

Pours hazy creamy with medium/high foam head.
Nose is focused on esters and yeast notes. Taste is well balanced and full, then finishes on a yeasty great flavor.
Good Belgian triple.
Bottle. Better than I anticipated. Poured a hazy amber color with a ridiculously thick head. Has a lot of the sweetness that the Belgian styles have, but its muted to be palatable.
Bottle to snifter (from notes).  Looks good; a hazy orange with off-white head.  Smells and tastes sweet, hoppy, and yeasty with an average mouthfeel.  Decent.
Light hazy orange colour with an off white head. Light fruity and hoppy aroma. Moderate sweet malt flavour with fruity and light citric tones. Lovely stuff.[Big bottle from Brussels airport]

Aroma: floral, fruity 
Appearance: creamy head with intricate lacing, hazy caramel color
Taste: medium sourness, medium bitterness, salty, 
Palate: medium body, lively carbonation, slightly astringent and bitter aftertaste

Tap. Pours clear amber with a medium white head that leaves great lacing. Aroma is yeast, coriander, spice, clove and dried fruit. Taste is about the same, lightly sweet, lightly (citric) bitter, medium body.

On tap. Im not normally much of a Belgian fan, but getting this draft was a real joy. Sweet and aromatic, went great with the meal. Left an almost slightly bitter, fruity aftertaste. Would definitely order again.
Thick head.  Opaque, amber color.  Minimal aroma.  Taste slightly of bananas.  Fresh and clean on the palate.

Ive had this from bottle and on draft--time to review. From bottle into Duvel glass. Colossal pour with head billowing above the rim of the glass and sticking for days. Beer is a slightly hazy burnt orange. Light, crisp, slightly funky aroma. Gets a bit hotter than you might expect, but the palate retains a lightness that helps even it out. Flavor is pretty mild; to me this beer is more about aroma and mouthfeel. Chimay is always great. Blue is still the classic and my favorite, but you cant go wrong with this tripel.
33cl. Pours light amber color with generous head. Very fruity aroma with notes of yeast. A good fruity aftertase. Excelent

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2013 Zijdezacht met een bitterheid in de mond en in de afdronk. Hoppig aroma met droge druiftoets

2e rating: lichtzurig jong bier, smaken fijner. Peperig, koriander en vanille. 
Medium body, vettig,
Colour is hazy orange. This one has white head. Aroma consists of yeast, fruits and hops. Flavour is bitter, spicy and a bit fruity.

750 ml corked caged bottle. Pours a deep honey gold color topped by a huge mousse-like white head. Fruity wine-like malty nose hints a citrus. Crisp dry lemony malt flavor with subtle peppery, ginny undertones. Complex malt and hops character throughout. Dry resiny hop finish makes this complete. Well attenuated and a true classic tripel.
Aroma is fruit, booze, yeast and slight hops.  Pale, cloudy and a bit turbid.  Buttery smooth mouthfeel.  Good trappy.

Medium strong aroma is fresh and fruity, citrus, mango, pineapple, lots of nuances, coriander, apple. Hazy honey yellow, dense white head is long. Taste is fruity, spices more evident than in aroma, pepper bite, fresh and crisp. Crisp sour, medium body, fizzy carbonation, long dry and sour finish. Overall a good nicely nuanced beer with crisp bite.
Love the classic label on the bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow.  Lovely almost wine like aroma.  Taste is very mild to start and then it grows on you.  A simple base for the fruit notes to expand on.
A hazy dark orange trippel with a nice white head. The aroma has notes of fruits, spices and hops. The taste is bittersweet and slightly dry.

Best before end of 2015.     33cl bottle
citrus, herbs, banana, Fruits, cereal, dark golden, hazy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, sticky, lively, long finish,

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2012 Small bottle poured into included Chimay Trappist glass.  Dark golden color with thick almost 1" white head.  At the bottom of the glass I observe the sediment (or "floaties as others have said).  Aroma was yeasty, some fruit and booze.  Taste is complex with some light hoppiness, sweet maltiness with flavors of raisins, booze, pepper and other spices notes.  This will be my second favorite Chimay, blue is my favorite.
Pours a cloudy dark golden with some sediment. Smells like wheat and hay. Notes of banana and caramel...very sweet smells. Balaned flavours though..more hay and sweet grassy flavours. Good.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Hazy amber. Notes of citrus, yeast, and some floral hops on the nose. Very well balanced mouth feel with neither the hops or malts stealing the show. Light enough to drink multiple glasses worth but still maintains a full flavor. Really solid brew.

Citrus pine nut, summer morning breeze a little fruity. Nice white frothy head. Light hoppy bitterness with a little citrus sweet underneath.  A little bitter aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light brown with orange tint. Raisins seep into the taste from the very aroma of this beer. It's not a bad thing but once you get over the raisins you'll get into the better parts of this beer; the balance of hops; the slightest touch of bitterness that rounds out at the end. If the review were shorter it would simply say: great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Head: off-white colored foam. Color: clear, yellow copper (brass). Aroma: hops. Taste: sweet, bitter. Palate: sweet, light CO2, full body, bittersweet finish. Overall: very nice.
Im constipated. Shared with brother in law impromptu beer tasting/pissup. Worse than red and blue, but little diff noted.
Jaha, så det var här den sista - och enda - biten i livspusslet låg. Chimay dricker man inte för att få vara sig själv en stund utan för att få vara någon annan - med ett bättre liv - för en stund.

August 28, 2012 - 330 mL bottle from LCBO - Pours deep gold with a moderate head and beautiful lacing.  Aroma of bananas, raisins, malt, and cloves.  Dry/Crispy and spiced taste.  FInishes fairly bitter, but with a bit of fresh, minty flavour.

Tap. Goldenish yellow but maybe a bit darker than that. Sticky sweet malt aroma, lots of yeast notes. Flavor is similar, floral, bubblegum, some pepper, hops maybe. Sticky finish, a bit more booze/pepper. Nice.

330 ml bottle @ La Brouette, Brussels.  Poured a cloud amber yellow with a thick off-white head. Aroma was yeasty and floral.  Taste was spicy, floral, and yeasty.  Medium, dry, hoppy finish and carbonation.

A decent, not extraordinary Belgian. Pours a cloudy orange. Not too much smell, a little sweet. Taste is basic, with a little bit of a bite. Had in the bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750 ml bottle from systembolaget sweden @ home. Pours golden with a huge white head. Fruity aroma and a quite dry taste. Long good finish. Very good this triple.
Già migliore rispetto alla Chimay etichetta rossa ma non convince appieno e non allaltezza della fama che la precede.

750---> snifter.  Pours hazy deep yellow with fluffy white head that sticks around throughout with killer lacing.  Aroma is banana bread, raisins, and booze.  Taste is sweet figs and yeast.  Palate is nice and thick and carbonated.  A nice beer, but nothing that stands out.
Cerveja excelente. Com sabores complexos e aroma intrigante e convidativo. Apresenta uma boa secura, típica, mas nada que prejudique a drinkability. sua aparência e corpo fortes já dizem tudo.

A delicious tripel thats surprisingly dry and hoppy. Wonderfully complex nose and a BEAUTIFUL head--really a great-looking beer. Mouthfeel is sticky and those hops hang around long after the last sip.

750 ml bottle. Pours a golden color with a huge white head. It has the aroma of herbs, hay, grass & coriander. It has a slight hop bitterness and tastes of raisins,  dark fruit & coriander. This beer is complex and has a wonderful & complex mouth feel. I really enjoyed this one.

Golden amber in color, nice nose but not pronounced. The head is a nice 2 finger which lingers. Some lacing in the trappist glass. Very clean with just a tocuh of bitter bite (more bitter than malty). Nice floaties on the bottom of the glass (non-pasteurized). A very fulfilling ale which I will buy again.

Hazy golden colour with good amount of head. Carbonation hold quite a while in the glass. Taste is a little bit malty/fruity and easy on the way down. Aftertaste holds a bit too. 8% but alcohol not overpowering at all. Great Beer.
Raisins taste, with good bitter palate. You can feel the power of this beer while drinkin it. White, thick foam stays very, very long. Copper colour. Very good beer, one of the best in my opinion.

Bottled, 0.33l. Cloudy golden color with thick white head and lively carbonation. Aroma of yeast, spicy hops and fruits. Taste starts with sweet barley malt and is followed by yeast and dried fruits which give the beer pleasant light sourness. Mouthfeel is very warm while finish is lightly hopped. Full body, thick texture and moderate carbonation in palate. May I say red and blue are better? But this one is still great...

Bottle enjoyed at home
Orange hazy, big white head that lasts forever. Smells of yeast esters, grass and some malts. Light malty taste, medium sweet, quite dry. Heavy bitter, quite grassy. Medium body, lively carbonation, watery texture. A quite nice tripel. Not very comparable with the blue and red Chimay; i think also its not as complex as the two. Still a very nice beer

A-- Poured a cloudy straw gold color with some floaties in the pour. Head was a big off white color with a lot of sticky lacing and a good 1 finger head once it settled.

S-- Not overly candied sugar sweet. A good amount of yeast in the smell. A little bit of sweet fruit and hops to this but not a lot again. Alcohol smell is well hidden. More about bread in this.

T-- More alcohol in the taste. Still get candied sugar and bread but not as strong as in the smell. 

M-- Creamy, decently carbonated and lively. Once it warms up it loses a lot of flavor and flattens out a bit. Becomes basically a beer with a lot of yeast in it.

O-  Not my favorite of the main three
Trapistické pivo, světlé, silné jako buk. lo to, ale nic extra. Lahváč z Makra.

On draft at Red Rocks in Alexandria, Virginia.

A: This ale appears mostly clear, with just a slight haze about it. The color is light orange, with a half inch of white head that leaves a nice coating of lace on the glass.

S: The smell is of fruit, citrus, yeast, and alcohol.

T: The taste is decent, with pleasant flavors of citrus fruits and Belgian yeast. The beer finishes with a touch of bitterness in the back.

M: Medium in body with a solid carbonation level. Warming alcohol shows itself in the finish.

D: A decent beer, but not my favorite offering from Chimay. Still, this is enjoyable and worth buying.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 12-28-2010
Enjoyable and interesting, more bitterness than recognizable hop flavors. Yeast. Sweet.
Overall this is an enjoyable Tripel that is quite drinkable, interesting and readily available. Nothing mind-blowing; just super solid.
Rating to rate it.  I know, boring right, well it had to be done.  Middle fav of the three.

0,33 l bottle. Fruity notes?  No way. This one has maybe an extremly nice colour between amber and briwn, but tastes just bitter. Maybe good if you have have a fat meal beside you. Maybe. Will never drink it again.

Had a lot of hope on this beer but was deeply disappointed. It got bitterer by every sip and I couldnt even finish it. Strongest bitterness ever, lots of yeast and wheat in taste. Taste of some bitter cucumber.

Bottle; cloudy, golden brown, thin loose bubbly head; yeasty aroma; spicy, sweet, burnt orange flavour; yeasty with a touch of alcohol; full mouthfeel, well carbonated; a long, fruity bitter finish; very good, but perhaps a little too much obvious sugar to propel the score above the magic 4.0.

330ml bottle @ EEWDBDSF 2012. Pours golden towards amber with white head. Floral, citric aroma with some caramel. Sweetness, floral notes, yeast, even some bitterness in flavour. Floral, sweetish finish.
This beer has a remarkably fluffy body, a light but firm hit of malt; and an intense, late orange, perfume,junipery dryness.

75cl bottle at home. Beautiful, cloudy sunset color with off-white head. Aroma is subtle. Great flavor. Sharp, bitter aftertaste. My favorite of the Chimays. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330 Ml bottle. Strong taste like a Chimay, but really strange with this type of ale. Not my thing...
Niiiiiiice!.....Now thats a tripel!  Smooth and sneaky.  Drink 3 and you are in trouble!  Green Flash Rayon Vert should take notes from these guys!
Poured on tap into a glass.  No joke here, I would recommend trying this out if youre lucky enough to find it on tap.  Great Belgian

Tap.  Pours cloudy golden orange with thin, creamy white head; short retention and minimal lacing.  Aroma is heavy bread and caramel malts, pears, floral hops, Belgian yeast, some spicy notes, and light sugar.  Flavor is sweet malt forward with good supporting citrus fruit esters, spice, and light hops; dry finish.  Medium body, low carbonation, and medium/high warmth.
Top class Belgian beer, With plenty of caramel and biscuit flavour, alcohol very well hidden. Very warming beer and perfect after a long night at work.
Nice and clean aroma, great foam that stays long. fruity but not to sweet. One of my favourite regulars
Golden colour, white foam. Mild sweet smell. Mild on tongue, very foam. Alcohol taste, sweet, quite strong. Good beer, but not the best.
Bottle @ Poggio. Two finger foam. Golden haze. Spicy yeasty notes. Pleasant crisp dry. Long finish. Oh yes are very nice Classic belgian.

In Italy with Japalo bottle. 


What to say... Really nice beer from Belgium. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.  Pours a hazy orangeish color, with a very thick head and a lot of yeast particulate.  Nice aroma of yeast, fruit, and spices (cloves, etc.).  The flavor is unfortunately more dull - some bitterness from the hops, yeasty tang, a bit of spices and (oddly) some dark fruits on the finish.  Mouthfeel is a bit thin.  Decent enough, but doesnt live up to the quality of the other two mainstays of the Chimay line.
16 oz draft.  Cloudy copper with dense white head.  Floral, citrus and spicy notes stronger than I normally prefer.

Pours a beautiful hazy amber with an impressively long-lived white head. The intense nose is filled with floral and citric hop goodness and doughy yeast. The malts have a clean fragrance of caramel. The flavor is creamy caramel malts up front, followed by a complex transition through a collection of spices, citrus and an assorted bouquet into the long bitter orange and alcoholic finish. Semi dry, the bitterness is only slightly off-balance. The carbonation is spot on. Kudos to you, monks of Chimay, this beer is nigh perfect.

Brilliant amber pour with a very white thick head. Smells fresh and taste aswell. Slight tingle on the tounge and throat when swallowed but nice slight bitter aftertaste. Dont notice the alc at all.. drinking out of wide mouth chimay glass. Dont know whta i like best...this or the blue.
Flagship of the style!  Belgian yeast aroma and flavor.  Doesnt get much better than this!

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Color oro carico lievemente opalescente con un bel cappello di schiuma bianca persistente. Aroma con fresche note fruttate di pesca e albicocca e sentori erbacei più delicati; gusto piuttosto dolce che apre con albicocche secche, malto e un tocco di caramello e chiude con un retrogusto luppolato asciutto e amaro molto soddisfacente. Perfetta al palato, con un buon corpo e una vivace effervescenza, struttura robusta con abv ben mascherato.
Golden/light brown and a little hazy with a medium head. Hoppy and malty smell. A bit of toffee, citrus and herbs. Refreshing with a medium body. Alcoholic aftertaste.

I dont understand why some sort of beers and brewers as Chimay, Guinness and lots of others are so overrated. Chimay is on average, so I even dont mind to describe it, as million of pals have already done with their commonplace enthusiasm.

A pellucid amber color on the pour, the head is large-scale, the lace filmy fine sheets that cling to the Chimay Chalice. Nose is malt, hints of citrus and lightly sweet, and quite pleasant. Start is malt, somewhat sweet, the top squinny, the finish is medial in carbonation, the hops pronounced, the aftertaste bone dry. Of the three Chimays, this is my least favorite, great in its own right, just not my personal favorite, but well worth a sample if you have not.

33cl bottle at Trikkestallen. Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Fruity aroma with Belgian yeast, malt with hints of spices. Lightly sweet with some alcohol and a fairly dry and somewhat bitter finish.

Bottle. Golden, hazy color, white fluffy head, making me thirsty. 
Slightly hoppy aroma, with yeast and sugar. taste of caramel, citrus fruits, grain and yeast. Good carbonation, and a lasting finish.

750 ml. corked bottle pours a hazy yellow with a huge white head and good lacing. Aroma is full of ripe apples, bread (yeast), and mild spices. Medium to full body without too much carbonation.Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2013 Mooie gouden kleur. Troebel, witte schuimkraag. Aroma van hop, citrus, gist, honing. Levendig palet door voldoende koolzuur. Smaak begint prettig zoet, gaat mooi over in een bittere afdronk. Nasmaak iets te bitter, verder heel mooie tripel.

If youre looking for a good tripel that is easy to find, this definitely your go-to beer. I had this on tap and it tastes a little fresher and went well with a steak. A nice Belgian yeast odor that is finished through the taste. Clean and crisp and easy till the finish. I typically find triples over-carbonated for my taste, but this one is at a milder level. Definitely worth a try.

330 ml bottle. Gusher. Then poured a murky orange brown with full head. Aroma of ripe apples, spice and yeast. Full and almost creamy. Flavors of honey, golden raisins, spice and yeast. A little bitter and acidic on the finish but only a little. A great beer.

On bottle at Underbar, Oslo.
Fruity aromas, nice yeast.
Well balanced
Full body & high complexity.
Very enjoyable
Sawdust type aroma, reminds me of the smell of Dutch bruin cafes, taste is dry and complex, some grainy flavours with malts and slight yeast

330ml bottle. Pours hazy golden yellow with a voluptuous white head which dissipates slowly. Aroma is hoppy with fruit, honey and citrus undertones. Taste is fruity with orange and a zesty hoppy taste. Pronounced bitterness that fades slowly.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2012 330ml bottle. Hazy orange color, with little white bits in it. Medium creamy head, stays for eternity. Sweet, yeast, malty, fruity aroma. Orange peels, yeast, sweet, alcohol in flavor. Mild bitter finish. Good beer.
Exquisita, y si es de grifo mejor que mejor. Pocas se pueden encontrar que sean mejores.
From the bottle. Hazy yellow, long lasting white head. Creamy, a touch dry, a touch of bitterness, spicy notes, orange notes and some warmness. Another brilliant Chimay beer.

Pours a nice hazy golden yellow with a nice lasting medium white head. Aroma and Taste is of some light ripe fruit, Belgium yeast, some biscuit malt. A nice medium body with a nice smooth mouth feel on the palate. Finishes with a nice light ripe fruit flavor, some Belgium yeast and biscuit malt ending with some light peppery hops. Overall an enjoyable and easy drinking Triple.
15th May 2010Hazy gold - amber beer, a little white head. Light dry palate. Dry creamy malt with a bitter orange and a spicy bite. Finishes dry and a little sweet. Okay but over dry.

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur jaune-orange pale, trouble, mousse abondante dassez belle tenue. Fruitée et légèrement épicée mais avec toujours avec un houblon très marqué qui offre une amertume soutenue et un côté herbacé. Une finale un peu sèche avec une pointe dalcool. Belle carbonnation, longueur moyenne. Trouvée à Intermarché - Montigny en Gohelles.

eccellente rappresentazione di questo stile abbey/tripel, che presenta la birra con un colore giallo carico e una schiuma bella corposa e molto persistente. Il gusto è molto forte, tuttavia nasconde abbastanza bene i suoi 8 gradi. Una volta finita, saremo lieti di sentire il suo buon sapore ancora per un bel po.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2012 Dark golden color with nice head. Found it a bit a heavy drinker, but the bitterness compensated for that. Neutral smell. Hops, fruit, spices.
Dry while drinking but intense after bitterness.

Botella de 750ml -Etuiquetada como Cinq Cents y tapón de corcho. Copa Cáliz de Chimay. Saboreada en jun´12. Color ámbar anaranjado. Nublada con evidente levadura en suspensión. Corona marfil, tupida y de burbuja pequeña. Buena retención y espumosos collares. Aromas y sabores de malta caramelo, vainilla, frutas y matices de pan. Peras maduras dulces en el intermedio con notas de especia. Sin amargor. Cuerpo pleno y carbonatación exacta. Final de melón maduro y retrogusto especiado. Maravillosa, refrescante y agradable asimilación. Perfecto equilibrio de aromas y sabores. ¡Una cerveza de chapeau!
750ml bottle -labeled Cinq Cents & corked tap- Chimay Chalice glass. Enjoyed on jun´12. Orangish amber in color. Hazy, evident yeast in suspension. Off-white, close, small bubbled, crown. Good retention & foamy collars. Caramel malts, vanilla, fruits & bready hints both in flavors & aromas. Sweet ripe pears in the middle, spiced notes. No bitterness. Full body, exactly carbonation. Ripe melon finish & spiced aftertaste. Marvelous, refreshing & pleasant drinkability. Perfect balanced flavors & aromas. A wow beer!

Theres a fantastic blanket of thick, viscousy goodness that comes through in the aroma, full of caramel, dough, orange and honey.  On the tongue its got a lovely spiciness, and on the sides  a warm, whiskey-like taste right down the middle.  Pure awesomeness.
No questions asked, this is the best belgian triple made anywhere.  This is how all others are judged

Very good. The beer smells of light fruit in apple maybe pear range with a complementing sweetnees ranging from honey to fresh yeast rolls. The beer is a hazy gold with a large fizzy structured white head that condenses to a light foam, but leaves only marginal lacing. The beer tastes of light fruit, honey, fresh dough, with just a touch of herb like spice. The hops play little with the taste giving of a light citrus note and a mildly bitter finish. The beer is on the chewy side of medium bodied with a very smooth mouthfeel and a velvet finish.

330ml Bottle. Golden hazy ale with a white fluff head which calms quite quickly. Instant wheat nose with fruitiness of grapes. In the mouth, its rather hoppy. Lots of bitterness coming with vinous fruits, pear, raisin and theres a hard yeasty dough streak throughout. Very gassy, but drinks quite smoothly and the finish is mellow with a pleasant bitter linger.

Tried at Delius 6.2.12 with Lisa, Amy, Robb; very nice aroma any palette feel

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Slightly hazy golden appearance with a definite yeast aroma. Definite Belgian style. Smooth and tasty with fruity notes. Slightly bitter on the backend.
