UPDATED: AUG 29, 2015 Murky, brown and orangeish colour with an intense white head. Sour aroma with some sweet notes. Taste is great though. Really rich and full. Mouthfeel is somewhat thick, carbonation is not too heavy. Very nice triple.

Nice golden pour, frothy white head.  Hops and subdued fruit and spice in the nose.  Malty, dry and spicy across the tongue.  Deep malt reasserts itself, with hops dropping the last blow.  Formidable.

Bottle shared with (and courtasy of) Inbreak and ClubGonzo. Best before 2010. Has a hazy light brown colour, reminds me of sewer. A small light beige head. A lot of sweetness in the aroma with dried fruit, brown sugar and some heather honey, and a touch of alcohol. Much of the same stuff in the flavour but not that pronounced. Bitterness = light+. Slick and silky mouthfeel. A nice sweet aroma on this, but an okay flavour. The storing has affected the beer.
Aroma is cloves, pears and apples. Taste is cloves, pears, apples, citrus, cherries, banana and yeast. Nice mouthfeel and tons of carbonation. Awesome beer. Very well done and enjoyable

On tap at The Brew House, Altrincham. Golden with a big white head. Notes of pine, banana and spices in the aroma. Fairly thick and creamy, with a lemony sharpness and enough complexity to keep it interesting. Goes down very easily with alcohol well masked. Very good tripel.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2012 Bottle. Pours hazy golden amber with frothy white lasting head. Aroma is caramel malt, pears, citrus, chardonnay and cookies. Taste is balanced medium sweet, bitter and acidic. Body is light oily and refreshing with good carbonation. Finish is dry and bitter with notes of chocolate, coffee and apples, but also hints of yeast.
About as good as it gets with this hugely complex and effervescent Tripel. The funky taste of raisins adds complexity and aroma.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Tap at Cheeky Monk. Poured a golden yellow with a fluffy white head and great lacing. Aroma is yeasty, spice, banana, fruit, some pineapple, and biscuit. Taste is biscuit and bread, banana, yeast, clove spiciness, and light alcohol, with a dry finish. Although, I pick the alcohol up slightly, it is hidden very well. Mouthfeel is medium with high carbonation. Overall a complex beer that is highly drinkable, crisp, and refreshing. Delicious.
Bottle. dark golden colour with medium dense head. Aroma hoppy and sweet malty notes. Taste sweet, hoppy and belgian yeast.

Powerful aromas of coriander, barley, oats, yeast, and intense floral hops. Appearance is a darkened brownish gold with a massive white top. Immense explosion of flavors upfront. Some of which include biscuit/dough, coriander, barley, roasted nuts, oats, floral and citrus hops all topped off with a thick, creamy malt and heavy alcohol filled finish. Overal, this is a monster of a beer filled with geniusly blended flavoring and heavy alcohol warming. I highly suggest this to anyone. A+ rating
Bottle. Hazy lighr copper color. Foamy white head. Fresh aroma is mostly citrus, spices. Sour taste, medium bitter aftertaste.
On draft at the trappistenhuis. Poors clear yellow orange with white head. Aroma banana, little citrus. Taste is banana, Some sweet, small bitter in the finish. It tastes like a stong weizen.

Bottle 0,33l 
Appearance:Hazy yellow-brown color with a huuuge tan head. 
Aroma: -moderate to high- malts, yeast, dry orange peel, grapefruit
Taste:light to moderate sweet with a high bitter finish.
Palate: Medium to full body, moderate carbonation   

Palate: Medium to full body, moderate carbonation
Orange color with bhite/orange creamy head. Aroma had malt and hints of citrus. And dominanting feeling of hops. Beer is more bitter than I expected.

Pours a rich, dark, copper/golden color.  Medium carbonation - tiny particles floating around.  Generous, lasting, foamy head.  Hoppy, caramel, bread, chocolate(-ish) aroma.  Nice, full body.  Nice, slightly bitter taste and aftertaste.

Aroma is light cookie dough and a hint of spice, maybe a poke of pumpkin pie and the spice form of cinnamon.  The aroma is most pungent immediately after the pour, but give it a swirl to kick it up again.  Appearance is just like apple cider.   It would be the foam only that let you differentiate the two.  There is a fair amount of particulate suspended in the brew, examine it against a back light to appreciate.  Taste is sweet malt, and really tastes just like it smells but with more pumpkin pie.  Seems like average carbonation and medium viscosity.  Not too thick, not too thin.  For a brew of this sweetness, it is not very syrup-like.  Overall, not bad.  I tried it with Indian palak gosh, the sweetness didnt stand up to the spice, but the brew itself was appreciable.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2012 Draft many times. Pours a dark honey amber with a pillowy head. Very well blended fruity tripel. Apple. Banana. Lemon.  Nectarine. Sweet in general but finishes fairly dry. Medium syrupy body. Some spicy bitter notes for balance, but tripelwise a full fruity wonder. Pretty much the standard for Belgium tripels and with good reason. Perfection for its spot in the beer world. Usually a bit heavier on draft but that is not a bad thing. Very much the yardstick to comparing any other tripel.

330ml bottle. Hazy orangey golden colour with average to huge firm creamy lacing white head. Fantastic fruity, yeasty and slightly spicy aroma, banana, pineapple, a grassy note. Taste is less intense and varied, balanced sweet- and tartness, increasing dry finish. Full body, well carbonated. Very good.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2012 ORIGINAL MAY SAMPLING NOTES: Pours to an impressive white head and nice light, golden color at the bottom of the glass.  Smell is yeast, nutmeg, and citrus, in that order of pungency.  Flavor is light initially, yeast and nutmeg, then more of a hops-kick (yet not overly bitter), and more of the same.  Super crisp.  Perhaps not quite as complex as their Grande Réserve or Première, but still outstanding.  After-flavors are banana clove and bread.  OCTOBER TASTING: Once again impressed.  Head is again fantastic - very billowy, and great carbonation with this one.  Lacing is more sporadic.  Aroma is so clean and pure - yeast and nutmeg, as I mentioned before, although the hops are less citrusy this time for me and more grassy.  Alcohol also hits harder than I recalled - really get a burn in the finish.  Still, cant complain too much about this one - a well-balanced tripel that doesnt over-assault with acidity as some in the style can tend toward.  Probably still my second favorite in the style after Corsendonks - I liked Samuel Adams New World a lot as well, but its a bit dark and peppery for the style label.
golden, amber, hazy, white foam, grass, spruce, bread, leaves, alcohol, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, lively, bitter,
amber, hazy, Huge white foam, bread, hay, cereal, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,
A wonderful blend of spicy and sweet Tripel taste and complex flavour without any aspect dominance.

From BA: October 2007: The third beer I had during my Chimay evening, I had all three Chimay beers and some of their semi-soft cheese (blue label).

This beer is slightly cloudy orange colour with a good large white head.

The aroma is all about spice, lemons and yeast.

The taste carries on where the aroma stops, herbs and citrus fruit flavours without the tart sourness that implies.

The flavours stay, this is a fine beer it is the best triple that is easy to obtain and is well worth trying.

Very drinkable beer, just like the other two regular beers the monks brew at Chimay.

Bottle 0.33 L.
Hazy deep orange body with a huge, creamy, white head, fully lasting with an excellent lacing;high density of tiny particles.
Intense yeasty and malty aroma at first; after a while a more persistent aroma of spices (cloves, nutmeg), fruits (apricot) and honey comes over; an alcoholic note is also present.
Alcoholic and fruity sweetness in the flavour, with a light-to-moderate acidic character and a light bitter note.
Light-to-medium body with a watery texture (quite unexpected, actually); lively carbonation; light alcoholic feeing in the finish.
Very satisfactory beer!

Chimay blanche, ou Chimay triple, ou Chimay Cinq Cents, depuis
la célébration des 500 ans de la Principauté de Chimay... 3 noms pour une
bière, bien quen fait le nom de Cinq Cents devrait être réservé à la bouteille
de 75 cl... si lon sen tient à lhistorique de la maison.
Voilà pour le cadre de départ. Mais attention tout est dans la suite !!!
Une couleur abricot, peau dorange, pêche qui fait assez bien penser à la
bière dOrval, et on verra par la suite quil ny a pas que la couleur...
Mousse blanc beige bien stable sur le brassin, de quoi contenter la fée des
triples...
Des arômes de prune blanche, pêche, abricot, poire et autres fruits doux.
Une texture remarquablement veloutée. Ooooh plaisir premier de la bière.
Un premier goût fruité : depuis les fruits de la passion jusquà labricot tendre.
Avec une pointe de girofle et un jolie amertume en arrière bouche.
Un second sur le trèfle, la myrtille, lortie avec une pointe de coriandre, suivi
de céréales écrasées au pilon en arrière fond.
Un 3ème nez de céréales et houblon superbement équilibré.
Une 3ème bouche complexe, de grande ampleur, avec un équilibre sublime
qui vous fait naviguer dune saveur à lautre.
La longueur fait atteindre au goût de lOrval... avec une nuance spécifique.
Le suivi est exceptionnel. La finale mirifique et très longue.
La levure est du plus pur calibre, douce, suave, et entière.
Lalcool est dune progression remarquable.
Cette bière est une triple dun niveau extraordinaire, voire parfaite.
Coter à 5 est le minimum, je propose plutôt 6 sur 5, et ceux qui cotent cette
bière en dessous de 4 doivent faire un recyclage urgent, ou changer de boisson...
Merci Chimay, youll never walk alone .

Rating #731, bottle at Franks place  

Quite nice tripel appearance; hazy and with a medium dense stable head. Aroma is flowery and citrusy, with a good bunch of hay. Flavor is much alike, but with some nicely balanced sweetness as well - not overly complex but really well tasting. Medium palate. A nice, sweet, well balanced tripel.

This is very creamy, soft and foamy. The taste is very pleasant, "normal", and aroma gets into your nose very nicely. Very easy to drink, so its not too strong. Probably the best beer Ive tasted, because Ive dreamed of creamy beer. This is not too sugary, like many strong beers are. Its just bread, cereal, nuts, toast, roast, coffee, hay... all but nothing too much. The fruitiness isnt too raisin-like, its more like spruce - fresh, but very mildly. The end is a bit bitter, but I guess you cant help it, and its still very mildly bitter. After drinking more, I think this is still a bit too much raisin-like (sweet), but if you drink it normally, and dont let it be in your mouth, its still fresh and easy to drink.
Pours a hazy orange color and an offwhite head. The aroma is of sour fruits with hints of green apples and  citrus. The flavor is also tart and sour with same fruity notes. Medium body.
Tasted at Tap 42. My mom got a glass, its very smooth, and tasty but not dark and rich enough for my preference. But it is refreshing.

Bottle, hazy orange beer with a huge white head. Sweet aroma of malt, yeast kryderet with notes in the direction of coriander and citrus. Slightly spicy and rich flavor. Slightly bitter and spicier end
Good beer overall. Pours a slightly hazy gold color. Nice head. Fruity and citrusy yet fairly hoppy flavor. Mild taste that is very drinkable.

330ml bottle. Pours with huge fluffy head thick enough to support some of the sediment from the bottle. Cloudy iced tea colour. Aroma is syrupy with nutmeg, cinnamon, clove, must and dust. Taste is a lot of spice up front, with some sweet fruit and yeasty dryness. Alcohol very well masked. Body is thick but smooth. Overall, the spice overpowered the fruity sweetness making it a little unbalanced, but it was still quite good.

Chimay Tripel, with its typical golden colour, its slightly hazy appearance and its fine head is especially characterised by its aroma which results from an agreeable combination of fresh hops and yeast. The beers flavour, as sensed in the mouth, comes from the smell of hops: above all it is the fruity notes of muscat and raisins that give this beer a particularly attractive aroma. The aroma complements the touch of bitterness. There is no acidity, but an after-bitterness which melts in the mouth

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden, with an appealing thick airy head. A rather dark aroma with roasted malts and dried fruits. Flavour is roasted malts and orange peel, before it ends off with a tremendous and everlasting grapefruity finish.
This a wonderful beer. Whether chilled or at ambient temperature. The first taste is a mild hop followed by a lovely fruit. This is truly a world class beer.

pours a cloudy dark golden color with a thick white head.  The aroma is grassy, fruity, and yeast.  The flavor is very sweet of wheat, fruit, grass, and yeast i get a small amount of raisins in the taste too.  The overall palate of this is pretty nice, for being 8 percent there is little hint of the alcohol, and is very smooth.
From the bottle pours a beautiful, hazy, golden brew with a thick, rich head. Medium bodied with aromas and flavors of citrus, malt, and hops. The malt comes at you up front and the hops finish up.
Bottle. Hazy golden with creamy  head and good retention. Smells lemony and biscuity. Tastes sweet then lightly dry. Warming- almost reminiscent of brandy- a hint of spice on the finish.
Everything you ever wanted from Belgian beer and maybe something more. Incredible.
33 cl. bottle @ home. Hazy golden colour with some specks of yeast and a white head. Aroma of yeast, citrus fruit and champagne. Rich deep, slightly biter tripel taste with lively carbonation.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2012 +/- normaal goud honing kleur.
+ heerlijke geur, zoete vrouwen parfum.
+ 1ste smaak - zacht zoet, 2de smaak - prikkeling van koolzuur op tong, 3de smaak - Prikkeling van de alcohol, 4de smaak - ligt bitter.
330ml bottle from Bierzwerg. Poured to chimay chalice, hazy golden colour with 2 finger head. Aroma is yeast, fruits. Flavour is fruity and yeasty. Pairs nicely with chimay grand cru cheese.

Hazy orange golden with a rocky, stabile off-white head and sediments.
Fruity, spicy smell.
Tasteing starts sharp followed by a pine-fruity and dry aroma escorted by distinct herbals, honey, alcohol and cheese, mouthfeels syrupy.
It finishes long and warming with pepper and citrusses, which leaves a tart aftertaste behind.

Bottle.... It pours hazy golden with a medium white head....the aroma is some citrus, fruits, muscat nut :) ... hops and butter..... the flavor is butter, muscat, hops, fruits ........... medium body.... fruits and bitter finish.....
Draught @ The Trappist. Golden, see through, small white head. Caramel, nuts, hops. Thin body.
UPDATED: DEC 22, 2012 Was given one for free by a Bud Light drinker so I canât complain. I still think its a little overrated.
On tap at Bishops Skövde. Pours copper with a big white head. Smells and tastes sweet nutty malty with a similar finish.
La clásica Chimay nunca falla aunque su precio suele tirarme para atrás normalmente. Para momentos especiales.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2012 Bottle. Pours with a massive creamy head which lasts most of the drinks duration. Lots of lace. Murky, opaque orange colour. Rich aroma of caramel and slight hint of hops. Tastes even better. Well balanced with a sweeter finish. Delightful.

Bottle @ home. Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma malt, belgian yeast, sweets, sweet fruit. Taste is malt, yeast, sweet fruit, orangepeel, light spicy. Medium body, average carbonation. 030412

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Oak gold yellow hazy poor with nice foam, slighly off-white. Some yeast taste, and very bitter hop. Taste is long lasting in mouth, quite high on alcohol, but thats what I like. No sweets.

pours a hazy golden orange tint with a veru nice white head, very good retention and lacing. saison-esque aromas. citrus, bready, very yeasty, lemony. lightly boozy, peppery, medium long grassy finish, lively but soft carbonation.

I love pouring this beer into a proper gobblet it comes out a cloudy mahogany color with a two finger off white head that fades to a ring around the edge of the glass. It smells somewhat sweet malty with a strong presence of brown sugar and dark fruit.  The taste is creamy, smooth with a slight bitterness in the finish.

 This is a classic trappist style beer; a real crowd pleaser. If you ever what to convert someone to start trying carft beer this is a great place to start.

Enjoyed in a Fin Du Monde Trappiste glass @ 1410 beer haus, Calgary.  Aromatic micro-bubble froth gets the nose and dissipates.  Deep amber color folks the eyes and makes my mouth dry with anticipation of the bitterness.  I am surprised, though, as i taste it the bitter hops, mingle with the manly sweetness and rolls off the tongue like fois gras.  What a sexy finish!

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2014 
33 cl bottle. 2010 vintage.
Hasnt really developed to any direction, maybe the alcohol comes through a bit more, slight increase on toffee as was expected. Maybe this isnt as good for ageing as Blue is.
33 cl bottle. 2010 vintage.
Originally rated on 20090215. (9+4+8+4+17)
Pours cloudy amber color with a large sized and long lasting frothy head. Aroma of belgian yeast, spices, some leaves, mild toffee and caramel notes, earth, sour fruits and mild herbal notes. Flavor of yeast, sour lemony fruits, spices, distant toffee notes and some caramel. Strong CO2, sourish palate with a bitter and dry finish. Not as fruity as it was when fresh, but definitely not worse.
3446
Clear golden colour with white thick head. Aroma is very fruity. Taste is sweet, also quite fruity with some wheath notes and also some alcohol. Slithtly bitter in the end but mainly sweet.
Bottle thanks to mar, pour is a honey, with thin white head..Nose is apple,grape, floral, spice..Taste is white grape, apple,spice, bready..

This beer was headed for a 3.8 rating but the more I drank, the more I enjoyed it. Poured in a Duvel Tulip bought today, very pleased with it, supported a decent sized head that disappeared after about 5 minutes, golden and hazy beer. The aroma is of yeast and sugars, taste is hoppy, slightly bitter, very smooth on the palate, creamy, silky. Just my second Tripel. At this rate, I cannot wait to go to Belgium in September. Lovely beer. And thats the 3 Chimays done for me.
user_location: Chapel en le Frith, Derbyshire, ENGLAND

text:
On tap at Matchbox Pizza in Rockville, MD. 

Hazy golden straw color.  Head had already settled to a thin, creamy film when the beer arrived.  Excellent lacing. 

Aromas of Belgian yeast & sugars. 

Classic triple flavor.  Creamy mouthfeel.  Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a rich hazy golden color with a fluffy white head. Smells a bit floral with some yeast and citrus notes. Taste malty with a touch of spice and dry hops. There is also some tartness to this one. Med body, med carbonation. Overall this is very well balanced and a very elegant dry brew that isnt bitter and easy to drink.
poured a golden color on tap at gingerman nyc. slightly hoppy scents and a sweet scent to it like a fruit. taste was matched with hops and some malt that was sweet.
Orange amber, white head. Citrusfruits, dough, caramel malts, some yeast, some hop bitterness. Good body and carbo.

From notes.  First reviewed 12/10/2011.  Poured from an 11.2 oz bottle into a Chimay branded chalice.

My pour out of the bottle has a murky faded golden color with a tangerine tint. An ever-rising taupe head that exhibits a typically Trappist bubbly carbonation. Sheets of lace coat the glass on the way down.

The aroma has a full bready aroma. Full cereal grains, honey, Belgian spicy yeast, and some cloves.

The grains come on pretty strong to begin each sip. Somewhere between biscuity and bready, some honey and light caramel sweetness comes in next. The estery yeast adds a nice spiciness, but the flavor loses steam toward the end. There is an annoying metallic taste that comes in toward the end, and the malt sweetness seems to have run out of steam. I noticed the same metallic taste on tap, but I figured I would give a bottle a chance in case it was a one time problem. It is not.

The carbonation here follows the typical lively Belgian style. Very full and bubbly, it almost seems to scrub the tongue and remain somewhat creamy at the same time. There is a rugged graininess that is a clear result of the brewing style. Overall the body is on the fuller side of medium, but it is smooth enough to drink fairly easy.

Chimay had such a cache for me when I first started into the craft beer scene. But after having quite a few great Belgians and trying some of the more creative American styles, this tripel just leaves a bit to be desired. The carbonation is a bit out of control, and the slight metallic flavor towards the end is a turn off as well. At this point there are a few readily available tripels I would rather have.
Beautiful cloudy amber with lasting foamy pure white head that lasts and lasts. The aroma and taste are yeasty and bready and so silky smooth. Like any trappist beer, very enjoyable

0,33 l bottle. Pours a big sticky white head. Aroma of plum and yeast. Nice balance due to wheat and barley malt. A deserved little brother to the Blue;)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
full body,soft carbonation, long finish, thick feel, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, lightly sour, golden, hazy, white foam,

Cloudy, orangish-yellow color. Effervescent. Head was creamy and off-white. Hoppy and phenolic nose--wonderful. Some underlying citrus scent. Body was medium with lots of hop flavor and a fair amount of bitterness. Great drinkability.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2012 Sono queste tipo di birre che ti fanno ringraziare lesistenza dei monaci trappisti. Liquorosa, complessa, vellutata fruttata. In bocca si percepisce un pò di amarognolo. Il retrogusto è di albicocca si sente anche un sapore di zucchero candito. Ottima! a mio parere la miglior Chimay.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2012 Aroma and taste are both quite fruity and floral. medium body and lively carbonation. this beer is easy to drink. the finish is bitter, what I like a lot. The beer tastes like a kind of Belgian style IPA
UPDATED: JUL 19, 2012 lovely grassyhop aroma, lots of fruit in the palate, complex and clean. The hop is most prominent and is carried by a smooth bitterness that echoes away.
On tap at Pangaea Two Brews. Fruity notes in the aroma and flavor.  Nice effervescent mouth feel.

Smooth - not overly sweet - excellent with a meal. The flavor builds on the aromas of fresh hops and yeast.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A lighter more golden version in the Chimay lineup.  Its crisp and refreshing without as much weight and body as the Blue, but more refined than the Red.
Nice golden colour and small white head. Quite sweet and also a bit bitter for a Tripel. Not bad, but lacks a more robust body.

330ml bottle.
Medium, cloudy straw, white head.
Spicy, malty aroma, yeast, hops, citrus peel, cloves.
Dry, medum body and bitterness, balanced CO2.
Spicy, yeasty taste, malt, citrus peel, cloves, some phenols.
(2012-02-27)
Dark golden color with a fluffy white head. Strong apple and grassy aromatics. Some sweetness blends in with the malty palate. Floral notes and tree fruit on the finish. Delicious.

Bottle. Pours a hazy deep orange color with a big, fluffy boisterous head that settles slowly. The nose is wood, apricot, honey, yeast, grassy hops. The taste is fruity, more apricot, white grape, the finish is lightly dry, hoppy, a bit of chalk and light acidity. The bodys light/medium, a very easy beer to take on. The carbonation is active indeed. Overall, not my favorite flavor profile, it has an herby flavor I dont love. But still nice to try.
Dark golden colour. Yeasty fruity aroma. Flavour is spicy, yeasty, hoppy. Finishes with a slight, but somewhat harsh, bitterness.

Hazy orange, soapy white head. Nose is yeast, fruit, hops, spice. Taste is malty, slightly sweet, hints of fruits and hops. Hoppy finish, citric-spicy notes, slightly dry. Medium bodied, fairly smooth carbonation. Good stuff.
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. Ill update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.
Bottle - big thick head, hazy dark orange color, great Belgian yeast spice aroma and flavor, good balance

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2013 mi aspettavo di più da un marchio trappista del genere,soprattutto dopo aver assaggiato la blu e la rossa(divine). Ci sono molte triple migliori di questa che non spicca affatto ma che resta comunque una buona birra dallaroma floreale,corposa e dal gusto secco,come il finale. (3,4)

19/09/2012 ho riassaggiato questa chimay alla spina..la conclusione è che la birra in bottiglia che ho assaggiato tempo prima (giudizio sopra) aveva qualcosa che non andava,forse avendola tenuta in magazzino e in cattive condizioni si è rovinata (ipercoop) perchè quella che ho assaggiato ieri sera è LA tripel..è assurda,partendo dallaroma che sviluppa (lieviti,luppolo fresco,malto profumato,fruttata, leggermente alcolica,perfettamente da tripel),passando per il gusto (pieno,dolce,luppolato,ha davvero tutto) e finendo col retrogusto,del quale non mi stancherei mai,lungo e bilanciato tra dolce e luppolato...altissimi livelli,una birra storica che cambia totalmente il mio giudizio!
bevuta allelfo

Bottle    pours a hazy deep gold  with a good dense white head. aromas of spice , grass ,citrus  ,yeast 
Taste  - something wrong  . I get yeasts band bitterness but it is very acrid / astringent - not at all pleasant . Maybe I got a bad one judging by other reviews

Currently drinking while typing. The aroma is nice once poured, good hop notes in there with Belgian yeast, malt, banana, pear, light spices and raisin. Very nice looking beer, hazy golden rusty colour with a reasonable head which is crisp white with bubbliness at first then slows into a nice creamy smooth textured surface. A pleasant flavour but not really full enough, tastes of sustained gentle bitterness, grassy hops, well masked alcohol, cereal, malts in the back and a white pepper taste which is a bit too prominent and the aftertaste is mainly bitter hops and cereal. Nice feel in the mouth, very full feeling for a Tripel style. Nice carbonation which contains well in the mouth with a subtle dryness too. Good beer but if I want a Tripel I will stick to a St Feuillien or a Westmalle, this just seemed to lack a richer flavour that alot of the other Tripels hold.
Bottle. Beautiful aroma of fruits, malts and hops. Taste is similar to aroma, with hints of alcohol and slightly bitter aftertaste. A very nice beer.

An absolute fruit boat of an ale. The aroma is all apples with a hint of cinnamon. Theres a fair amount of bitterness when it rolls over the tongue--and definitely the sweet taste of a pear. The finish is a puckering dryness. Really a treat worthy of breaking out for the Super Bowl. Go Packers! (Theyre not in it? Oh. Sorry.)

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2012 Crisp fruity nose.  Hints  of lemon.   Pasture appearance.  Small head....but it lasts.  A small Belgian "Wang" in the aftertaste, but not so much as I remember from previous samplings.  A good beer for a meal.   ***** Updated ranking...went up 0.1.  Witherspoon Grill, Princeton, Nj.

Sweet grapes and grass dominate the nose, backed up by caramel. Pours a hazy orange with a fluffy off-white head. The Muscat grapes are also the forward most flavor followed by grass, lemon, pepper, and dry, peppery, and sticky finish.

Chimays newest beer also features apples and more hops than the others. You also wont notice that this is 8% ABV until youre almost done with it.

Another world-class beer from Chimay. Outstanding!
Een triple met een zeer sterke maar droge smaak, vooral mout en hop. Kleur : geel tot donker geel.
Really light for a triple, liked it a lot, although I really expected a little bit better.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2012 Blonde color, nice white head, it mainly has a big bitter taste, little bit too agressive for me, as for strong blonde/triple type of beers i dont prefer too much the bitterness... It does also have a little sweetness that reminds me of honey.
Ottima Tripel, molto maltata in cui si sente notevolmente il classico lievito belga

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2013 Bottle. Yellow hazy. Malty wheaty yeasty nose. Good tripel flavours. Body is fullish, a bit dry and bitter. Full, long. Some coriander, spices. Quite good, if into the style.

After a westmalle tripel, this feels more malty. Otherwise similar profiles. Nice hops, good body. Excellent beer overall.

On tap at Petrol Station. Pours a clear gold with an off white head that dissipates nearly completely. Aroma has lots of light flora and sweet grain with a good amount of sweet fruits. Flavor starts with grains and sweet grains with a bit of light fruit with a hint of citrus.
Thie chemay triple has an overly hoppy smell. It poors light brown with a big frothy white head.
Bottle. Stron belgian yeast flavour. Fruity esters. Very dry finish. Layers of malty complexity. A proud example of the style.

Pours a nice hazy golden yellow with a nice lasting medium white head. Aroma and Taste is of some light ripe fruit, Belgium yeast, some biscuit malt. A nice medium body with a nice smooth mouth feel on the palate. Finishes with a nice light ripe fruit flavor, some Belgium yeast and biscuit malt ending with some light peppery hops. Overall an enjoyable and easy drinking Triple.
Een blonde Trappist, met een zachte bittere afdronk. Langzaam uitschenken, want anders wordt hij snel troebel van de gist. Je kan het onderste van de fels natuurlijk ook apart serveren.

Light clean aroma with slight alcohol hint.  Full pillowy head.  Sweet and slightly fruity, touch of Belgian yeast.  Lots of carbonation and a touch of hop bite at the end.  Finishes a bit dry.  Very good tripel

Pours hazy golden with a long lasting white head.  Aroma is of Belgium yeast, biscuit malt and some sour notes. Medium, smooth body.  Flavors are a boquet of Belgium yeast, peppery hops, biscuit malt and ripe fruit. Wonderful brew.
bread, citrus, earthy, cooked vegetables, pale, cloudy, white foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, heavily sour, umami,

Tap at Tap East, Stratford, served in a Chimay goblet. Pours a golden orange with a tight white head. Bubblegum aroma with orange peel, curacao, banana and clove. Thin, oily and fizzy on the tongue. Bubblegum, a little orange, grass, lemon zest and lime are all apparent. Almost a fizzy lemonade surrounds and contains. Quite a sweet and lasting home-made lemonade finish. Tasty.

Bottle at North Bar, Leeds. Pours a hazy hold with generous finger and a half of pillows head. Smell is great Tripel - Belgian yeast, apricot, banana, hops. Taste is nice - very Belgian with banana, apricot, hops, and a definite Belgian yeast character. Gratifyingly bitter finish stops it becoming cloying - a common Tripel fault for me - but is too fizzy. Very, very nice, though, classic Tripel.
Cloudy golden colour with a frothy white head and lace. spice, malt aroma. spice and herb in the flavour. Tangy, citrus orange finish.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2012 750 ml pours a nice hazy golden yellow with a white head. Aroma and Taste is of some light ripe fruit, Belgium yeast, some biscuit malt. Finishes with a nice light ripe fruit flavor, some Belgium yeast and biscuit malt.

Poured a cloudy amber with a dense with head. A ton of lacing. Aroma is yeasty with some apple and raisin. Taste is raisin, some breadiness, and a good sweet and bitter balance. Nice aftertaste. Very good.

Bottle
Banana & clove mix upfront coupled with some yeast and a lot of spice. Not what I was expecting when I picked this one up but very nice indeed. There is some nice citrus and good hops to round this one off.

Hazy golden orange colour with a massive, part foamy and part bubbly white head that looks quite rough. It slowly recedes in size from about three-fingers width to about a thin lace.

Citrus & clove to start with followed by some hops and Belgian yeast. There is a lot going on with this beer, some strong dark fruit flavours hit around the middle and maybe some pear too.

Medium, smooth and well carbonated, there is also a nice citrus sting upfront with this beer. It has a strong hops presence and also has a good feel to it.

Chimay never disappoints. Perhaps not there strongest offering when compared with the Rouge or the near perfect Bleue, this is by no means a failure and goes down very well indeed.

1 of the 1001 Beers To Try Before You Die:

33 cl. bottle in to a trappist glass. Cloudy, bright amber colour with a big white head, that leaves quite a bit of lacing on the glass. Fruity and yeasty aroma with hops, apples, banana, grapes and something sweet like bubblegum. Taste is sweet with apples, caramel malts, honey, and grapefruit with a hoppy and a subdued alcohol in the long lasting finish. Medium to full body with a creamy texture, lively carbonated. An excellent beer with the right balance between the hops and the yeasts.
Small bottle from LCBO.  Pours hazy yellow with a great big head.  Aroma is yeasty, citrusy, and a little spicy.  Taste is light Belgian ale, with a citrus bitterness.  Nice Tripel.

Poured from bottle. Fantastic yeasty, barley aroma with a beautiful big head when poured. Milky, amber appearance like many other great ales of this kind. Quite a hoppy, yeasty taste, but very smooth going down and a wonderful after-taste. This is a beautiful, pure, natural beer that has not been filtered like many of the crap mass-produced beers that Americans guzzle without thought. This is one of the better ales I have had the fortune to taste and it makes me happy to think that the ancient brewing methods of the monks at Scourmont Abbey still hold their own today.

Pours a deep murky molten gold with a sizeable rocky head. Wonderful orchard and wet cobblestone nose with hints of creamy vanilla. Some mild peppery citrus background. Some nuttiness there too. Makes me want to run out and grab the Westmalle for comparison. Wonderful texture on the tongue with just the perfect amount of hops for this taster. A perfect medium body and a class act. I will revisit the Westmalle, but this seems to me to be the epitome of what a Triple should be. The balance is outstanding.

Jag tycker att det är väldigt svårt att definiera trappistöl och den här är inget undantag. Smaken präglas av sötma och, vad jag tror är, jäst. Jag måste erkänna att jag föredrar den blåa framför denna.

750 ml bottle @ Market Basket, Portsmouth, NH. Hazy copper like color in a snifter. OH! Had a mild gusher here. It was not shaken on the car ride home, so looks to bit over carbonated. Once the head died down and it sat awhile, I got a nose of yeast, clove, hops, & lemon zest. The taste is slightly sweet with a bit of malt, clove, light fruits, and a bit of spice. I pick up the ABV, only slightly. Medium bodied with a dry finish. Of the Tripples Ive sampled, not one I would revisit.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2016 Aroma van fruit en geroosterde noten. Koolzuur is zwaar aanwezig, een beetje te heftig. Smaak is fris met een zoetje, met een een rokerige afdronk, bitterheid in balans. Prachtige stevige kraag. #2 subtiel aroma van idd fruit, rokertje in snaak is meer kruidige pit van vers groen kruid met witte peper. Smaak plus 1.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2012 Re-rate 180912
Tried the big one and it is way more enjoyable than the smaller. Nice fresh hoppy notes of citrus and oranges. Longer aftertaste.

-----
An enjoyable tripel that is a good starter. Does have that extra ompf that Im looking for in a beer.licorice,

Hazy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, clove, hops, & citrus; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, fruit, spice, hops, and light citrus; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Overall, really good.

pours cloudy yellow/amber with a fantastic pillowy white head. aroma is sweet and yeasty, with caramel and some dark fruits. taste is surprisingly unsweetened. there are grassy, citrus notes, with strong hop/bitter presence throughout. unusual example of a tripel, but its good stuff.

Golden coppery  color with a huge stable white head. Complex aroma, caramel, spruce, spices and some slight banana. Spices and caramel at first taste giving way to a strong taste of alcohol and a somewhat bitter palate.  As seems to be a trend with Chimay beer, this one is also a little lopsided towards the first impressions, while leaving the end hanging a bit. Altogether a good beer though, and a nice example of the style.

Pours a murky golden amber color with a super thick head.  Aroma is of Belgian yeast, coriander, spice, orange, and banana.  Very carbonated palate.  Flavor is of citrus, yeast, grapes, spice, and flowers.   Leaves a citrus Belgian yeast finish.

Poured a hazy golden color.  Big frothy head.  Aroma of fruity notes and slight yeast flavors.  Med lite bitter, med lite sweetness.  This triple is more bitter than most of this style (in a good way). Medium bodied, frothy texture, above ave carbonation.  The head sticks around on this one.  Not my favorite chimay, but wouldnt pass it up if offered to me.  Has a spicier or peppery finish also.  Thanks Ryan.

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy copper with nearly white head that leaves a little lace. Bread and tropical fruit on the nose with a touch of spice. Tropical fruit dominate the palate with some sweetness and a floral note. Finishes with a light bitterness.
Very good, cloudy and noticeably unfiltered. Rather pleasing to the palate.

Original rating : april 2005 
Head: white, creamy , away fast 
Colour: blond, bit hazy 
Smell: hops, citric, yeasty, wheats 
Taste: start is yeasty, bitter, citric, hopy , then comes a somewhat flaw malty flavour in it with a dry end , after is a bit grassy, ok

Draft. Hazy honey in color and served with no head. A medium white head grows when the glass is swirled. Light fruit, dough, yeast, and soft cheese. Light sweet flavor of fruity esters and yeast. Good carbonation, light body, yeasty-sticky texture, and a bitter, crisp finish.

A yeasty, golden hued pour. Big white head that slowly dies down and leaves ample lacing behind. A slight citrusy aroma mixed with malt and yeast. A little carbonic and spicy. A dry sweetness in the mouthfeel. Citrus tartness and yeasty flavors round out the malt and phenols. This one has a little bit of age on it, but not much. Still pretty good.
UPDATED: JUL 9, 2012 Golden color with a fine head. Hops and yeast aroma, really nice. Fruity and citrus sweetness on the taste. Very good beer.

Pours a slightly hazy dark gold, with a foamy head that hangs about doggedly. Aroma is big and fruity, pineapple, candied citrus peel and touches of spice. Taste is loaded with pilsner malt sweetness, a mild pear type thing going on and a hit of spicy hop bitterness. Medium to full bodied, and really nice drinking.

The pour gave to a nice and hazy blonde body providing a one inch head. Smelled plenty of hops, yeast, honey and hints of clove. The taste was initially dry, but once it warms up you get richer flavors. Notes were bready, like sweet biscuits with a very faint but smooth fruitiness. Undertones of spicy malts and alcohol were present, which made this brew incredibly balanced.

Slightly hazy golden colour, firm white head. Aroma of malts and hops with Chimay yeast. Floral and fruity, spices, cloves and light pepper. Flavour is light malty sweet, medium hop bitterness, floral with a medium dry finish. Very agreeable. 
(Draught @ In den Spytighen Duvel, Turnhout)

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Opaque golden pour with a big, fluffy white head. Sweet spices and fruits mix with bubblegum and yeast on the nose. Sweet spices and belgian yeast run throughout the taste. Slightly sweet with the addition of heavier fruits in the taste as well. A little over carbonated. Quite a good tripel even though the style does nothing for me

Bottle:
To be honest I have drank this one of the Chimay cultus a bit lesser than the others.
And I find it to be the lesser of the three in taste and quality than the other two.
Still this is a good and decent beer. I am not going to review this beer due to the fact that many others have already done this before and that it is a while ago I had this one.
Yes, you might see this just as another tick But honestly it is for my own database. Beautiful that it counts as one more beer in the list Still this list is not even close to being complete.
Anyways, this is a good and decent beer with a nice aroma, looks, structure, taste, aftertaste, etc. What else would you expect from a real Trappist?!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: nice sweet malty aroma,amber, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, soft carbonation, light watery, nice soft finish.
golden pour, very fizzy.  nice fruity aroma.  well balanced taste. very tasty.
Bottle. Pours gold with a thick head. Has a yeasty scent with a strong belgian flavor. Chimay is an example of  great trappist brew..

Finalmente ho trovato la cinq cents, e con lei ho ritrovato il piacere di bere grandi birre belghe. maledetto palato che si abitua alla lana di vetro delle luppolature americane. questa birra invece la verseresti e rimarresti li a guardarla, nel suo bicchiere con quella maestosa schiuma e tutti gli esserini che ci sguazzano dentro. quando poi ti decidi che i soldi che hai speso erano finalizzati a berla e cominci a farlo, ti rendi conto ancor di più di come si possano fare grandi birre, equilibrate, fresche, profumate, complesse in un colpo solo. veramente unottima birra.

On tap at world of beers, a pretty dense triple, wish my bro matt was here to enjoy this amazing brew. Light body finishes malty when I would prefer a little bitter? Perhaps an aged keg? Top notch, monk power!

11.2 oz. bottle, 2008 vintage- Pours hazy orange with a thin bubbly white head. Aroma is bubblegum, very tart and acidic, Belgian yeast. The taste is again tart and acidic, vanilla, but there is an off note that the aroma didnt have, mostly in the aftertaste, hopefully this isnt past its prime. Carbonation is high, finish lingers and is somewhat bitter, not hoppy bitter, just bitter. This underwhelmed me, not bad, but I had higher expectations.

Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass deep golden, nice head. Spicy-strong aroma. Starts the same, spicy and strong. Also some fruity notes and a little salty touch. Finish still spicy, a bit alcoholic and moldy. Okay.
Tap.  Opaque gold pour with a big white head.  Aroma is sweet and fruity.  Taste is of sweetness, alcohol, and some bitter hops.  Body is medium to heavy.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2012 Tasted from bottle into tulip glass. Poured a beautiful golden color with some yeast haze and vigorous, firm white foam with great retention and Belgian lace. Aromas of pepper, clove, citrus zest, slight banana, some earthy, flowery late hops and a hint of alcohol. Flavors of subtle malt sweetness and hops bitterness, but the complexity is definitely from the yeast again: spicy esters, some more citrus fruit, slight apricot tang. Well-rounded, somewhat light mouthfeel, highly carbonated. Dry finish. Tiny fizzy bubbles from ongoing bottle fermentation. High alcohol percentage is very well hidden. Spicier than Chimay Red, another masterpiece.
Bottle from a sample pack. A very smooth drinking beer. Sweet flavor with some citrus, sour and pepper mixed in. Dry finish with a hint of bitterness. Tasty.
Bottle, pours gold-amber with thin head. A: bread, alcohol, fruity. malty. T: sweet. Well carbonated, medium body.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2011 Opaque golden, thin head.
Champagne smell, banana, fruity.
Banana, sour alcohol, dry peppery aftertaste.
Medium-thin, carbonated.
Really enjoyable.

75cl Bottle. Nice clear amber with a big white head. Head goes down but dont disappear. 
Nose : Hop freshness with some light notes of fruits like peach and apple. Honey aroma reveals sweetness of malt. 
Sip : Nice body with a fine carbonation that might get fluffy if poured gently. Malt goes out in a bearable sweetness of a typical tripple beer and ends up with a little pinch of bitterness. Its like a signal that weares off leaving a great harmony. After couple more sips I sense some little banana and pepper notes too which doesnt surprise me neither for this kind of beer. 
What I enjoy in it is mostly the richness of micro aromas that I could dig and dig but all that contained in an intelligent brew (read harmonious) and still refreshing. Its like Yoda of tripple beers.

Pours a nice golden-orange with a thin white head. Aroma is fruity and warm. Has a nice bite of alcohol, goes down relatively smooth. Overall an excellent ale. Definitely has that "brewed by monks" feel.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on October 9. Rather well chilled bottle overflowed the instant it was opened. Pours hazy golden with a huge white head that slowly dissipates leaving lots of traces on the glass. Smell is quite yeasty with bread and spices. Theres some alcohol and floral notes. Taste is sweet and pretty intense. It has a sweet yeasty character with spices and orange zest but also sports a prominent dry bitterness that dominates the finish. Not as sweet and one-dimensional as tripels sometimes can be, but instead quite complex and intriguing.
Pours pale golden. White head, which lingers quite a while. Sweet. Smell and taste of wheat and yeast. Some alcohol. Liked it.
Bottle in Chimay glass. Dark orange colour, nice off white head. Sweet aroma. Sweet and creamy flavour. A decent tripel.

Only slightly hazy with a pillowy white head that clings lovingly to the side of the glass. Only a hint of the BO character present in many Tripels, leans more toward lemon zest and older characters. The flavour is interestingly complex. Slightly sour with restrained carbonation and a long lingering sourness with lemon juice. In the short time that this beer has been poured it has developed a distinct citrus pith puckering note. 
I had a Dutch tripel not half an hour ago and it interests me how different they can be. More interesting to note, this one is about seventh on the Tripel overall list and the Dutch one isnt. Says it all really.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2014 Retasted it at moules&beer, lisbon. Color is orangy. Head is thin to medium. Body is smooth. Taste is medium bitter and light to medium sweet. A bit sticky. Aroma is caramel, herbs, spices, hops.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 Reviewed from notes (2007).

A: Hazy orange body with a sizable white head that clings to the glass.

S: Soft spices and a hint of yeast.

T: This is a balanced beer with some sweet and bitter tones. Its a refreshing beer, real crisp and clean malts.

S: Smooth and somewhat dry.. the alcohol tingles the tongue in the finish.

O: A classic

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2012 Notes of flowers, fruits, citrusy esters, and grains in the aroma. The taste is bitter, mainly dominated by floral notes, spices, and citrus peel, without much of an alcohol intrusion. The body is well-carbonated, not very heavy.
Smells of sickly malt, alcohol and Vicks Vapour Rub. Light gold colour. Tastes of alcohol, perfume, flowers, and more alcohol. Palate is prickly and dry. Not great frankly.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Slightly hazy, golden with a thick white lasting head. Aroma of yeast, orange, some pepper and bread. Lively carbonation and a creamy texture finishes off with a sweet bitterness.

A beer worthy of the 500th rating on this fine "Thirsty Thursday".

A - Bubble gum and musty, with alcohol undertones
A - Golden and hazy, with ample, dense and pillowy white head
T - Strong, but mellow alcohol, with light sugary sweet and bitter
P - Medium and soft
O - It is special...it works together almost perfectly

The Tripel craze continues! If you have not had the chance to try a tripel, you MUST! This brew poured up a hazy dark-orange colored body with an intensely creamy, foamy off-white colored head; long-lasting retention and lacing effects. Aromas of yeast, orange zest, cloves, and peppery spices. Flavors are quite complex and well-balanced with a very sweet-n-sour hit up front followed by a dry finish with light citrusy flavors lingering long afterwards. Loads of carbonation in the medium-bodied brew. Would pair this up with a slow-roasted pork rack or perhaps a slow-roasted rack of lamb.

33cl Bottle. Pours large white head with large bubbles which slowly diminishes. Colour is hazy caramel. Very attractive. Herbs, citrus and yeast aroma. A sweet initial taste which turns bitter with earthy notes.

This is easily one of my favorite beers.  Aroma is Belgian yeast, fruit and spice.  Taste is bread, banana, clove, citrus, and cinnamon.  Carbonation and hops provide a little bite in the finish.  Tremendous.
pours a silky yellow to orange with a fizzy white head. nose and taste of light grains, malt, yeast.

Chimay White (Cinq Cents) has a thick, off-white head and a hazy amber appearance with little lacing but lots of tiny suspended particles throughout. The aroma is of citrus (oranges?), bread, cinnamon, and some bread. Taste is of some citrus, wheat bread, cinamon, and a little hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium, and Chimay White finishes semi-dry and smooth. The aftertaste is spicy. Overall, this is excellent, and I highly recommend it. RJT

Bottle from Peckham & Rye, Hyndland......Golden beer, slight haze, massive rocky head with good lacing and retention.....Aroma of yeast, bread, spicy hops - the yeast has a superb aroma....Taste of bready yeast, bit of wheat, spicy perfumy hops, hint of pepper, sweet light malts, great complex flavour, well balanced....Lots of carbonation gives a good mouthfeel and carries the flavours well...Finish is bitter hops, dry, with a bready yeast tail. 
Overall...I quaffed this down, easy to drink as the alcohol is more hidden than I expected for a golden beer. Added all the yeast at the end which gives a stronger bitterness but the yeast has a superb flavour. Better than the Red and almost as good as the Blue which I didnt expect.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Snifter.

Appearance: Hazy orange that brightens considerably in the light. Massive foaming head at first that leaves bubbly legs.

Aroma: Banana, fleshy fruit, cloves, pepper, lemon and pretty strong (noble?) hops.

Taste: Very fruity and spicy. Lots of banana, lemon, peach, clove and pepper. Slightly sweet and earthy at first, and then turns more spicy and bitter, with pretty strong hops carrying through after each sip.

Palate: High carbonation, medium body but pretty effervescent, very dry finish.

Overall: A kick ass Tripel. I like them on the bitter and dry side, and this one more than delivers.

330ml bottle. Pours an effervescent, golden colour with a huge white head that settles down eventually. Aromas of fruity esters, alcohol, yeast and blueberries. Flavours of bananas, raisins, Belgian candi sugar and white pepper. Not too sweet. Nice peppery finish and a foamy mouth-feel. Heavily carbonated with a little CO2 prickle.

AROMA: floral, herbs, citrus, earthy
APPEARANCE: amber, clear, frothy, minimal head remains
TASTE: light sweetness to start with that slowly turns to intens bitterness
PALATE: full body, creamy, lively, bitter long aftertaste
OVERALL: beautifully balanced triple that is well up there with the top beers.

On tap.
A nice look with a hazy golden body. Almost no head (could be due to the tap), but the little head had a nice withe colour. Nice smell with maybe some hops in it. Sweet and fruity taste. And in the first sips I actually tasted butter and honey. Bitter hops in after-taste. A good beer that feels good in your mouth with a nice carbonation.
Bottle at Oud Arsenaal, Antwerp, Belguim august 2011. Golden amber, hazy medium head. Fruity aroma and taste with some hops. I like this beer.

Not a typical tripel, maybe... Pours golden with a HUGE white head. Smells of yeast, wheat malts, spices, a touch of fruit. Taste has more bitterness and less sweetness than what Im accustomed to with tripels. This is not a bad thing per se, it just doesnt seem very fitting. Its complex but perhaps not as balanced as I would have liked in that complexity. Still, obviously, a bloody good beer!
UPDATED: DEC 6, 2012 An excellent beer, the beer that convinced me about Belgians.  Floral head with a note of bitter hoppy aftertaste that lingers pleasantly.  Bottle in Canmore

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2012 0.33 Bottle. Deep orange color, lightly hazed. Massive off-white head, compact and incredibly stable, wow! Complex nose, fruity notes. Foam taste is fruity with strong bitterness. Aroma is dense and full, mostly fruity with some yeast, spices, strong wheat presence, some syrup as it warms up. High alcohol but no dramatic impact on aroma. Lively carbonation, full body. Taste starts sweet and finish into an aggressive strong and long bitterness where the massive amount of hops is on spot. Complex and strong, this is a bomb! Tends to be somewhat similar to an IPA.

golden, medium bitterness, medium body, 
Bottled. Really good beer. Aroma of fruits. Easily available. Quite the same comments that for the other two Chimay.

n honungsgul trippel med högt skum som sakta lägger sig. Typiskt estrig doft med pomerans och jäst. Smaken är kraftig och alkholen värmer, men snart stramar munnen åt sig p g a av den för stilen rejäla beskan och den förväntade sötmans frånvaro. Istället är den rejält torr, lite jästbesk och med mycket humlebeska från den gräsigt oljiga humlen. Jag som ofta tycker tripplar är för söta om de inte fått ligga något år gillar det här skarpt.

Appearance is medium white head with an amber orange haze. Aroma is strong blend of wheat, citrus, and hint of earthy hops. Taste hits with a near perfect blend  of wheat citrus and hops with just enough bitterness. Overall a very enjoyable one.

A good brew
Nose is fruity and malty specifically pineapple and some dark fruits
Flavor has a sweet beginning followed by a sweet, malty and slightly alcoholic ending
Medium mouthfeel with light carbonation

Yum!

Ooo the second of the chimays!  Nice pop to the cork with this one.  Hazy yellow color to this one.  White fritzy head.  I smell yeast!  Some carbonation and maybe some bananas.  Has some hops in the aroma as well.  Pretty interesting smell.  Taste is more bitter than I would have expected.  Tastes fairly carbonated with some nice honey flavors near the beginning.  Alcohol is slightly present in the aftertaste.  Pretty delicious beer.

Pours brown/orange with big fluffy white head. Nose is surprisingly subtle. Bit of yeast, apple, grape, touch of citrous. Taste is yeast, malt, grape. Not really as good as I expected and not as pungent or flavoursome as Chimay Red or Blue. Ive had much better Tripels.

Brown, light filtered body with bold off-white head. Wheat, light yeast, apple; kind of disappointing really. Taste is much more pronounced, exactly as I like a tripel. Light sweet with a pleasant bitter finish. Oily mouthfeel. Light alcohol burn. Very smooth body, dangerously easy to drink even with the sweet start. A great beer of real highs and lows. (33cl bottle, 1,80 EUR)

Birra che riesce nelllimpresa di rendere in equilibrio ed armonia elementi tra loro contrastanti; alcol al naso insieme al luppolo e ai malti, al palato e amara e leggermente acidula e sfuma in un equilibrato finale fruttato.
Its fine, but Im not sure whats the bee eff dee with this one.  Breakfast, anyone?

Bottle from Csakajosor.hu. Poured golden yellow with a nice, quick to disappear white head. Aroma of honey, vanilla, grapes, apple, coriander, cinnamon, and yeast. Somewhat musty. Medium dense with lots of carbonation. Sweet, caramelish taste, pleasant, somewhat dry, vinous finish. Really good!

Golden hazy pour orange hue lots of sticky white soapy head ... aroma of floral and a bit herbal hops along with fruity yeast/light grape ..... taste is of bitter floral and light citrusy hops smooth and soft carbonation citrusy and fruity grapes on the tongue with a slight bitter/pepper on the tongue that lingers into the finish .... a smooth brew loved it no trace of the abv

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2011 A true work of art!  Goblet, on draft.  Golden pour under an off-white head.  Subtle hops behind a thick, sweet, sticky palate.  And flavor that kept building, sip after sip.  Was still tasting it long after, and thats a good thing!  My first foray into that kind of top-shelf offering, quite impressed!

0,33 bottle. big, soft and off-white foam over dark golden hazy liquid with suspended yeasts. intense aroma, sweet, banana and vanilla. fresh and malty taste with some fruitness, bitter and dry final. good body sustained with the right carbonation. normally I dont like tripels because of their metallic taste, but this one is very good!
Hazy golden orange pour with fluffy white head. Aroma of banana and candied fruit. Taste is dry with a slight malty hop bitterness. Good beer.
Light golden beer with perfect lacy head. smells like candies bananas. taste so light refreshing and crisp. little sweet kinda a hint of fruit sugar.

33 cl bottle, #L09-582, BBE 2012
Fresh aroma has citrus, flowers and hints of toffee. Flavour is a bit spicy, it has flowers and hints of citrus. Some peppery spices do also appear. I feel lots of CO2 hitting my tongue. Good triple, pairs well with a hot summer day.
UPDATED: JUL 3, 2012 Rerating 3.7.2012: Malty, peppery smell. Cloudy amber colour, small beige head. Aroma of alcohol and overripe fruit and pepper. Aftertaste of herbs and hops.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2011 Pours gold with a nice balanced foam. Its taste is incredible, a bit alcohol a bit hops and very well blended with vanilla. It has the most brilliant smell and you can feel it tingle your mouth. One of the best beers Ive tried and perhaps even my favorite Trappist till now. On lower temperatures it also shows a surprising taste of dough.
draft.  I cant believe ive never rated this?  Sweet somewhat floral nose.  Pours gold with thick white head.  Smooth sweet malt a little floral with a spicy finish, finishes dry.

Bottle 33 cl. Poured sligtly cloudy goldenorange in colour with light tan head. Yeast, fruity and sweet aroma. Very pleasant combination, perhaps one could say that there are also some spices present. Wheat and some grassy bitterness in flavour. Aftertaste quite grassy bitter. Taste is quite filling and good otherwise, but just a bit too bitter finish.
Draught @ Kaisla, Helsinki. Originally rated on 7.6.2010. Well balanced, classic tripel with notes of spices and yeast.

Bottle. Hazy bright orange with a fluffy white head that leaves some chunky lacing.  Lots of yeastiness, citrus, spice, vanilla, and a touch of sweetness and peppery alcohol.  Nearly leans too sweet at some points, with pear, fruitiness, chalky yeast, spice, and a warming vanilla-like finish.  Lighter to medium body with spritzy carbonation.  Always good.
Beautiful taste! well-hopped for a Belgian beer, with that lovely Belgian flavor that is difficult to characterize. Hard to describe, except that its a wonderful beer. fills the mouth.
Draught.  Golden hazy with medium white head. Yeasty aroma.  Full bodied, grapey and malty.  Some hop in the finish, with more fruitiness.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text:
A: The pour is a hazed golden-orange color with a fluffy off-white head. 

S: Spices really shine through on this beer.  Lots of coriander, and nutmeg.  Theres a lot of malt character, especially bread, with a little bit of biscuit.  Some nice fruit notes of banana and orange.

T: Much the same story on the palate.  There is a more pronounced citrus (orange) flavor and perhaps a bit more banana.  Nicely sweet with plenty of bread and yeast.  Good spiciness all the way around as well.

M: Medium bodied with a medium to high carbonation.

O: You cant really go wrong with a Chimay beer.  Just great stuff.
Typical standard clear golden tripel color. Not the best smell, but a nice bitter taste. Very good palate, medium to full body, firm but nice carbonation.
Pale weisse beer, much tasty, no much expensive, easy to reach. This is cerveza!
bottle, yellow coloured with nice and foamy white head. Smell: very hoppy, some grassy notes. Taste: nice hops, alcohol, some fruity notes. Nice tripel!

AROMA: subtle fruit hints

APPEARANCE: cloudy golden color with a thick white head

TASTE: slightly sweet, slightly bitter

PALATE: lively notes; smooth, creamy finish

Ködös aranysárga. Beige hab. Már illatában is bemutatkozik az erős szesz valamint malátás, gyömölcsös szőlő buké.
Íze kukoricás, korianderes kevés citrom. Szénsavas komlós befejezés. Tartósan marad a nyelven. Nem édes. 
Jóó.
UPDATED: JUL 5, 2011 This one scored pretty much the average score. Not the best triple ive ever had.

Big yeasty, doughy, spicy nose. Glorious nose. I could smell this beer all day. Pours amber from bottle with a big white head. Medium mouthfeel. The taste? Theres a touch of sweetness but baking spices as well. Well crafted, this beer hides its 8% well. Finishes clean. What a pleasure!

Mild prickelnder Antrunk, würzige Andeutung, getreidiger Hintergrund. Hopfig-malzig werdend, etwas intensiver, im Mittelteil würzig, etwas champagnerartig. Im Abgang etwas lascher, weniger malzig, trocken, etwas hopfig. Könnte aromatischer sein. 	 
Test vom 13.8.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 11,8,8,8,8,8 - 8,30

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2015 At publicisdrugstore in paris, .33l btl. Hazy yellow amber color with massive white head, lots of sediment. Sharp carbonation, quicker finish. hop nose, lemonpeel aroma that is pleasant in the aftertaste. 7/5/8/3/16 Re-rate, 12/30/15: Been a while since I had this. Back then, I was 4 months into my beer journey, a sucker for classic hype beers, and generally just excited to find a decent rateable craft beer while I was overseas. Seems like Im due for a revisit. 750ml bottle, from Dutchs. Cork is dated 2014. Enjoyed from my Chimay Goblet. Mostly clear orange color. Hazy in later pour, with some dark sediment at the bottom. Bigger, finger.5 white head, kind of foamy, retains well. Leaves nice splotches of lace. Really does look great. Flavor is mild and uninteresting, though. Just kind of bready, kind of spicy, peppery, mildly musty, not really much else to it. Just a touch of funk. Mild paperiness. Drinks like a slightly rough saison, with a little more malt sweetness. Not much in the way of fruity ester or complexity sadly. Bigger sweet taste, light to moderate bitter. Dry finish, very mild warmth on the finish. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of soft, light carbonation. Touch of roughness to the texture, overly dry maybe. A touch of orchard fruit comes out later. Just disappointing. Why is the added sugar necessary? It feels a little noticeable. Maybe its better fresh? I doubt it. I think this is just what you get when you mass-produce and rely on "trappist" marketing for sales. Why are we even getting 2014 bottles in mid-late 2015?

Bottle. Cloudy orange with sediments and a big, creamy white head. Sweet nose is characterised by yeasty spiciness and coriander. Sweet and spicy flavours, coriander together with banana and clove, good bitterness, giving a dry finish. Full-bodied with warming alcohol. It may have become diluted and commercialised recently, but it is still a great beer.

Brilliant gold with white head, lots of carbonation and some floating sediment.  Aroma - green apple & grassy hops.  Taste - cereal grains, yeast, hay, earthy hops and soap.  Also lesser notes of banana and floral honey.  Creamy texture.  Ive never loved tripels but this is prettty good.

33cl bottle from the LCBO. Havent had this in a while and picked up a bottle just for kicks. Cloudy pale yellow with a huge white head, fades to a decent covering. Great belgian yeast aroma, some lemon, grapefruit, booze, grains; very balanced taste, hides the alcohol well, but a little thin. Starts slightly sweet and fades to bitter, dry on the palate with some hops, but the finish is one dimensional and too simple to be a great beer (especially when compared to the blue) but still good.

Bottle from market street.  Pours a cloudy dull yellow with a thin white head.  The aromas are leather, lemon zest, dough.  The mouthfeel is sticky, lively carbonated and slightly dry with a heavy body.  Cheers!
I wasnt a huge fan of this.  Too much alcohol upfront and it had an odd taste like bananas.  This seems to be a very well liked beer and Im hoping it wasnt just the bottle that I had.

Das Chimay Triple verkoste ich aus der 0,75 l-Flasche mit Champagner-Korken. 
Trüb-goldene Farbe, hefig-fruchtig im Geruch. 
Geschmack fruchtig mit nussigen Aromen, aber auch unerwartet herb. 
Gelungenes Triple, das ich allerdings in einer noch recht frischen Version trank. 
Wäre einen Nachtest im abgelagertem Zustand wert.Test vom 26.12.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Mellow aroma for a tripel. I, personally, think of this more as a "blonde" than a "tripel." But thats just me. Very pleasant, balanced aroma... not too sweet, not too malty.

Pours a dark golden color with a solid one inch head. Essence of the head lingers through the entire drink. Moderately hazy, somewhere between a Wheat Beer and a Westy Blonde.

Pleasant upfront taste. More bitter than other tripels but in a nice way. Solid taste on the back of the tongue with no lingering bitterness. Great mix of sweet and bitter.

Average carbonation, smooth texture, medium/light bodied with a delightful finish.

Overall I love this. Its my second favorite Blonde Belgian.

[330ml bottle, The Bottle, York] Deep pale golden pour with a peaky white head. Lovely aroma of creamy banana and walnuts. High levels of carbonation throughout. Wheaty, yeasty background with hops and lemon citrus taking the forefront. Rising sweetness on the palate before the fruity banana flavours come out on the aftertaste, together with a warming alcohol finish [23052008]

And again does Chimay not disappoint me. Pours out golden coloured with a nice, big, longlasting white head. Aroma has citrus, barley malts and some alcohol. Flavour is rich and complex, showing a perfect balance between sweet and bitterness. Last long in your mouth. Great one. Luckliy I still got one bottle left.
On tap -  pours dark orange with rich white head. Has a hoppy character to it and tastes sweet.  Has a long finish. Very tasty and quite enjoyable. Could use a little aroma.
Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma is malt, almond, fruit and light grass. Flavour is malt, alcohol, almond, fruit and light grass.

Ive had many bottle of this from Carrefour, and they were terrible. 

But I had it from the tap at Académie De La Bière, and it was great.  Very, very tasty beer. opaque orangey golden color and just a hint of too much alcohol, and almost bitter enough. 

 Its a waste of time to drink this out of the bottle, at least if youre getting it at the Carrefours I shop at.  But on tap, it is just great.
How can you complain about this? Absolutely amazing in everyway. Perfectly balanced. Tons of depth and interest. Beautiful pour. Finishes dry and perfect. Love it.
golden colour with great big head. aromas of hops, yeast, raisins, gorgonzola. hoppy flavour with dry, bitter finish.

The pour was a medium brown color with an off-white head. The aroma was bread and yeast-like, with some spices. The flavor was also somewhat bready, and it contained some spices and distinct Belgium yeast. Overall an excellent beer.

Purchased at Golden Leaf in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home on one of those odd May days where it starts out in the mid-70s then goes down to the low-40s within a couple of hours span.  I needed an expensive beer after experiencing that!  Appearance a very cloudy orange haze with a rich, frothy white head in a Delirium Tremens glass.  Aroma nice but faint, of Belgian yeast and a hint of clove, cant really get any hops in the nose.  Taste is very smooth, fantastic mouthfeel thats well balanced between a slight bitterness and the slight creaminess from the yeast.  There really is no aftertaste, if anything that touch of bitterness.  And, being an 8% ABV this is very light.  Nice work, Belgians.

On tap at matchbox on rockville.  Freakin delicious.  Incredibly smooth, thats the thing I noticed most.  Pours off white with a sizable white head, strong lacing.  Nose and palate is smooth sweet fruit.  Belgian yeast doing its work!  Very refreshing for a tripel, and not too heavy.  Finishes with a  touch of hops and no aftertaste.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2017 Pours hazy yellow with a creamy, lasting head. Aroma is bitter malts and some alcohol. Flavor is bitter malts, alcohol and hops. Quite different than the other Chimays but nice.
Re-rate from a bottle. More fruits in the aroma. Very good tripel.

May 10, 2011; 750ml bottle sampled in Trappist glass.  Cloudy amber pour with sediment settling at the bottom and a pillowy-yet-creamy head that lasts til the end of the glass.  Cider/lemon aroma.  Pleasantly-sour citrus notes; some noticeable alcohol and a minor explosion of other things I cant identify.  Superb balance.  Chewy and complex. A slightly-astringent bitterness and fruit flavors dance on the tongue long after the swig.  Im not particularly comfortable rating tripels, but its difficult to find anything at all "wrong" with this brew -- Chimay has made a fan of me.

330ml bottle from Stirchley Beer and Wines. Pours a cloudy woody amber colour with a bubbley white head. Aroma of citrus fruits, banana, bread and grass. Flavour is the same with bright floral hops. Soft, yet lively carbonation. Slightly dry finish on the back of the tongue. Very pleasant and refreshing.

750ml bottle.
Golden orange brew with a thick, lasting white head.  Aromas of bready malts, candi sugar, and fresh cut grass.  Bit of an herbal hop bite with some spices.  Just great.

A nice bready aroma! Poured golden yellow cloudy, lots of white head, that disappeared to lacing on the glass quickly. A strong beer the alcohol was quite noticeable above the warm bread feel in the mouth. a drying finish that leaves you wanting that next sip.

Had a nice head,which lasted a long time.Nice lacings.I didnt smell much of an aroma.citrus smell a bit.It went down smooth.hoppy and somewhat bitter finish.Wheat ,grapefruit,.color is chestnut.Had 8% alcohol ,which is more than your typical beer.Had a bit of dead yeast sediment on bottom of bottle.Overall I really like this beer.Will definately buy again!!
Bottle 0,33ltr: Hazy orange coloured with an fruity/orange sharp taste, and a quite good bitter aftertaste. Just one great tripels in the world.

March 28, 2011; 330mL Chimay brown bottle, refrigerated, BBD: End/13
Aroma is quite weak from what I heard but floral notes and citrus comes through. [served too cold? though served in Trappist style glass.] Pours a cloudy, bottle-conditioned, deep golden-amber colour. Generous off-white head that sits throughout the entire drink, almost meringue-like. Nice lace on glass. Citrus fruits again with some spice and yeast. Some hints of licorice and unidentifiable spice. Bitter aftertaste that lingers from the hops but not too overpowering. 

As far as I know, this is my first Abbey Triple, so I didnt know what to expect.

Pours a nice cloudy golden colour with a tall frothy white head which gives magnificent lacing. Aroma is quite fruity with some hops and malt. Taste is sweetish fruit and hints of caramel followed by a nice hoppy finish that lasts. Really enjoyable.

on tap at the Doerak, Delft.
Decent white head.  Hazy golden blond colour.  A decent triple

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2011 Appearance: Bottle into Chimay trappist glass. Pours a cloudy, bright amber with a massive, foaming, bright white head (again!). Theres quite a bit of lacing on the glass too.

Aroma: Fruity - apples, banana, grapes and bubblegum. Herby and floral...light smelling, almost delicate. Strong smell of hops and yeast. Cinnamon and spices as well. Really reminds me of the Westmalle Tripel, and the Schneider Hefe-weizen.

Taste: Apples, caramel, honey, and grape with a hoppy and boozy finish. 

Palate: Crisp and refreshing with the perfect balance of sweet and bitter with a dry finish. Not as thin as you would think. This is fucking fantastic.

Overall: I love this beer, probably my favorite Chimay. Its just good; I find myself picking that glass up and drinking it a little too easily.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2012 Cloudy orange body with a huge white head. Yeasty aroma with cereal, lots of caramel, orange and other fruits. Full mouthfeel, bittersweet flavour. Great. (8/5/8/5/18) Cloudy orange body with a huge white head. Awesome yeasty sweet aroma with spices, orange, caramel, and other fruits. Full, fully carbonated body. Bittersweet flavour with grapefruit, orange, caramel. A great tripel.

Bottle. Pours a murky, orange-brown with medium khaki head. Big sugar and candy in the aroma. Some spice and grassy hops. Flavor of caramel and pastry, with big raisin and brown sugar. Some spice and breads as well.

From a 33cl bottle from Picks Liquors poured into my Chimay Trappist glass. Pours a golden-orange with a thick white head. There is so much yeast that not only is the beer cloudy, but you can actually see the yeast chunks floating in it. Smell is bready, like pizza dough with a slightly sweet smell. The taste is much more bitter than the blue(which I just finished). Very dark flavored, like coffee, and very earthy. Medium bitter and lightly sour. Its full bodied and thick, with fizzy carbonation. This finish is slightly bitter and stops abruptly. Overall, Ill give this beer an A-. Its pretty good but at around 6 bucks for a 33cl its not something I could drink everyday. There are much better beers with much lower price tags.

ottima trappista,forse quella che preferisco nella sua "semplicità"
decisamente fruttata al naso,ma una volta bevuta,si esalta nel suo agrumato delicato e persistente,ma anche decisamente amarognola nel retrogusto.....ottima!

75cl bottle from a beer retailer. It pours a hazy deep golden/amber liquid with little yeast particles everywhere and a precious and huge not-entirely-white pillowy head that lasts throughout the beer and leaves some lacing. One of the best-looking pale beers. The aroma is extremely complex, with hints of green grapes (muscat) , citron (both lemon and orange), grassy and floral hops, loads of yeast, raisins, and a very nice malty base, with some distant notes of coffee. I can even smell a little pineapple and strawberries when it has settled for a while. The flavour is very strong: muscat and citron, dough, grassy hops and a notorious honey/caramel maltiness that compensates deliciously the general hoppiness of this brew. It is somehow sweet, with a very nicely scented palate and both lively and softly carbonated. It finishes dry, leaving a very bitter aftertaste, with grassy and floral hops. I might be obsessed with Chimay, but I cant find any flaws in this beer. Presentation is smart and appropriate for a trappist beer.

Served from a 750mL bottle into a tulip with Thanksgiving dinner 2010.

Pours a dark peach color with a two-finger white head that doesnt have the best static power and doesnt leave around as much lacing as would be expected. The nose has some sligt booze with some banana, caramel, stone fruits, and general yeasty esters.

The taste is slightly sweet with a bit of malt, banana, light fruits, and a bit of spice. There is some alcohol there as well. Medium bodied with somewhat low levels of carbonation. Drinks fairly well, but is probably my least favorite of the Chimay trio.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-25-2010
Draft. Fruity notes of muscat and raisins giving it a great aroma. Awesome beer which we already knew

Bottle. Innisfil, Ontario, Canada.
Fantastic beer, and a good abbey tripel. Great carbonation, huge head, lasts forever. Great start. Very dark golden hue. Excellent nose; floral, honey, some hops, possibly some raisins. Very nice, smooth taste. Excellent, in fact. A little buttery, with a hop backend, excellent bitter finish. Excellent beer, cant wait to have this in Belgium (and everything else I can find!)

This is a close 2nd or tied for 1st for my favorite chimay beer. I enjoy this because of the aroma mainly with the delicious yeast swell you get. It seems lighter than the other two chimay beer, it that is what makes this so drinkable.

0.75 L bottle from "beers and more" in Nicosia, for the price of 5.50euro.
Golden-orange colour, not clear at all.
almost no foam and after few seconds, any foam is gone for good.
Diffculut to smell it. For sure yeast...
Fizzy taste...that leads to a smooth bitterness...
Its one of the best tripel I ever had.
Strong in alcohol but easy to drink.

0.33L bottle in Brussels. Pours a hazy golden orange with a fizzy white head. Smells of yeast, spice, an orange rind. Good carbonation that leads to a very fine mouthfeel. Taste is quite good: an intense shock of flavor balanced between spice, alcohol, yeast, and honey that slowly wanes in to a subtle finish that completely masks the alcohol content. Excellent. Perhaps a bit conservative, but it works well here.

This beer has tons of carbonation. I pop the top and it fizzes everywhere. When you pour it comes with a huge off white head with great retention. The beer itself is a very cloudy dark gold. Lacing is nice its stick nice and chunky. Lacing like a spiderweb. The head lasts at least five minutes.

The aroma is your typical tripel, nothing to distinguish it from any other tripel. The big notes are flowers, light hops, and honey. 

The taste is light but complex with lots of flavors. It starts sweet, there is little bit of honey, and there is a bitter end where you taste some sweet hops.

The mouthfeel is pretty good, sticky for a few seconds after you swallow.

This is pretty drinkable, could drink a lot of it. Pretty good beer, but Ive had better tripels.

33cl bottle poured into a goblet.  The beer has aromas of fruity yeasts with some funkiness.  The beer pours a golden color and is cloudy from the bottle conditioned yeasts.  An ample white head is on top but fades rather quickly.  Taste is not overly sweet which for a trippel, I am surprised.  The bittering hops really lend a perfect balance and there is a great mouthfeel on this one.  Good carbonation and a medium body make it very drinkable.  Overall, this is a great trippel, and one that I would recommend to anyone.
Clear dark golden with a white head. Aroma is dry, malty, fruity, yeasty, spicy and hoppy. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Quite dry finish. 230311

750 mL bottle in a trappiste glass.  Hazy orange pour with medium white head.  Aromas of orange and spices similar to a strong hefe.  Very well balanced and full of flavor.  Sweet and a little spicy.  I like Fin du Monde better though.  Still an excellent beer.
